002-001.text: One’s-self I sing, a simple separate person,Yet utter the word Democratic, the word En-Masse.
caption: An individual standing tall amidst a large crowd, symbolizing democracy and togetherness.
A person standing alone in a field, but surrounded by a large crowd of diverse people, symbolizing both individuality and democracy.
In a minimalist style, a portrait of a person standing alone, with a bold banner in the background that reads "DEMOCRATIC" and "EN-MASSE".

002-002.text: Of physiology from top to toe I sing,Not physiognomy alone nor brain alone is worthy for the Muse, I saythe Form complete is worthier far,The Female equally with the Male I sing.
caption: The image depicts an entire human body without any distinguishing facial features or focus on the brain. The focus is on celebrating the entire form of both males and females.

A portrait of a human body, showing all its physical aspects from head to toe. The focus is not only on the face or the brain, as the whole form is being celebrated as worthy of the Muse. The portrait includes both male and female forms, as they are equally important in this depiction.

This picture has a surrealistic style. It shows an androgynous figure in a vibrant pose. The figure's body is outlined with neon colors radiating from the figure's head to toes. The focus is on the form, which looks complete and awe-inspiring. The androgynous figure looks like it is both female and male, depicting gender equality.

002-003.text: Of Life immense in passion, pulse, and power,Cheerful, for freest action form’d under the laws divine,The Modern Man I sing.
caption: A vibrant figure with dynamic energy, reflecting the powerful and passionate force of life. This figure is exuding a sense of joy and freedom, moving with ease and grace within the boundaries set forth by divine laws. This is a depiction of the Modern Man.
A picture of a modern man with a passionate and powerful aura, embodying freedom of action under divine laws.

Photorealistic portrait of a confident, strong and energetic-looking man. His features reflect immense passion, pulse, and power. He stands in a dynamic pose, symbolizing his love for freest action and mastery of laws divine that guide him. The picture evokes a sense of hope and optimism, reflecting the spirit of the Modern Man.

003-001.text: As I ponder’d in silence,Returning upon my poems, considering, lingering long,A Phantom arose before me with distrustful aspect,Terrible in beauty, age, and power,The genius of poets of old lands,As to me directing like flame its eyes,With finger pointing to many immortal songs,And menacing voice, What singest thou? it said,Know’st thou not there is but one theme for ever-enduring bards?And that is the theme of War, the fortune of battles,The making of perfect soldiers.
caption: An old, powerful and frightening phantom appears before a poet. The phantom is pointing at a collection of immortal songs and asks the poet what he is singing about. The phantom states that the only theme for enduring poets is the subject of war, battles and creating perfect soldiers.

A person sitting in deep thought, surrounded by their written poetry. Suddenly, a ghost-like figure appears before them, emanating a mix of frightful beauty and terrifying power. This figure is the genius that inspired the poets of old lands. It stares at the person with fiery eyes, with a pointing finger directing their attention to various immortal songs. It speaks with a menacing voice, asking the person what they sing about. The figure reminds the person that the only everlasting theme for poets is war- the fate of battles and the creation of perfect soldiers.

Surrealist. A figure with a monstrous appearance, with a mix of beauty and terror. It points an accusatory finger with its eyes blazing, as if questioning the purpose of writing. In the background are images of wars and battles of the past, representing the recurring immeasurability of the theme of war that is impossible to escape.

003-002.text: Be it so, then I answer’d,I too haughty Shade also sing war, and a longer and greater one than any,Waged in my book with varying fortune, with flight, advanceand retreat, victory deferr’d and wavering,(Yet methinks certain, or as good as certain, at the last,) thefield the world,For life and death, for the Body and for the eternal Soul,Lo, I too am come, chanting the chant of battles,I above all promote brave soldiers.
caption: In the foreground, a group of soldiers preparing for battle. In the background, the vast expanse of the world. A somber tone of both death and life lingers in the air. The soldiers stand courageous, ready to fight for both their physical and spiritual beings. The viewer knows that victory is uncertain, but the soldiers stand tall and resolute.

A heavily armored warrior stands in a battlefield with a book in one hand and a sword in the other. The battle is intense with fighters charging forward and retreating. The warrior's face is determined as they chant the song of war, promoting the bravery of their fellow soldiers for the sake of life, death, body and eternal soul.

The visual style is expressive, and the image depicts a battlefield with countless soldiers engaged in a relentless conflict. The soldiers are portrayed with bravery and courage, fiercely fighting for their lives and the souls of humanity. The scene is chaotic, with soldiers advancing and retreating, and the outcome uncertain, but their unbreakable spirit and determination can be felt through the image.

004-001.text: In cabin’d ships at sea,The boundless blue on every side expanding,With whistling winds and music of the waves, the large imperious waves,Or some lone bark buoy’d on the dense marine,Where joyous full of faith, spreading white sails,She cleaves the ether mid the sparkle and the foam of day, or undermany a star at night,By sailors young and old haply will I, a reminiscence of the land, be read,In full rapport at last.
caption: A ship in the middle of the expansive blue sea, with the wind blowing and waves crashing against the hull. The ship could either be a large vessel with majestic sails or a smaller one with just one person aboard, journeying through the sparkling waves during the day or under a starry night. The image suggests the ship represents a memory of the land, which will be remembered by sailors young and old, as they navigate the ocean.

A painting of a ship on the vast sea. Large waves crashing against the hull, with the wind howling and the sound of the waves. A lone vessel traveling through the day and night, with sailors of all ages aboard, seeking adventure, and a sense of longing to be in touch with the land they left behind.

Realism. A painting of a ship at sea, surrounded by boundless blue water on every side. The wind whistles and the waves sing with music. The ship battles large, imperious waves, while a lone bark floats atop the dense marine. Joyfully and full of faith, the ship spreads white sails and cleaves through the shining foam of day or under the shining stars at night. Sailors young and old read a reminiscence of the land, which is conveyed through a painting, in full rapport at last.

004-002.text: Here are our thoughts, voyagers’ thoughts,Here not the land, firm land, alone appears, may then by them be said,The sky o’erarches here, we feel the undulating deck beneath our feet,We feel the long pulsation, ebb and flow of endless motion,The tones of unseen mystery, the vague and vast suggestions of thebriny world, the liquid-flowing syllables,The perfume, the faint creaking of the cordage, the melancholy rhythm,The boundless vista and the horizon far and dim are all here,And this is ocean’s poem.
caption: A painting depicting a ship at sea. The sky above is vast and blue. The ship is pitched up and down on the waves. The water is a deep navy color and you can sense the endless motion of the sea. There is a hint of salt in the air and the sounds of the ship creaking and the waves splashing can be heard. The horizon is visible in the distance, vast and all-encompassing. The painting is the embodiment of the ocean's poetry.

A breathtaking seascape depicting a ship's deck on the ocean with vast endless horizons. The image conveys rhythmic undulation and the pulse of the waves. The sounds of the sea and its mysteries are evident through the vibrations felt under foot, the creaking of the cordage and the mystical suggestions of the briny world. The picture emanates a melancholy rhythm amidst the vague and vast vista, where ocean reveals its depth and majesty.

The painting is abstract, with a mix of cool colors representing the ocean, accents of white representing the deck and the sky, and a flurry of brushstrokes to symbolize the motion of the ship. In the center, an array of shapes and lines create a sense of rhythm and musicality. The painting suggests the feeling of vastness and limitless exploration, capturing the essence of being a voyager at sea.

004-003.text: Then falter not O book, fulfil your destiny,You not a reminiscence of the land alone,You too as a lone bark cleaving the ether, purpos’d I know notwhither, yet ever full of faith,Consort to every ship that sails, sail you!Bear forth to them folded my love, (dear mariners, for you I fold ithere in every leaf;)Speed on my book! spread your white sails my little bark athwart theimperious waves,Chant on, sail on, bear o’er the boundless blue from me to every sea,This song for mariners and all their ships.
caption: The image shows an open book floating in the sky like a small boat. The book is on a mission, not knowing its destination, but always keeping faith. It becomes a companion to every ship that sails the seas, carrying with it the author's love for all those who sail. The book braves the vast ocean, travelling from sea to sea, singing its song for all mariners and their ships.

A picture of a lone boat sailing among the vast blue sea. The book is the same as the boat and both have a purpose they are not sure of, but they carry love and faith with them. The boat sails alongside other ships and shares its love with them as it crosses the boundless ocean.

A painting in the style of impressionism. A small boat sailing through the open ocean with vast blue skies above. The boat carries a book, which is its sole passenger, drifting aimlessly but with unwavering conviction. The book, folded in every leaf, is filled with love and the hopes of the person who sent it off across the endless waves. The painting depicts the open sea as a place of possibility and adventure. It invokes the spirit of discovery and encourages all sailors to join in, as they navigate the boundless oceans, finding hidden treasures along the way, with the book as a constant companion.

005-001.text: I heard that you ask’d for something to prove this puzzle the New World,And to define America, her athletic Democracy,Therefore I send you my poems that you behold in them what you wanted.
caption: A person holding a book of poetry towards another person, with the gesture of presenting it as a gift. The gift is meant to clarify and give proof of the mystical concept of democracy that the new world represents.
A person is presenting a collection of poems that represents the essence of America's vibrant and robust democracy to someone who had requested to understand the country better.

Photorealistic. A towering, muscular American bald eagle, mid-flight over a tranquil landscape, with the sun setting behind it. In the eagle's talons is a scroll, upon which is written indistinguishable text, the poems mentioned in the stanza.

006-001.text: You who celebrate bygones,Who have explored the outward, the surfaces of the races, the lifethat has exhibited itself,Who have treated of man as the creature of politics, aggregates,rulers and priests,I, habitan of the Alleghanies, treating of him as he is in himselfin his own rights,Pressing the pulse of the life that has seldom exhibited itself,(the great pride of man in himself,)Chanter of Personality, outlining what is yet to be,I project the history of the future.
caption: A portrait of a contemplative figure, set against a backdrop of mountains and valleys. The figure is not concerned with the external trappings of politics or religion, but is instead focused on the innermost qualities of humanity. The portrait hints at a hopeful view of the future, one in which individual personalities come to the fore and shape the course of history.
A figure standing on a high mountaintop, looking out across a vast landscape. This person sees the world as it truly is and looks towards the future with a determined gaze.

The picture is in an impressionistic style. A person standing on a mountain, overlooking a vast, green valley. The person is pointing towards the horizon triumphantly. The landscape and the person's body language suggest that they are envisioning future possibilities and potential.

007-001.text: To thee old cause!Thou peerless, passionate, good cause,Thou stern, remorseless, sweet idea,Deathless throughout the ages, races, lands,After a strange sad war, great war for thee,(I think all war through time was really fought, and ever will bereally fought, for thee,)These chants for thee, the eternal march of thee.
caption: A person standing tall and resolute with an expression of determination and passion on their face. The backdrop shows a battlefield with defeated soldiers lying on the ground. The person is holding a banner with the symbol of the cause they believe in. The image exudes a sense of endurance, as if the cause has been fought for over many generations and will continue to be fought for in the future.

A powerful image of a cause that is celebrated and revered throughout time and space. The cause is symbolized by an indestructible, passionate and stern idea that has survived numerous battles waged in its honor. To commemorate this cause, a great war was fought and countless eternal chants were sung in its name.

The picture is in the Monumentalist style. It shows a towering, imposing statue with a peaceful expression on its face. In the background, there are vague, indistinct images of soldiers fighting in a war. Despite the chaos, the statue remains a symbol of hope and perseverance.

007-002.text: (A war O soldiers not for itself alone,Far, far more stood silently waiting behind, now to advance in this book.)
caption: A group of soldiers looking fierce and ready for battle, with a sense that their efforts will have far-reaching consequences that go beyond the immediate fight. There is a sense of anticipation for what is to come.

A group of soldiers walking forward with a sense of purpose, representing a larger cause beyond just the immediate battle they are facing. The soldiers sense that the book they carry will lead them to greater battles in the future.

The visual style is impressionistic. An army of soldiers is shown with their heads bowed down, awaiting orders. The scene is set against an ominous and dark background, symbolizing the impending war. This picture conveys the idea that the soldiers are fighting for something much larger than themselves, and their actions in this war will have far-reaching consequences.

007-003.text: Thou orb of many orbs!Thou seething principle! thou well-kept, latent germ! thou centre!Around the idea of thee the war revolving,With all its angry and vehement play of causes,(With vast results to come for thrice a thousand years,)These recitatives for thee,--my book and the war are one,Merged in its spirit I and mine, as the contest hinged on thee,As a wheel on its axis turns, this book unwitting to itself,Around the idea of thee.
caption: A fiery and intense image of a spinning orb, the center of all movement and energy. The surrounding scene depicts a violent and raging war, with causes and effects that extend for millennia. All elements of the world - including the narrator and their book - are drawn to and revolve around this central force, the essence of the orb that drives all things forward.

A bright, fiery orb surrounded by chaos and tumultuous energy. All forces, both good and evil, are drawn towards it, with its influence destined to last for millennia. This image is referenced in a book that is inseparable from the essence of this orb, with the conflict within the book itself revolving entirely around its power. As if part of a larger machinery, the book spins endlessly around this all-encompassing idea.

Surrealist. An intricate and glowing orb with many other smaller orbs revolving around it. The orb is the center of attention, with everything else revolving and revolving around it. The surrounding space is dark and shadowy, with a sense of mystery and tension.

008-001.text: I met a seer,Passing the hues and objects of the world,The fields of art and learning, pleasure, sense,To glean eidolons.
caption: A traveler walking away from the colorful and vibrant world and heading towards the abstract and elusive world of eidolons with the help of a guide.
A person deep in thought with their eyes closed, standing in the midst of a variety of objects and colors. They are reaching beyond the physical world to gather intangible, spiritual entities.

Surrealism. A person walking through a field of various objects and colors, each representing different aspects of the world and human experiences. The person is reaching out to touch the "eidolons," which are ethereal, otherworldly shapes floating around them.

008-002.text: Put in thy chants said he,No more the puzzling hour nor day, nor segments, parts, put in,Put first before the rest as light for all and entrance-song of all,That of eidolons.
caption: A person presenting a shining, luminous object to a group of people. The object emits light, illuminating their faces and surroundings.

A picture of a choir conductor standing in front of a group of singers. The conductor signals to the choir to begin singing. The focus is on the conductor's face, which is filled with inspiration and passion. Behind them, the church walls are adorned with ornate carvings and stained glass windows.

Surrealistic. A luminous and ethereal sphere with colorful smoke-like swirls around it, standing out among contrasting darkness, signifies the primacy of the chants that lead to and involve all of the different parts of life.

008-003.text: Ever the dim beginning,Ever the growth, the rounding of the circle,Ever the summit and the merge at last, (to surely start again,)Eidolons! eidolons!
caption: A continuous circle with ever-growing size, eventually culminating in the merging of the outer edges. It represents the eternal cycle of life and rebirth.

A series of circular shapes with an ascending size, implying growth and progress. The final circle is larger, merging with the first to imply the cycle's repetition. An abstract representation of the concept of eidolons.

Surrealism. A circular image with a darkness penetrating the edges, as it transitions into a bright light in the center. The light merges and becomes one with other bright lights. It is a representation of the cyclical nature of life and how everything is interconnected.

008-004.text: Ever the mutable,Ever materials, changing, crumbling, re-cohering,Ever the ateliers, the factories divine,Issuing eidolons.
caption: A dynamic abstract painting with various shapes and colors that seem to be in a constant state of change and transformation, with towering factories and workshops in the background producing ghostly, ethereal sculptures.

A time-lapse photo of natural materials such as rocks, soil, and plants changing and eroding over time. In the background, we see factories and workshops of a divine nature that produce spiritual and ethereal beings.
Surrealistic. A constantly shifting landscape of materials and machinery forming and collapsing into each other, emitting ethereal beings or spirits.

008-005.text: Lo, I or you,Or woman, man, or state, known or unknown,We seeming solid wealth, strength, beauty build,But really build eidolons.
caption: A person building what appears to be a solid structure, representing wealth, strength, and beauty. However, upon closer examination, it is revealed to be an illusion, or "eidolon." Symbolizing the idea that our material possessions are not truly solid and lasting, but rather a fleeting representation of what we value.

A person standing in front of a grand and impressively tall structure made of bricks, steel, and glass, looking upon it in awe. However, upon closer inspection, the building is revealed to be a mere facade, a Hollow and lifeless construction.

The visual style is abstract, with a portrayal of people and states as seemingly solid, but in a state of disintegration or fading away. The people and states are gradually turning into intangible eidolons, despite the illusion of their wealth, strength, and beauty.

008-006.text: The ostent evanescent,The substance of an artist’s mood or savan’s studies long,Or warrior’s, martyr’s, hero’s toils,To fashion his eidolon.
caption: An image of a ghostly apparition emerging from the mind of an artist, savant, warrior, martyr or hero, derived from their fleeting emotions, long study, or arduous experiences. The creation of an eidolon.

An artist furiously painting on a canvas, an academic pouring over books, a warrior fighting a battle, a martyr or hero enduring immense hardships, all straining to create an image of their ideal self.

In the style of abstract art, a blur of vibrant colors and shapes that depict the fleeting essence of creation, with hints of an artist's studio, a scholar's library, a warrior's field, and a martyr's sacrifice merging into one ephemeral form.

008-007.text: Of every human life,(The units gather’d, posted, not a thought, emotion, deed, left out,)The whole or large or small summ’d, added up,In its eidolon.
caption: A collage of different individuals' lives, with each moment and aspect of their experiences captured and combined to form a larger whole. The resulting image is a representation of the essence of life that transcends any one individual experience.
A collage of photos of different people, each one a part of a bigger picture. Each individual captured in a moment, combined to create a larger idea of humanity.

Surrealism. A strange and surreal composition made up of many disparate objects and symbols, reminiscent of Salvador Dali's famous works. The objects include a jumble of human figures, each one unique, but all gathered together in one place. The figures are arranged in different poses and postures, with a sense of motion and energy. There are also a wide variety of other objects and symbols, including flowers, animals, and geometric shapes. The overall impression is of a world of intense and mysterious emotion, where every human life is important and valued.

008-008.text: The old, old urge,Based on the ancient pinnacles, lo, newer, higher pinnacles,From science and the modern still impell’d,The old, old urge, eidolons.
caption: A person standing in front of two sets of peaks, the old ones representing traditional knowledge, the newer and higher ones representing scientific and modern advancements, with an irresistible urge to explore and move forward.
A person looking at a mountain, representing the ancient pinnacles, with a newer and higher mountain beside it, representing science and modernity. The person feels an old, old urge inspired by both.

Surrealist. A towering stone pillar representing the old, old urge with an array of smaller, more complex pillars emerging form the top, symbolizing the newer, higher pinnacles inspired by science and modern advances. Mist flows in and around the pillars, adding to the mysterious atmosphere.

008-009.text: The present now and here,America’s busy, teeming, intricate whirl,Of aggregate and segregate for only thence releasing,To-day’s eidolons.
caption: A bustling city scene, with people of all walks of life coming and going in a complex dance. The diversity of the environment leads to the creation of new ideas and possibilities.

A busy city street with people moving about, either alone or in groups. The picture showcases everyday life in America, busy, complex and constantly in motion. The complex interactions of different groups of people and their surroundings are the focus of this picture. The present moment is captured in this dynamic, ever-changing scene.
Surrealist. A chaotic mix of people, machines and buildings in America. From the mixture, ghostly figures emerge as if they were going to be freed from reality.

008-010.text: These with the past,Of vanish’d lands, of all the reigns of kings across the sea,Old conquerors, old campaigns, old sailors’ voyages,Joining eidolons.
caption: A collage of images representing various eras of human history, including depictions of ancient lands, royals, conquerors, military campaigns, and oceanic explorations. All of these images are being merged together to form a new, universal entity comprised of all past experiences and cultures - the eidolons.

An ethereal image of the present connecting with the ghosts of past empires and civilizations, including ancient kings, conquerors, campaigns, and sailors who've voyaged across the seas. All are unified together in this vivid imaginary world.

Surrealistic. A collage of overlapping images showing the remnants of past civilizations, including ancient ruins, faded portraits of long-dead monarchs, and ships sailing across the sea to new lands. The images seamlessly blend into each other, representing the joining of the present with a mystical past.

008-011.text: Densities, growth, facades,Strata of mountains, soils, rocks, giant trees,Far-born, far-dying, living long, to leave,Eidolons everlasting.
caption: A panoramic view of nature with mountains, trees, and landscapes in various stages of development and decay. The image evokes a sense of the eternal cycle of life and death.

Style: Hyper-realistic landscape painting

The painting shows the magnificence of nature's grandeur, with seemingly infinite layers of dense forests, towering mountains, sturdy rocks, and giant trees. The intricate, complex strata of the natural elements are perfectly captured in the painting. There is a sense of vastness and ageless wonder in the picture, as if the landscape has existed for millennia and will continue to exist beyond us. The painting captures the beauty and power of nature's enduring presence through the imagery of eidolons, or everlasting spirits.

008-012.text: Exalte, rapt, ecstatic,The visible but their womb of birth,Of orbic tendencies to shape and shape and shape,The mighty earth-eidolon.
caption: A person standing with their arms stretched up high, looking towards the sky with a look of wonder and ecstasy. Above them is the image of the planet earth, slowly taking shape from a glowing orb.

Abstract expressionism. A painting that shows a swirling, exalted mixture of colors with an intense focus on the center, symbolizing the birthplace of creation. The colors bleed and blend into each other, reflecting the idea of shape and tendency forming the earth.

008-013.text: All space, all time,(The stars, the terrible perturbations of the suns,Swelling, collapsing, ending, serving their longer, shorter use,)Fill’d with eidolons only.
caption: The picture is an image of endless space and time, with stars and suns experiencing their natural cycles of growth and decay. The focus of the picture, however, is on the omnipresent eidolons, or spirits, that populate all corners of the universe.

Surreal. An explosion of stars of varying sizes, shapes, and colors filling up the entire frame. The stars seem to be collapsing in on each other and exploding all at once, creating a mesmerizing and terrifying landscape. In the center of this chaos, a single, ghostly figure appears, an "eidolon," seeming to be one with the cosmic forces surrounding it.

008-014.text: The noiseless myriads,The infinite oceans where the rivers empty,The separate countless free identities, like eyesight,The true realities, eidolons.
caption: A serene, vast landscape with numerous rivers flowing into a boundless ocean. The scene is filled with countless individual entities, each possessing their own distinct identity. The overall impression is of an endless expanse of reality, with an otherworldly quality to it.

Surrealism. A picture that shows countless tiny objects, arranged in a way that implies vastness and infinity. These objects are individually distinct yet merge and coalesce into an unbroken whole, much like the water droplets merge into the ocean. Each object forms an identity of its own, yet together, they seem like a singular entity.

008-015.text: Not this the world,Nor these the universes, they the universes,Purport and end, ever the permanent life of life,Eidolons, eidolons.
caption: An abstract artwork with multiple universes and galaxies that stand out. The main focus is on the core of the artwork because it represents the permanence of life.

Abstract. The image shows a mesmerizing spiral of cosmic colors, representing the endlessness of the universe. The center holds a vibrant, golden aura symbolizing the permanent life of life, or Eidolons.

008-016.text: Beyond thy lectures learn’d professor,Beyond thy telescope or spectroscope observer keen, beyond all mathematics,Beyond the doctor’s surgery, anatomy, beyond the chemist with his chemistry,The entities of entities, eidolons.
caption: A person looking beyond a telescope and a professor's lecture to see the essence of things - the entities of entities, the eidolons.

The visual style could be surrealism. The image could be of a person looking at a telescope or a microscope, while being surrounded by abstract and dreamlike entities or eidolons. These eidolons could represent the intangible aspects of knowledge beyond the physical world that exist beyond even the most advanced scientific tools.

008-017.text: Unfix’d yet fix’d,Ever shall be, ever have been and are,Sweeping the present to the infinite future,Eidolons, eidolons, eidolons.
caption: A still picture of a never-ending spiral with a sense of constant motion. The spiral symbolizes the infinite future with the past and the present being swept along, represented by an image of blurred motion. The picture evokes a feeling of continuity and permanence.

Surrealistic. An infinite expanse in which the present is being swept towards the future. Within this space, there are multiple ghostly forms - eidolons - appearing and disappearing in quick succession.

008-018.text: The prophet and the bard,Shall yet maintain themselves, in higher stages yet,Shall mediate to the Modern, to Democracy, interpret yet to them,God and eidolons.
caption: The painting depicts a prophet and a bard together in what seems to be a majestic scene. The two figures are seen transcending into higher realms as they mediate and connect with the spirit of democracy, and interpret and communicate the divine presence and or spirits of the heroes and the loved ones to the modern world.

The picture is done in a surrealism style. It shows a powerful image of a prophet and a bard standing side by side, gazing towards the future. They are standing on a staircase that seems to lead to higher and loftier land, where the mysteries of democracy and freedom await. In the background, there are clouds and faded images of gods and idols casting a divine glow over the scene.

008-019.text: And thee my soul,Joys, ceaseless exercises, exaltations,Thy yearning amply fed at last, prepared to meet,Thy mates, eidolons.
caption: In the picture, a soul is depicted as being overjoyed and elated while engaging in activities without end while being surrounded by other souls, all of whom bask in the fulfillment of their longings in a state of readiness to come together.

The visual style is abstract. The image shows a soul floating upwards towards a bright and radiant light, surrounded by various colorful shapes and patterns. The soul appears to be fulfilled and joyous, as it prepares to meet with other similar entities.

008-020.text: Thy body permanent,The body lurking there within thy body,The only purport of the form thou art, the real I myself,An image, an eidolon.
caption: An abstract image of a person where there is a hidden body within their physical form. The essence of the person is represented by the inner body, which is the true identity.

The photo is in black and white, with a person's silhouette being superimposed over their body. The body within the silhouette is a fainter outline than the outer body. This creates the effect of an image or an eidolon - a ghost-like projection or phantom image.

008-021.text: Thy very songs not in thy songs,No special strains to sing, none for itself,But from the whole resulting, rising at last and floating,A round full-orb’d eidolon.
caption: An abstract painting with various colors blending together to form a harmonious whole. The painting gives the impression of music or a song, despite containing no obvious musical symbols. At the center of the painting, there is a circular shape which represents the full-orb’d eidolon.

Surrealism style. A painting of a face with musical notes emanating from the head. The notes come together forming a colorful round-shaped orb, representing the idea that the songs are not about individual notes but rather the complete experience.

009-001.text: For him I sing,I raise the present on the past,(As some perennial tree out of its roots, the present on the past,)With time and space I him dilate and fuse the immortal laws,To make himself by them the law unto himself.
caption: A person standing tall, representing the present, rising from the roots that symbolize their past. The laws that shaped them are depicted as a force that expands and encompasses the person, making them the ultimate authority and guide for themselves.

The visual style is surrealist. A man emerging from the roots of an ancient tree, lifting a present gift box over his head into a cloudy, otherworldly space. Surrounded by intricate, swirling branches and vines that represent the passing of time and the fusion of the mortal and immortal worlds. The man's posture exudes a sense of self-reliance and agency, symbolizing his ability to create his own destiny by following the natural laws of the universe.

010-001.text: When I read the book, the biography famous,And is this then (said I) what the author calls a man’s life?And so will some one when I am dead and gone write my life?(As if any man really knew aught of my life,Why even I myself I often think know little or nothing of my real life,Only a few hints, a few diffused faint clews and indirectionsI seek for my own use to trace out here.)
caption: A person sitting by a bookshelf appearing lost in thought, reflecting on the meaning of life as they consider the possibility of someone writing their biography. The background is shadowy and dreamlike, with only faint indications of the person's life story visible.

Surrealism. The image shows a human figure sitting in an empty room, trying to read a floating book with a bright light shining from it. The figure is realizing the complexity of understanding one's own life and questioning whether anyone can accurately document it. Clues and hints about their life seem vague and unclear. All the while, ghostly hands are trying to grasp at the figure, seemingly representing the fleeting nature of life's moments.

011-001.text: Beginning my studies the first step pleas’d me so much,The mere fact consciousness, these forms, the power of motion,The least insect or animal, the senses, eyesight, love,The first step I say awed me and pleas’d me so much,I have hardly gone and hardly wish’d to go any farther,But stop and loiter all the time to sing it in ecstatic songs.
caption: A person in awe standing in front of nature, observing the smallest insect and connecting with the power of motion. The wonder of the moment makes the person want to stop and sing in ecstasy.

The visual style would be impressionism. The picture shows a person standing at the edge of a field, gazing in awe at the small details of nature - a flower, a bug creeping on a blade of grass, a bird landing on a nearby branch. The person is so enraptured by their surroundings that they can't bear to move on, instead choosing to sing ecstatic songs celebrating the beauty around them.

012-001.text: How they are provided for upon the earth, (appearing at intervals,)How dear and dreadful they are to the earth,How they inure to themselves as much as to any--what a paradoxappears their age,How people respond to them, yet know them not,How there is something relentless in their fate all times,How all times mischoose the objects of their adulation and reward,And how the same inexorable price must still be paid for the samegreat purchase.
caption: A series of images showing how animals are provided for on earth, occasionally appearing, and how they are both important and terrifying to the planet. These animals continue to live and adapt, though their length of time on earth seems contradictory. People acknowledge these creatures without fully understanding them. The fate of these beings seems harsh, and people often choose to idolize and reward the wrong things, ultimately leading to a high price for the planet.

In a realistic style, a panoramic picture of a serene landscape with green fields, trees, and mountains. In the foreground, people of all ages are seen living their lives, unaware of their fleeting nature. The sky above is menacing and ominous, highlighting the paradoxical nature of life and death.

013-001.text: To the States or any one of them, or any city of the States, Resistmuch, obey little,Once unquestioning obedience, once fully enslaved,Once fully enslaved, no nation, state, city of this earth, everafterward resumes its liberty.
caption: A person standing on a desolate, rocky terrain with a raised fist in resistance. A broken chain lies at their feet. In the distance, a city skyline looms, representing the oppressive forces of society.

The image portrays a rebellious person standing in front of a city skyline, with a determined expression on their face. The visual style is a combination of vintage and contemporary, with muted colors and bold lines.

014-001.text: On journeys through the States we start,(Ay through the world, urged by these songs,Sailing henceforth to every land, to every sea,)We willing learners of all, teachers of all, and lovers of all.
caption: A group of people embarking on a journey across different states and countries, propelled by the power of music. They are enthusiastic about learning, teaching, and embracing the diverse cultures they encounter along the way.

In a vibrant and eclectic collage style, with a world map used as the background, different cities and landmarks from around the globe appearing as cut-out photos with images of a group of diverse travelers exploring and learning from the cultures they encounter.

014-002.text: We have watch’d the seasons dispensing themselves and passing on,And have said, Why should not a man or woman do as much as theseasons, and effuse as much?
caption: A painting of a scenic landscape with trees, flowers, and leaves representing different seasons. In the foreground, a person is standing and looking at the landscape, contemplating the passing of time and the idea of effusing as much as the seasons.

In the style of Impressionism, a human figure standing amidst a landscape that depicts the changing of seasons. The figure is inspired and determined to match the relentless transition of time with their own effusive and ever-changing nature.

014-003.text: We dwell a while in every city and town,We pass through Kanada, the North-east, the vast valley of theMississippi, and the Southern States,We confer on equal terms with each of the States,We make trial of ourselves and invite men and women to hear,We say to ourselves, Remember, fear not, be candid, promulge thebody and the soul,Dwell a while and pass on, be copious, temperate, chaste, magnetic,And what you effuse may then return as the seasons return,And may be just as much as the seasons.
caption: A journey through different cities and regions, experiencing and conversing with people along the way. Embracing honesty and openness, with the aim to become better versions of ourselves. A reminder to remain balanced and pure in our interactions, and to trust that our efforts will come back to us in due time.

The visual style is impressionistic. A traveler's journey across various American landscapes, from vast valleys to southern states, encountering different people and cultures. The traveler seeks to engage with the inhabitants and encourages them to be honest and express themselves freely. The traveler pauses in each place and experiences the different seasons, ultimately leaving a positive impact.

015-001.text: Here, take this gift,I was reserving it for some hero, speaker, or general,One who should serve the good old cause, the great idea, theprogress and freedom of the race,Some brave confronter of despots, some daring rebel;But I see that what I was reserving belongs to you just as much as to any.
caption: An outstretched hand holding a gift box with a bow, offered towards a group of people. The giver has a look of admiration and respect for the person receiving the gift.

The visual style is a combination of abstract and realistic art. The image depicts a person holding out a gift as if offering it to someone. In the background, there is a faint silhouette of a statue representing a hero or a general. The color palette is muted with shades of blue and gray, invoking a somber and serious mood.

016-001.text: Me imperturbe, standing at ease in Nature,Master of all or mistress of all, aplomb in the midst of irrational things,Imbued as they, passive, receptive, silent as they,Finding my occupation, poverty, notoriety, foibles, crimes, lessimportant than I thought,Me toward the Mexican sea, or in the Mannahatta or the Tennessee,or far north or inland,A river man, or a man of the woods or of any farm-life of theseStates or of the coast, or the lakes or Kanada,Me wherever my life is lived, O to be self-balanced for contingencies,To confront night, storms, hunger, ridicule, accidents, rebuffs, asthe trees and animals do.
caption: A picture of a person standing calmly in nature, surrounded by animals and trees. They are at peace, and their surroundings do not phase them. They have found meaning and purpose in the simplicity of their existence, and are content no matter where they may find themselves. The person is self-balanced and able to face any challenge that might come their way, just like the trees and animals around them.

Impressionism. A figure stands calmly amidst nature, at ease among the irrational things of the world. They absorb their surroundings, taking in the landscapes of Mexico, Mannahatta, Tennessee, the north, inland, the coasts, or the lakes through their serene and passive demeanor. This person's identity is shaped primarily by their inner poise rather than external factors like occupation or reputation. They are ready for whatever life throws their way, whether it be harsh weather, hunger, ridicule, accidents or rejections.

017-001.text: Thither as I look I see each result and glory retracing itself andnestling close, always obligated,Thither hours, months, years--thither trades, compacts,establishments, even the most minute,Thither every-day life, speech, utensils, politics, persons, estates;Thither we also, I with my leaves and songs, trustful, admirant,As a father to his father going takes his children along with him.
caption: A picture of nostalgia, where the past is revisited and celebrated. Everyday life in every form, from objects to people, are captured and cherished. The artist is present in the picture, leading the way like a father to his children, sharing in the wistful sentimentality of the scene.

The picture is done in the style of surrealism with a father towering over a village. The father is symbolic and gesturing at the village, and all of its culture, life and politics. The father is guiding, as if taking them under his wing, or parentally watching over them. The father's actions are loving and protective.

018-001.text: Lo, the unbounded sea,On its breast a ship starting, spreading all sails, carrying evenher moonsails.The pennant is flying aloft as she speeds she speeds so stately--below emulous waves press forward,They surround the ship with shining curving motions and foam.
caption: A majestic ship sails upon an endless sea with all sails raised, including the moonsails. The wave's foam sparkles in the sunlight as they race to catch up to the speeding vessel. The pennant flies high, proudly announcing the ship's name.

With a dramatic style, a panoramic view of a vast, endless sea is displayed. A majestic ship is seen in the distance, sailing ahead while all its sails are up, even the moonsails. The ship is moving forward speedily, and its pennant flies in the air prominently. The serene waves show their competitive spirit and rush forward, creating a wave around the ship, with shining and exquisite curving motions and a layer of foam.

019-001.text: I hear America singing, the varied carols I hear,Those of mechanics, each one singing his as it should be blithe and strong,The carpenter singing his as he measures his plank or beam,The mason singing his as he makes ready for work, or leaves off work,The boatman singing what belongs to him in his boat, the deckhandsinging on the steamboat deck,The shoemaker singing as he sits on his bench, the hatter singing ashe stands,The wood-cutter’s song, the ploughboy’s on his way in the morning,or at noon intermission or at sundown,The delicious singing of the mother, or of the young wife at work,or of the girl sewing or washing,Each singing what belongs to him or her and to none else,The day what belongs to the day--at night the party of youngfellows, robust, friendly,Singing with open mouths their strong melodious songs.
caption: A busy scene of American life, with people from all walks of life singing their varied tunes. Mechanics, carpenters, masons, boatmen, deckhands, shoemakers, hatters, woodcutters, ploughboys, mothers, young wives, and girls working, all singing their own songs. In the evening, a group of young, strong men gather to sing robust, friendly songs.

A busy street scene filled with people singing joyfully as they work. Each person has their unique expression, posture, and profession. The brightly colored street with pastel hues depicts the energy and rhythm of work, from the carpenter measuring plank to the young wife at work, each lost in their melody. The style of the picture is realistic but with a vibrant palette and a dynamic composition.

020-001.text: What place is besieged, and vainly tries to raise the siege?Lo, I send to that place a commander, swift, brave, immortal,And with him horse and foot, and parks of artillery,And artillery-men, the deadliest that ever fired gun.
caption: An army led by an immortal commander on horseback with infantry and heavy weaponry laid siege to a fortified location.

The style I would recommend for this Picture would be a futuristic one. A fortified city under siege during a battle. Suddenly, a silver armoured commander, followed by rows of robotic foot soldiers, ride in on hovering motorbikes carrying advanced artillery weapons that burst out laser beams, shields up, prepared to annihilate everything.

021-001.poem: Still Though the One I Sing
021-001.text: Still though the one I sing,(One, yet of contradictions made,) I dedicate to Nationality,I leave in him revolt, (O latent right of insurrection! Oquenchless, indispensable fire!)
caption: A portrait of a person with conflicting emotions and qualities, dedicated to their country. The figure is portrayed with a spark of rebellion, a powerful and inextinguishable flame.

The picture is portrayed in an impressionist style that shows a man with a conflicted expression on his face. Behind him is the image of a flag being lifted by the strong winds of change. The man is representative of the nation, and the chaos and revolt behind him signify the never-ending struggle for freedom and liberty.

022-001.text: Shut not your doors to me proud libraries,For that which was lacking on all your well-fill’d shelves, yetneeded most, I bring,Forth from the war emerging, a book I have made,The words of my book nothing, the drift of it every thing,A book separate, not link’d with the rest nor felt by the intellect,But you ye untold latencies will thrill to every page.
caption: In the picture, a person stands outside a grand library with closed doors. They hold up a book they made themselves and it radiates a powerful energy. Despite not having words of great importance, the meaning behind the book is what truly counts. It is not like any other book in the library but has the potential to touch someone's soul who reads it.

The visual style is impressionism. A person standing in front of closed library doors with arms open wide as if pleading to enter. In one hand, they hold a book, which emanates a warm light, highly contrasting with the cold, impersonal building. The book seems to be a product of the person themselves, representing their innermost thoughts and experiences. The surrounding library is dark and shadowy, but the pages of the book glow with a bright energy that seems to reach out to be felt by an unseen force.

023-001.text: Poets to come! orators, singers, musicians to come!Not to-day is to justify me and answer what I am for,But you, a new brood, native, athletic, continental, greater thanbefore known,Arouse! for you must justify me.
caption: An image of a person standing tall with their arms outstretched, looking upward towards the sky. In the background, a diverse crowd of individuals is gathering, including poets, orators, singers, and musicians from different cultures and backgrounds. The person in the foreground is calling upon this new generation to rise up and surpass all that has been done before, and to justify their existence and purpose in the world.

The photograph is taken from a low angle, and it is of a dynamic group of young artists. They are emerging from a rugged terrain, representing their strength and vigor. The background is a vast, epic American landscape. The style is dramatic and grandiose, inspired by romantic paintings.

023-002.text: I myself but write one or two indicative words for the future,I but advance a moment only to wheel and hurry back in the darkness.
caption: A person standing on the edge of a cliff overlooking a vast darkness. They write a few words on a paper, then hesitate and step back into the shadows.

The Minimalist style. A dark and  abstract painting featuring an incomplete circle, inscribed with just a few obscure words. Above, a momentary light fades into the darkness, as if calling for attention to the brief time it existed.

023-003.text: I am a man who, sauntering along without fully stopping, turns acasual look upon you and then averts his face,Leaving it to you to prove and define it,Expecting the main things from you.
caption: A man walking past the viewer, glancing at them but quickly averting his gaze. He leaves it up to the viewer to interpret his intentions and expects the viewer to take the lead in their interaction.

The visual style for this picture could be impressionistic or chiaroscuro.  A man is walking slowly, eyes are wandering casually on you, but he avoids looking straight. The focus of the picture is more the emotions that the scene conveys, leaving the viewer to define it.

024-001.text: Whoever you are, I fear you are walking the walks of dreams,I fear these supposed realities are to melt from under your feet and hands,Even now your features, joys, speech, house, trade, manners,troubles, follies, costume, crimes, dissipate away from you,Your true soul and body appear before me.They stand forth out of affairs, out of commerce, shops, work,farms, clothes, the house, buying, selling, eating, drinking,suffering, dying.
caption: In the surrealist style, a figure walks, but their features, clothing, and surroundings are melting and fading away, revealing their true inner self standing firm amidst the chaos of everyday life.
The imagery is surreal, portraying a blur of dissolving reality. The figures depict the loss of identity in the rush of mundane life as the true soul and body are exposed.

024-002.text: Whoever you are, now I place my hand upon you, that you be my poem,I whisper with my lips close to your ear.I have loved many women and men, but I love none better than you.
caption: The picture is a close-up of two hands coming together, one open and one closed.  The hands come together in a whisper, almost touching but not quite, as though the speaker is inspiring the other person to be their muse. The overall visual style is a soft and intimate moment between individuals.

The visual style is romantic. The picture depicts hands clasping each other, with a flower bouquet in the background. The focus is on a whispering couple, with the speaker's lips close to their lover's ear.

024-003.text: O I have been dilatory and dumb,I should have made my way straight to you long ago,I should have blabb’d nothing but you, I should have chanted nothingbut you.
caption: Picture Description: In watercolor style, A person standing beside a road divided into two paths. One leads to various obstacles while the other leads directly to a beautiful destination. The person appears to be regretful, looking back at the obstacles they faced.
In a monochromatic photograph, a lone figure stands in the distance under a cloudy sky. Lush fields are on either side, but their gaze is fixed on the figure.

024-004.text: I will leave all and come and make the hymns of you,None has understood you, but I understand you,None has done justice to you, you have not done justice to yourself,None but has found you imperfect, I only find no imperfection in you,None but would subordinate you, I only am he who will never consentto subordinate you,I only am he who places over you no master, owner, better, God,beyond what waits intrinsically in yourself.
caption: A black and white photograph of a person standing on top of a mountain looking out at the horizon. The person appears to be in complete peace and awe while no external factors exist to subordinating them.

A black and white photograph of a person standing in front of a vast wilderness with snow-capped mountains in the distance. The person looks proudly into the distance with a sense of independence and self-reliance.

024-005.text: Painters have painted their swarming groups and the centre-figure of all,From the head of the centre-figure spreading a nimbus of gold-color’d light,But I paint myriads of heads, but paint no head without its nimbusof gold-color’d light,From my hand from the brain of every man and woman it streams,effulgently flowing forever.
caption: The picture is pointillist: thousands of tiny, colorful dots making up a mass of heads in a crowd. One central figure stands out, shining a brilliant gold light that spreads out over the picture and illuminates the surrounding figures with smaller, yet still visible, halos of light.

This photograph is a blur of faces, each with an ethereal glow that emanates from them. The focal point is a person in the center of the frame, whose golden aura spills over every surrounding face. The photograph is in a contemporary style.

024-006.text: O I could sing such grandeurs and glories about you!You have not known what you are, you have slumber’d upon yourselfall your life,Your eyelids have been the same as closed most of the time,What you have done returns already in mockeries,(Your thrift, knowledge, prayers, if they do not return inmockeries, what is their return?)
caption: Surrealistic. A person sleeping over a bed of clouds, with their eyelids almost fully closed. Meanwhile, outside their window, there is a world overflowing with grandeur and glory that is inaccessible to the sleeper.

Surrealist. A human figure lying on a rocky surface, with their eyes closed as if asleep. In the background, a distorted landscape of mockeries slowly takes shape, symbolizing lost knowledge and unfulfilled potential.

024-007.text: The mockeries are not you,Underneath them and within them I see you lurk,I pursue you where none else has pursued you,Silence, the desk, the flippant expression, the night, theaccustom’d routine, if these conceal you from others or fromyourself, they do not conceal you from me,The shaved face, the unsteady eye, the impure complexion, if thesebalk others they do not balk me,The pert apparel, the deform’d attitude, drunkenness, greed,premature death, all these I part aside.
caption: Realistic portrait photography. A portrait of a person with various faces overlaid to show how they conceal their inner selves. The true person is revealed and pursued, while the mockeries and outer appearances are let go.

Surrealist. An abstract image, built upon multiple layers of incongruous symbols and entities. At first, what appears to be mockeries and superficial surfaces overlap each other. However, as we peel each layer, they reveal deeper meanings until a true essence of a person is revealed that cannot be concealed by any superficialities.

024-008.text: There is no endowment in man or woman that is not tallied in you,There is no virtue, no beauty in man or woman, but as good is in you,No pluck, no endurance in others, but as good is in you,No pleasure waiting for others, but an equal pleasure waits for you.
caption: The photograph shows a mosaic of different faces, each radiating qualities of strength, beauty, pleasure, and endurance. The faces are arranged in a circle, representing the interconnectedness of humanity and how each person carries within them the potential for greatness. The visual style is reminiscent of impressionism, with the faces depicted in soft yet vibrant brushstrokes.
In the Surrealist style, a large magnifying glass framed by flowers is held over a desolate plain. Every living thing and every desirable attribute can be found within the magnified image.

024-009.text: As for me, I give nothing to any one except I give the like carefullyto you,I sing the songs of the glory of none, not God, sooner than I singthe songs of the glory of you.
caption: In this surrealist depiction, there's an intricate vine-like plant growing out of a heart while a faceless figure carefully waters it. The figure opens its mouth to sing, and instead of notes or words, a rainbow of multicolored light emanates from within.

In the style of a watercolor painting, a person standing in a lush green field, arms stretched outwards with a look of contentment on their face, as if they're singing the songs of the glory of someone special.

024-010.text: Whoever you are! claim your own at any hazard!These shows of the East and West are tame compared to you,These immense meadows, these interminable rivers, you are immenseand interminable as they,These furies, elements, storms, motions of Nature, throes of apparentdissolution, you are he or she who is master or mistress over them,Master or mistress in your own right over Nature, elements, pain,passion, dissolution.
caption: The picture is a surreal landscape with a person standing in the foreground. The person is towering over vast meadows and rivers that stretch infinitely across the terrain. At the same time, the person appears to be the embodiment of nature, with lightning bolts and powerful winds emanating from their figure.

In a surrealistic painting, a human figure stands amidst a vast landscape of meadows and rivers, appearing colossal and eternal. The chaotic forces of nature, such as storms and furies, are emerging from the figure, who is depicted as the master and mistress of all elements, pain, passion, and dissolution.

024-011.text: The hopples fall from your ankles, you find an unfailing sufficiency,Old or young, male or female, rude, low, rejected by the rest,whatever you are promulges itself,Through birth, life, death, burial, the means are provided, nothingis scanted,Through angers, losses, ambition, ignorance, ennui, what you arepicks its way.
caption: The image is in the style of impressionism, showcasing a figure breaking free from chains on their ankles. They appear content and self-reliant, regardless of their age, gender, or social status. No matter what challenges they face in life, they have the strength and means to overcome them and thrive.

The image is a textured and slightly abstract portrait of a person standing tall and free with broken ropes lying at their feet. The person appears confident, unperturbed by the judgments of others, and in command of their life's journey.

025-001.text: Thou reader throbbest life and pride and love the same as I,Therefore for thee the following chants.
caption: An outstretched hand with a bright light emanating from the palm, symbolizing the sharing of life, pride, and love.
Surrealistic, a close-up of two hearts beating as one, with waves of vibrant colors emanating from them, conveying the intensity of life and love.

026-001.text: 1Starting from fish-shape Paumanok where I was born,Well-begotten, and rais’d by a perfect mother,After roaming many lands, lover of populous pavements,Dweller in Mannahatta my city, or on southern savannas,Or a soldier camp’d or carrying my knapsack and gun, or a minerin California,Or rude in my home in Dakota’s woods, my diet meat, my drink fromthe spring,Or withdrawn to muse and meditate in some deep recess,Far from the clank of crowds intervals passing rapt and happy,Aware of the fresh free giver the flowing Missouri, aware ofmighty Niagara,Aware of the buffalo herds grazing the plains, the hirsute andstrong-breasted bull,Of earth, rocks, Fifth-month flowers experienced, stars, rain, snow,my amaze,Having studied the mocking-bird’s tones and the flight of themountain-hawk,And heard at dawn the unrivall’d one, the hermit thrush from theswamp-cedars,Solitary, singing in the West, I strike up for a New World.
caption: A series of snapshots showing a person's life journey. Beginning as a baby in a fish-shaped place called Paumanok. Moving forward to different places, including Mannahatta city, southern savannas, a soldier's camp, and a miner's life in California, and finally living in Dakota's woods in solitude. The pictures also show appreciation for nature, including the flowing Missouri River, mighty Niagara Falls, and buffalo herds grazing on plains. The person is depicted studying animal behavior, learning bird sounds, and being inspired by the hermit thrush singing in the swamp-cedars early in the morning. The pictures end with the person, now an adult, moving ahead towards a new and unknown world that lies ahead.

The picture is a collage of different landscapes and settings, with a focus on nature and the American West. The style is a mix of impressionism and landscape photography. It includes images of buffalo grazing on the plains, mountains in California, the Missouri River flowing, and a hermit thrush singing in a swamp. The overall effect is one of adventure and exploration, with a sense of awe and wonder at the natural world.

026-002.text: 2Victory, union, faith, identity, time,The indissoluble compacts, riches, mystery,Eternal progress, the kosmos, and the modern reports.This then is life,Here is what has come to the surface after so many throes and convulsions.
caption: A painting depicting a person triumphantly standing in front of a background that represents time and eternal progress. The picture is filled with symbols of union, faith, and identity, all of which are surrounded by the mysteries and riches of the universe. The image shows that, despite many struggles and upheavals, what has emerged is a powerful and transformative life.

In an abstract expressionist style, a burst of colorful energy erupts from the center of the image. Swirls of bright hues intermingle with each other, as if reaching toward the sky. The overall impression is one of victory – a celebration of life, unity, faith, and progress. The image represents the essence of what has come to the surface after so many struggles and convulsions.

026-003.text: How curious! how real!Underfoot the divine soil, overhead the sun.
caption: A photo of a person standing barefoot on the earth, gazing up at the bright sun in the sky.

The photograph depicts a picturesque natural landscape, photographed in an impressionist style, with flowers and plants growing from the ground. The warm sun's rays cast a soft light on the scene. The focus is on the ground and the sun, showing the beauty of the earth, how sacred it truly is.

026-004.text: See revolving the globe,The ancestor-continents away group’d together,The present and future continents north and south, with the isthmusbetween.
caption: A time-lapse image of a rotating globe, showing the continents moving and grouping together. The present and future continents are seen to the north and south, separated by an isthmus.

The visual style is a detailed and colorful 3D illustration. The image shows the Earth rotating slowly with continents of the past, such as Pangaea, clustered together. The present and future continents are shown up north and down south, with a thin strip of land connecting them in the middle, also known as the isthmus.

026-005.text: See, vast trackless spaces,As in a dream they change, they swiftly fill,Countless masses debouch upon them,They are now cover’d with the foremost people, arts, institutions, known.
caption: An image of vast, empty space that begins to transform as if in a dream. Suddenly, countless people, arts, and institutions pour into it, filling it completely.

The visual style for this picture could be abstract. The picture would depict a vast expanse of black space with countless white shapes emerging, expanding rapidly, and filling up the space. These white shapes would represent countless masses, people, institutions, and arts that are rapidly emerging and taking over the space in a dreamlike manner.

026-006.text: See, projected through time,For me an audience interminable.
caption: A figure standing on a stage with an eternal crowd stretching out into the distance.
Futuristic abstract. A person standing on a glowing platform looking into a digital portal that shows an endless audience of silhouettes that seem to blend into infinity.

026-007.text: With firm and regular step they wend, they never stop,Successions of men, Americanos, a hundred millions,One generation playing its part and passing on,Another generation playing its part and passing on in its turn,With faces turn’d sideways or backward towards me to listen,With eyes retrospective towards me.
caption: A procession of people, of various ages and ethnicities, walking in a steady and orderly manner. Each person is replaced by another in a never-ending cycle of generations. As they walk past, some turn their faces to look towards the viewer with a sense of nostalgia and curiosity.

Realistic. A panoramic view of a vast crowd with steady and regular movement as they progress through a long journey. The crowd numbers a hundred million, typical of American society. Every new generation moves in sync and performs their role and continues forward. Their faces are turned towards different directions, while some cast their gaze back with reflective expressions as they listen to the speaker.

026-008.text: 3Americanos! conquerors! marches humanitarian!Foremost! century marches! Libertad! masses!For you a programme of chants.
caption: A group of proud, triumphant people marching forward with determination. In the background, a flag with the word "Libertad" can be seen waving proudly. A program of chants inspired by humanitarianism and the masses.

The visual style is Pop Art. A vibrant and colorful group of people holding up signs and waving flags against a backdrop of a city. The signs read "3 Americanos!", "conquerors!", and "marches humanitarian!". The central figure is holding a megaphone, leading the group forward in a march for freedom and liberty. Behind them, the masses join in, raising their fists in support. All are united under a program of passionate chants.

026-009.text: Chants of the prairies,Chants of the long-running Mississippi, and down to the Mexican sea,Chants of Ohio, Indiana, Illinois, Iowa, Wisconsin and Minnesota,Chants going forth from the centre from Kansas, and thence equidistant,Shooting in pulses of fire ceaseless to vivify all.
caption: A panoramic view of the great American mid-western plains stretching out to the Mississippi river and down to the Mexican Gulf. The chants of various states soar into the air, spreading their energy throughout the landscape.

In a bold, colorful abstract painting style, we see a vibrant burst of light emanating from the center of an identifiable Midwestern region of the United States, with energetic lines of color shooting outwards like pulses or sound waves. The painting evokes the vast and diverse natural landscape of the region, including prairies, the Mississippi River, and the Mexican sea. The overall impression is one of dynamic movement and vital energy, reflecting the power of the chants that are flowing forth from the heartland of America.

026-010.text: 4Take my leaves America, take them South and take them North,Make welcome for them everywhere, for they are your own off-spring,Surround them East and West, for they would surround you,And you precedents, connect lovingly with them, for they connectlovingly with you.
caption: An image of a tree with its leaves falling, blowing across the country. The leaves are welcomed everywhere as they represent America's own offspring. The leaves surround the country from all directions, and America is encouraged to connect with them as they lovingly connect with America.

The visual style for this picture is a contemporary collage. This picture depicts autumn leaves of different colors that are scattered all around the northern and southern parts of America. The leaves are surrounded by various iconic symbols representing the states, such as the Statue of Liberty, the Golden Gate Bridge, the Empire State Building, and other landmarks. The elements of the collage are connected and intertwined, creating a cohesive whole. The picture portrays the diversity and unity of America and its people.

026-011.text: I conn’d old times,I sat studying at the feet of the great masters,Now if eligible O that the great masters might return and study me.
caption: An image of a person sitting at the base of an ancient statue, in a humble and studious manner. As they study, they express a desire to be studied by their teachers, who are also considered great masters.

The picture features a young person sitting by a desk with a large book, filled with ancient wisdom; a faint smile hints their enthusiasm to learn as light comes through the window casting the room in a warm glow. The style is impressionistic with a blurred, yet cohesive effect.

026-012.text: In the name of these States shall I scorn the antique?Why these are the children of the antique to justify it.
caption: The picture portrays a person standing proudly in front of an ancient building, with a group of children behind them. The person is looking towards the camera with a look of defiance, as if to say they will never abandon the traditions of the past. The children look up to the person with admiration and respect, as if they understand and agree with their message.

Surrealistic. A hand holding a modern sculpture while rejecting an ancient sculpture, but both sculptures emerge as living creatures. The sleek modern creature appears to be followed by smaller, fragmented ancient creatures.

026-013.text: 5Dead poets, philosophs, priests,Martyrs, artists, inventors, governments long since,Language-shapers on other shores,Nations once powerful, now reduced, withdrawn, or desolate,I dare not proceed till I respectfully credit what you have leftwafted hither,I have perused it, own it is admirable, (moving awhile among it,)Think nothing can ever be greater, nothing can ever deserve morethan it deserves,Regarding it all intently a long while, then dismissing it,I stand in my place with my own day here.
caption: An intense gaze upon a wall filled with remnants of the past. The remnants include works from a variety of human endeavors, such as poetry, philosophy, art, and government. The viewer feels moved and inspired by the fragments of the past, but ultimately stands confidently in their own present moment.

The style is surrealism, with a black and white image that depicts a desolate landscape. In the foreground, there is a pile of books, scrolls, and manuscripts, all of which seem old and weathered, indicating their age. The pile is surrounded by the silhouettes of various figures from history, including poets, philosophers, priests, artists, inventors, and leaders. They are all facing towards the pile, as if paying homage to the knowledge and wisdom it contains. The figure in the center is looking at the pile intently, then turning away to stand confidently in their own present time.

026-014.text: Here lands female and male,Here the heir-ship and heiress-ship of the world, here the flame ofmaterials,Here spirituality the translatress, the openly-avow’d,The ever-tending, the finale of visible forms,The satisfier, after due long-waiting now advancing,Yes here comes my mistress the soul.
caption: A picture showing a male and a female figure standing on a ground. They are holding flames of materials which represents their power and influence. There is a ray of spirituality that connects them both. The soul, symbolically represented by a female figure, is entering into the picture, bringing a final solution to all visible forms.

The photo is in a surreal style, showcasing a genderless figure standing in a center with their hand reaching out. The figure is surrounded by floating flames, materials, and a faint image of the earth. In the distance, a celestial being holds out an ethereal veil.

026-015.text: 6The soul,Forever and forever--longer than soil is brown and solid--longerthan water ebbs and flows.I will make the poems of materials, for I think they are to be themost spiritual poems,And I will make the poems of my body and of mortality,For I think I shall then supply myself with the poems of my soul andof immortality.
caption: A picture of a soul that is eternal, lasting longer than the physical elements of soil and water. The focus of the artwork is the person's body, which represents mortality. However, through the making of the materials and the body, the soul is being cared for and will transcend into immortality.

The picture is painted in a unique abstract style that represents the concept of infinity. It is a composition of warm earthy tones that portray the essence of the soul. In the centre of the canvas, there is a humanoid form that seems to be made from materials scattered all around. The materials themselves are depicted as spiritual, each carrying a unique story of their own. The figure has its arms outstretched, holding onto the material world while it transcends to a more divine form, capturing the beauty of both mortality and immortality.

026-016.text: I will make a song for these States that no one State may under anycircumstances be subjected to another State,And I will make a song that there shall be comity by day and bynight between all the States, and between any two of them,And I will make a song for the ears of the President, full ofweapons with menacing points,And behind the weapons countless dissatisfied faces;And a song make I of the One form’d out of all,The fang’d and glittering One whose head is over all,Resolute warlike One including and over all,(However high the head of any else that head is over all.)
caption: A colorful and dynamic painting with various states depicted, united and equal. The painting shows comity between states during both day and night. In the center, a fierce and powerful figure stands tall, with weapons and a menacing demeanor. Countless faces appear behind the weapon, each dissatisfied in their own way. The figure represents the unity of all, the highest power over all else.

The picture is drawn in a bold, graphic-novel style with a white background. A roaring tiger with fangs and sharp claws is at the center, representing the United States. Surrounding the tiger are smaller, less aggressive animals representing the individual states. Above the tiger's head hovers a symbol of power with countless faces behind it. The picture evokes strength, unity, and the unbreakable resolve of the United States.

026-017.text: I will acknowledge contemporary lands,I will trail the whole geography of the globe and salute courteouslyevery city large and small,And employments! I will put in my poems that with you is heroismupon land and sea,And I will report all heroism from an American point of view.
caption: A person standing on top of a hill, looking out at the vast landscape before them with open arms, symbolizing acknowledgment of all contemporary lands. The person is also surrounded by various objects symbolizing different employments. They are looking out at ships and planes, representing heroism upon land and sea. They are determined to report on all heroism from an American point of view.

Realistic style. A globe displayed prominently in the foreground and a smiling figure standing in the background surveying different cities and landscapes. They seem to be acknowledging everything they see and cataloguing it meticulously. Heroic feats are also highlighted, though the speaker holds an American perspective on it all.

026-018.text: I will sing the song of companionship,I will show what alone must finally compact these,I believe these are to found their own ideal of manly love,indicating it in me,I will therefore let flame from me the burning fires that werethreatening to consume me,I will lift what has too long kept down those smouldering fires,I will give them complete abandonment,I will write the evangel-poem of comrades and of love,For who but I should understand love with all its sorrow and joy?And who but I should be the poet of comrades?
caption: A person holding a torch, with flames emanating from the torch, suggesting intense passion. The person is surrounded by others, also holding torches, symbolizing comradeship and brotherhood. The image represents the universal nature of love and friendship, often found in the most unlikely of places, burning bright and strong.

Visual Style: Impressionistic

Two male figures standing close to each other with a serene but passionate expression upon their faces. One of them reaching out to grasp the other's hand. In the background, there are vibrant colors and a blurred image of a community, representing the ideal of manly love and comradeship. The image is an impressionistic representation of the poet's belief in love and the importance of companionship.

026-019.text: 7I am the credulous man of qualities, ages, races,I advance from the people in their own spirit,Here is what sings unrestricted faith.
caption: A person with open arms stands in the middle of a diverse crowd. The crowd is representative of different ages, races, and qualities. Together, they all share a sense of unrestricted faith.
