027-056.text: The runaway slave came to my house and stopt outside,I heard his motions crackling the twigs of the woodpile,Through the swung half-door of the kitchen I saw him limpsy and weak,And went where he sat on a log and led him in and assured him,And brought water and fill’d a tub for his sweated body and bruis’d feet,And gave him a room that enter’d from my own, and gave him somecoarse clean clothes,And remember perfectly well his revolving eyes and his awkwardness,And remember putting plasters on the galls of his neck and ankles;He staid with me a week before he was recuperated and pass’d north,I had him sit next me at table, my fire-lock lean’d in the corner.
caption: A kind person sees a runaway slave outside their home. They help him by giving him water and a place to rest. They notice his injuries and make sure he is comfortable. The slave stays with them for a week until he is ready to continue his journey. They even eat together at the same table while a gun leans in the corner.

Realistic style. The scene shows a runaway slave outside a house. The owner of the house saw his movements and went to help him. The scene then shows the owner leading the slave into the house, where he provides him with water to bathe his body and clean clothes to wear. The owner vividly remembers the slave’s painful neck and ankle injuries and tended to them with plasters. The slave stayed with the owner for a week, during which the owner treated him with kindness and respect, sitting him next to himself at the table. Finally, the slave recuperated and went north.

027-057.text: 11Twenty-eight young men bathe by the shore,Twenty-eight young men and all so friendly;Twenty-eight years of womanly life and all so lonesome.
caption: A group of 28 young men enjoying a friendly bath by the shore. In contrast, a woman has been lonely for 28 years.

Realistic impressionism. A group of twenty-eight young men joyfully frolic, playing tag, splashing water and enjoying each other's company by the shore. In the distance, a lonely woman stands at the water's edge, gazing out at the calm sea.

027-058.text: She owns the fine house by the rise of the bank,She hides handsome and richly drest aft the blinds of the window.
caption: A beautiful and wealthy woman peers out at the world from the windows of her grand house on top of a hill.

With a cinematic style, the image shows a magnificent house on a bank rise. Through the window, a shadowy figure of a woman is seen standing behind the curtain, wearing a luxurious attire indicating her wealth.

027-059.text: Which of the young men does she like the best?Ah the homeliest of them is beautiful to her.
caption: There is a group of young men and a woman in the middle. The woman is looking at the men and seems to find the least attractive one the most beautiful.

The photographic style is black and white, capturing an outdoor setting with a group of young men. A woman's gaze is fixated on the homeliest looking man, who she finds beautiful despite his plainness.

027-060.text: Where are you off to, lady? for I see you,You splash in the water there, yet stay stock still in your room.
caption: A woman stands still in a room, yet in her mind she splashes in the water.

Surrealistic painting with a somewhat translucent female figure standing still in a room filled with water. The contrast between the stagnant water in the room and the flowing water of the ocean represented outside creates a sense of tension and displacement.

027-061.text: Dancing and laughing along the beach came the twenty-ninth bather,The rest did not see her, but she saw them and loved them.
caption: A lone person joyfully dances and laughs on a serene beach, unnoticed by others who are nearby, but she looks at them with affection.

The picture would be in watercolor style with a group of bathers enjoying the beach, but there is one young woman, the twenty-ninth bather, who is dancing and laughing joyously, while the others are unaware of her presence.

027-062.text: The beards of the young men glisten’d with wet, it ran from their long hair,Little streams pass’d all over their bodies.
caption: A group of young men with wet beards and long hair. Their bodies are covered in small streams of water.

The visual style for this picture could be impressionistic or post-impressionistic, with a color scheme that suggests the cold and damp weather of the setting. The image depicts a group of young men with wet beards and long hair, standing in a field or on a beach. Water is dripping from their hair and beards, and little streams of water are visible on their bodies. The image conveys a sense of raw, natural energy and the power of the elements.

027-063.text: An unseen hand also pass’d over their bodies,It descended tremblingly from their temples and ribs.
caption: A picture of two people in a state of euphoria, with their bodies glowing and what appears to be a mystical hand hovering above them. The hand seems to be emanating a sense of divine power and the figures below appear to be experiencing a transcendental experience.
Surrealist. A painting showing two black and white bodies with an ethereal hand delicately touching the temples and ribs, creating a visible trembling effect.

027-064.text: The young men float on their backs, their white bellies bulge to thesun, they do not ask who seizes fast to them,They do not know who puffs and declines with pendant and bending arch,They do not think whom they souse with spray.
caption: Two young men are floating on their backs in a body of water, with their white bellies pointed toward the sun. They are completely carefree, unaware of their surroundings or the others around them, and are simply basking in the sun and the cool water.

For the visual style, let's go with impressionism. 

A painting of young men floating on their backs in blue water. The sun shines bright and casts a golden light on their white bellies. The water around them is dotted with brushstrokes of different shades of blue, green, and white to show the motion of the waves. The young men seem carefree and do not notice anyone around them.

027-065.text: 12The butcher-boy puts off his killing-clothes, or sharpens his knifeat the stall in the market,I loiter enjoying his repartee and his shuffle and break-down.
caption: A candid black and white photograph of a butcher-boy leaning against his stall. He has taken off his blood-stained apron and is sharpening his knife with a steel rod. A person stands beside him, engaged in conversation and enjoying his witty remarks. The bustling noise of the market can be felt in the background.

The image is in an impressionistic style, portraying a bustling market scene. In the foreground, a young boy is taking off his butcher's apron and hanging it over a post. Behind him, a man is grinding a knife against a sharpening stone. The picture captures people milling about, enjoying the lively atmosphere of the market.

027-066.text: Blacksmiths with grimed and hairy chests environ the anvil,Each has his main-sledge, they are all out, there is a great heat inthe fire.
caption: The picture shows a group of blacksmiths with grime and hair on their chests surrounding an anvil. Each of them holds a large hammer and is busy with their work as the fire roars with heat.

The picture shows a group of blacksmiths working together in a dimly lit forge. Their strong arms and muscular chests are visible even through the dirt and grime covering them. Each smith has their own large hammer, and they work with great intensity around the glowing anvil. The overall atmosphere of the image is one of intense heat and focused labor. The visual style is gritty and realistic, with heavy use of shadow and deep, earthy colors.

027-067.text: From the cinder-strew’d threshold I follow their movements,The lithe sheer of their waists plays even with their massive arms,Overhand the hammers swing, overhand so slow, overhand so sure,They do not hasten, each man hits in his place.
caption: In a black and white photograph, a group of burly workers are seen in mid-action as they collaborate on a construction project. Their muscular arms wield heavy hammers with sardonic expressions on their faces. Each hit of the hammer is delivered with precision, as if synchronized dance motions.

The photograph depicts a group of muscular construction workers in action, with heavy hammers in their hands. Their swings are graceful and precise, with sweat glistening on their skin in the bright sunlight. The picture is captured in a documentary photojournalistic style, with a focus on the movement and physicality of the workers.

027-068.text: 13The negro holds firmly the reins of his four horses, the block swagsunderneath on its tied-over chain,The negro that drives the long dray of the stone-yard, steady andtall he stands pois’d on one leg on the string-piece,His blue shirt exposes his ample neck and breast and loosens overhis hip-band,His glance is calm and commanding, he tosses the slouch of his hataway from his forehead,The sun falls on his crispy hair and mustache, falls on the black ofhis polish’d and perfect limbs.
caption: A tall and strong black man stands with one leg on a wooden beam while confidently holding the reins of four horses pulling a large block of stone on a dray. He wears a loose blue shirt that reveals his muscular neck and chest, and his hat casually sits on the back of his head. The sun rays fall on his dark hair and mustache, highlighting his polished and perfect limbs.

Realistic. A proud and sturdy black man wearing a loose blue shirt, standing on one leg on the string-piece of his long dray at a stone-yard. He holds the reins of his four horses firmly, the block swaying underneath on its tied-over chain. His hat slouches away from his forehead as he looks on with a calm and commanding gaze. The sun shines on his crispy hair and mustache, glistening off his polished and perfect limbs.

027-069.text: I behold the picturesque giant and love him, and I do not stop there,I go with the team also.
caption: A person standing in awe in front of a giant mountain. They then join a team to conquer the mountain.

The visual style is impressionistic. The picture shows the silhouette of a massive tree against an orange sunset sky. In the foreground, a team of people are walking towards it, united by their love for the tree.

027-070.text: In me the caresser of life wherever moving, backward as well asforward sluing,To niches aside and junior bending, not a person or object missing,Absorbing all to myself and for this song.
caption: The picture depicts a figure gracefully moving forward, but also looking backward. They seem to be collecting and taking in everything around them. They have an all-encompassing presence and are absorbing everything for their creative expression.

Surrealistic. The image depicts a human figure enmeshed within a kaleidoscopic landscape. The figure has an affectionate expression on their face and is embracing all elements of life that surrounds them including objects and individuals at a lower level in the image. The figure is stretching backwards and forwards, capturing all moments of life to infuse into a song.

027-071.text: Oxen that rattle the yoke and chain or halt in the leafy shade, whatis that you express in your eyes?It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life.
caption: An image of two oxen under a tree, one with a yoke around its neck, looking directly at the viewer. The expression in their eyes conveys a depth of emotion greater than any words on a page.

The visual style for this picture would be realism. The image would be of a pair of oxen standing in a green field, wearing a yoke and chains around their necks. They are taking a break in the shade of a large tree. The oxen have a sense of expression in their eyes that seems to convey a deeper meaning, which transcends all the words that the viewer has read in their life.

027-072.text: My tread scares the wood-drake and wood-duck on my distant andday-long ramble,They rise together, they slowly circle around.
caption: A lone hiker on a long journey through a forest, causing the wood-drake and wood-duck to fly away in alarm. The birds circle together slowly in the sky.
In an impressionistic style, a solitary figure on a long hike. The figure is surrounded by a lush forest and a serene lake with a pair of startled ducks in flight in the distance.

027-073.text: I believe in those wing’d purposes,And acknowledge red, yellow, white, playing within me,And consider green and violet and the tufted crown intentional,And do not call the tortoise unworthy because she is not something else,And the jay in the woods never studied the gamut, yet trills pretty well to me,And the look of the bay mare shames silliness out of me.
caption: A person is surrounded by vibrant colors and nature. They appreciate all forms of life and beauty, without judgement or discrimination. The sight of a simple bird and animal can bring them great joy and humility.

The art is done in impressionism style, with brush strokes and vivid color use. The image showcases a group of different animals in their natural habitat. A turtle, a bird (jay), and a horse are present in the picture. The animals are not perfect but are beautiful in their unique way. The turtle's slow pace, the bird's lack of musical education, and the horse's majestic look all come together to create a stunning visual experience.

027-074.text: 14The wild gander leads his flock through the cool night,Ya-honk he says, and sounds it down to me like an invitation,The pert may suppose it meaningless, but I listening close,Find its purpose and place up there toward the wintry sky.
caption: A flock of wild geese flying in the cool starry night with their leader honking and signaling towards the wintry sky. The meaning is understood by keen listeners.

In a minimalist and modern style, a flock of geese flying through the night sky with one goose leading the way. The leading goose honks loudly, and its call echoes through the still night, beckoning the viewer to follow. Despite its simplicity, the image captures the sense of adventure and excitement that comes with exploring the unknown.

027-075.text: The sharp-hoof’d moose of the north, the cat on the house-sill, thechickadee, the prairie-dog,The litter of the grunting sow as they tug at her teats,The brood of the turkey-hen and she with her half-spread wings,I see in them and myself the same old law.
caption: An image of various animals, including a moose, cat, chickadee, and prairie-dog, along with a litter of piglets and a brood of turkey chicks surrounding a turkey hen with her wings partially spread. The image portrays the interconnectedness of all creatures and the universal laws that bind them together.

A mixed-media illustration, combining charcoal and watercolor elements, with various animals and their offspring in their natural habitats. A majestic moose stands tall in the foreground, while a curious cat watches from a windowsill above. In the background, a small chickadee perches atop a branch, with a family of prairie dogs curiously poking their heads out of their burrow. A mother sow nurses her litter of piglets, and a turkey-hen spreads her wings protectively over her brood. The scene evokes a sense of the interconnectedness of all living things and the universal cycles of nature.

027-076.text: The press of my foot to the earth springs a hundred affections,They scorn the best I can do to relate them.
caption: A person standing on the ground, surrounded by various objects and living beings. Each of these objects and living beings represents a different emotion that arises from the person's connection with the earth. The person cannot accurately express the depth of these emotions.

Surrealist. A person with one foot on the ground and the other foot in a pool of water. A hundred different emotions are shown through various objects and creatures that are springing up around them, making it impossible for the person to describe or express them.

027-077.text: I am enamour’d of growing out-doors,Of men that live among cattle or taste of the ocean or woods,Of the builders and steerers of ships and the wielders of axes andmauls, and the drivers of horses,I can eat and sleep with them week in and week out.
caption: A picture with a group of diverse people who live and work outdoors, surrounded by nature. They look content as they eat, sleep, and work together.

The picture is set in a rural countryside, with a group of men who are farmers, sailors, carpenters, and woodcutters. They are standing together and enjoying their work, surrounded by vast fields and a beautiful ocean. The visual style of the picture is naturalistic, with warm and earthy tones.

027-078.text: What is commonest, cheapest, nearest, easiest, is Me,Me going in for my chances, spending for vast returns,Adorning myself to bestow myself on the first that will take me,Not asking the sky to come down to my good will,Scattering it freely forever.
caption: An image of a person adorned in bright and extravagant colors, standing with arms stretched out, surrounded by a shower of glittering coins that they are scattering into the air. The person is bold, confident and exudes a sense of joy and generosity.

The visual style is Pop Art. The picture depicts a person standing in the center, with multiple hands holding money bags, and a thought bubble above with various symbols representing consumerism, such as dollar signs, shopping bags, and credit cards. The person appears confident and unapologetic, adorned in flashy clothing and accessories.

027-079.text: 15The pure contralto sings in the organ loft,The carpenter dresses his plank, the tongue of his foreplanewhistles its wild ascending lisp,The married and unmarried children ride home to their Thanksgiving dinner,The pilot seizes the king-pin, he heaves down with a strong arm,The mate stands braced in the whale-boat, lance and harpoon are ready,The duck-shooter walks by silent and cautious stretches,The deacons are ordain’d with cross’d hands at the altar,The spinning-girl retreats and advances to the hum of the big wheel,The farmer stops by the bars as he walks on a First-day loafe andlooks at the oats and rye,The lunatic is carried at last to the asylum a confirm’d case,(He will never sleep any more as he did in the cot in his mother’sbed-room;)The jour printer with gray head and gaunt jaws works at his case,He turns his quid of tobacco while his eyes blurr with the manuscript;The malform’d limbs are tied to the surgeon’s table,What is removed drops horribly in a pail;The quadroon girl is sold at the auction-stand, the drunkard nods bythe bar-room stove,The machinist rolls up his sleeves, the policeman travels his beat,the gate-keeper marks who pass,The young fellow drives the express-wagon, (I love him, though I donot know him;)The half-breed straps on his light boots to compete in the race,The western turkey-shooting draws old and young, some lean on theirrifles, some sit on logs,Out from the crowd steps the marksman, takes his position, levels his piece;The groups of newly-come immigrants cover the wharf or levee,As the woolly-pates hoe in the sugar-field, the overseer views themfrom his saddle,The bugle calls in the ball-room, the gentlemen run for theirpartners, the dancers bow to each other,The youth lies awake in the cedar-roof’d garret and harks to themusical rain,The Wolverine sets traps on the creek that helps fill the Huron,The squaw wrapt in her yellow-hemm’d cloth is offering moccasins andbead-bags for sale,The connoisseur peers along the exhibition-gallery with half-shuteyes bent sideways,As the deck-hands make fast the steamboat the plank is thrown forthe shore-going passengers,The young sister holds out the skein while the elder sister winds itoff in a ball, and stops now and then for the knots,The one-year wife is recovering and happy having a week ago borneher first child,The clean-hair’d Yankee girl works with her sewing-machine or in thefactory or mill,The paving-man leans on his two-handed rammer, the reporter’s leadflies swiftly over the note-book, the sign-painter is letteringwith blue and gold,The canal boy trots on the tow-path, the book-keeper counts at hisdesk, the shoemaker waxes his thread,The conductor beats time for the band and all the performers follow him,The child is baptized, the convert is making his first professions,The regatta is spread on the bay, the race is begun, (how the whitesails sparkle!)The drover watching his drove sings out to them that would stray,The pedler sweats with his pack on his back, (the purchaser higglingabout the odd cent;)The bride unrumples her white dress, the minute-hand of the clockmoves slowly,The opium-eater reclines with rigid head and just-open’d lips,The prostitute draggles her shawl, her bonnet bobs on her tipsy andpimpled neck,The crowd laugh at her blackguard oaths, the men jeer and wink toeach other,(Miserable! I do not laugh at your oaths nor jeer you;)The President holding a cabinet council is surrounded by the greatSecretaries,On the piazza walk three matrons stately and friendly with twined arms,The crew of the fish-smack pack repeated layers of halibut in the hold,The Missourian crosses the plains toting his wares and his cattle,As the fare-collector goes through the train he gives notice by thejingling of loose change,The floor-men are laying the floor, the tinners are tinning theroof, the masons are calling for mortar,In single file each shouldering his hod pass onward the laborers;Seasons pursuing each other the indescribable crowd is gather’d, itis the fourth of Seventh-month, (what salutes of cannon and small arms!)Seasons pursuing each other the plougher ploughs, the mower mows,and the winter-grain falls in the ground;Off on the lakes the pike-fisher watches and waits by the hole inthe frozen surface,The stumps stand thick round the clearing, the squatter strikes deepwith his axe,Flatboatmen make fast towards dusk near the cotton-wood or pecan-trees,Coon-seekers go through the regions of the Red river or throughthose drain’d by the Tennessee, or through those of the Arkansas,Torches shine in the dark that hangs on the Chattahooche or Altamahaw,Patriarchs sit at supper with sons and grandsons and great-grandsonsaround them,In walls of adobie, in canvas tents, rest hunters and trappers aftertheir day’s sport,The city sleeps and the country sleeps,The living sleep for their time, the dead sleep for their time,The old husband sleeps by his wife and the young husband sleeps by his wife;And these tend inward to me, and I tend outward to them,And such as it is to be of these more or less I am,And of these one and all I weave the song of myself.
caption: A busy and diverse scene of people from all walks of life engaged in their respective tasks and activities. A warm, communal atmosphere pervades, with families gathering for Thanksgiving dinners, workers laboring in various trades, and individuals pursuing leisurely activities such as fishing and hunting. Despite their varied backgrounds and experiences, they are all interconnected and part of a greater whole.

Post-impressionist. An energetic and vibrant montage of a diverse range of people and activities all taking place during the same period - Thanksgiving Day. The pure contralto sings in the organ loft while the carpenter dresses his plank. The young sister holds out the skein while the elder sister winds it off in a ball, and stops now and then for the knots. Meanwhile, the child is baptized, the convert is making his first professions, and the President holding a cabinet council is surrounded by the great Secretaries. Flatboatmen make fast towards dusk near the cotton-wood or pecan-trees, while Coon-seekers go through the regions of the Red river. All of this is woven together in a lively and cohesive whole, culminating in the image of the speaker weaving the song of himself from all of these experiences.

027-080.text: 16I am of old and young, of the foolish as much as the wise,Regardless of others, ever regardful of others,Maternal as well as paternal, a child as well as a man,Stuff’d with the stuff that is coarse and stuff’d with the stuffthat is fine,One of the Nation of many nations, the smallest the same and thelargest the same,A Southerner soon as a Northerner, a planter nonchalant andhospitable down by the Oconee I live,A Yankee bound my own way ready for trade, my joints the limberestjoints on earth and the sternest joints on earth,A Kentuckian walking the vale of the Elkhorn in my deer-skinleggings, a Louisianian or Georgian,A boatman over lakes or bays or along coasts, a Hoosier, Badger, Buckeye;At home on Kanadian snow-shoes or up in the bush, or with fishermenoff Newfoundland,At home in the fleet of ice-boats, sailing with the rest and tacking,At home on the hills of Vermont or in the woods of Maine, or theTexan ranch,Comrade of Californians, comrade of free North-Westerners, (lovingtheir big proportions,)Comrade of raftsmen and coalmen, comrade of all who shake handsand welcome to drink and meat,A learner with the simplest, a teacher of the thoughtfullest,A novice beginning yet experient of myriads of seasons,Of every hue and caste am I, of every rank and religion,A farmer, mechanic, artist, gentleman, sailor, quaker,Prisoner, fancy-man, rowdy, lawyer, physician, priest.
caption: A picture of a person with a diverse range of experiences and backgrounds. They are comfortable in many different environments and with people of different cultures, professions and beliefs. They are both maternal and paternal, young and old, and possess both rough and refined qualities. The person is shown in various settings such as sailing or hunting, and dressed in different clothing such as deer-skin leggings or snowshoes. Their life experiences have given them a deep understanding of the world and a desire to learn more.

The style is a portrait collage, featuring a diverse array of individuals. They are captured in moments of everyday life, portraying the many identities and experiences that make up a community. The subjects include farmers, mechanics, artists, gentlemen, sailors, Quakers, prisoners, fancy-men, rowdies, lawyers, physicians, and priests. Men and women of different ages, cultures, and backgrounds are shown. Some are shown in groups, shaking hands and sharing meals, while others are alone, pursuing their craft or trade. The collage represents the interconnectedness of humanity and the beauty in diversity.

027-081.text: I resist any thing better than my own diversity,Breathe the air but leave plenty after me,And am not stuck up, and am in my place.
caption: A colorful and diverse landscape with plenty of open space to breathe in. The image exudes humility and a sense of belonging in a natural environment.

The picture has a colorful and abstract style with a central shape surrounded by a variety of smaller shapes in different colors. The central shape represents diversity while the surrounding shapes represent individuals. The picture portrays a feeling of communal cooperation and individuality.

027-082.text: (The moth and the fish-eggs are in their place,The bright suns I see and the dark suns I cannot see are in their place,The palpable is in its place and the impalpable is in its place.)
caption: An image of a vast cosmic landscape with various natural elements like the suns, eggs, and insects arranged in their places. The visible and intangible things are all placed harmoniously.

The painting is an abstract piece done in the style of Surrealism. It features a moth and fish eggs in their proper place in a dreamy space. The sun is both seen and unseen, with the palpable and impalpable existing side-by-side in a harmonious balance.

027-083.text: 17These are really the thoughts of all men in all ages and lands, theyare not original with me,If they are not yours as much as mine they are nothing, or next to nothing,If they are not the riddle and the untying of the riddle they are nothing,If they are not just as close as they are distant they are nothing.
caption: An abstract image with many different shapes and colors representing the collective thoughts of all people across time and geography. The image emphasizes that these thoughts are not original to any one person and are only valuable if they are understood as shared experiences that bring us closer together. The image also suggests that these thoughts are both distant and close, serving as a universal riddle waiting to be solved.

In a watercolor painting, people from diverse backgrounds and time periods are depicted thinking and holding their heads in contemplation. The colors and lines are fluid yet distinct, symbolizing that these thoughts are universal and interconnected.

027-084.text: This is the grass that grows wherever the land is and the water is,This the common air that bathes the globe.
caption: A close-up of a lush green lawn, surrounded by a river and mountains in the distance. The blue sky and sun are reflected in the water, and the grass appears to be waving gently in a warm breeze.

Minimalistic with subtle use of color. The image showcases long blades of grass in various shades of green, growing out of the ground near a small body of water. The sky is depicted in shades of blue with fluffy white clouds. The image also features a mirror-like image of the world, symbolizing the common air that bathes the globe.

027-085.text: 18With music strong I come, with my cornets and my drums,I play not marches for accepted victors only, I play marches forconquer’d and slain persons.
caption: An orchestra standing strong and tall with their cornets and drums in hand. The music they play is not just for the victorious but for those that have been defeated and those that have lost their lives.

In an expressive and dramatic composition, musicians play with their cornets and drums. Rather than a victorious melody, they play a solemn march to honor those who have been conquered and lost. The image has deep emotional connotations. The visual style could convey a sense of realism or a heightened drama with bold colors and exaggerated shapes.

027-086.text: Have you heard that it was good to gain the day?I also say it is good to fall, battles are lost in the same spiritin which they are won.
caption: A soldier standing on a battlefield, looking towards the sky with his arms open wide. He is equally content whether he has won or lost as he knows he has put in equal effort and spirit into the battle.

Surrealistic. A picture of two soldiers violently clashing with each other on a battlefield, completely immersed in their fighting spirit. In the background, a serene, purple sky contrasts with the chaos of the battle.

027-087.text: I beat and pound for the dead,I blow through my embouchures my loudest and gayest for them.
caption: A musician playing a lively and energetic piece of music, with a sorrowful expression as they play for the dead.

With a surrealistic visual style, a trumpet appears to be suspended in mid-air, surrounded by a flurry of swirling ribbons of sound in vibrant colors. The trumpet is there to symbolize the "beating and pounding" of the person playing it, who is dedicating their music to the dead.

027-088.text: Vivas to those who have fail’d!And to those whose war-vessels sank in the sea!And to those themselves who sank in the sea!And to all generals that lost engagements, and all overcome heroes!And the numberless unknown heroes equal to the greatest heroes known!
caption: An image of a monument or statue dedicated to the idea of honoring those who failed, lost battles, or perished in the sea. The monument stands as a tribute to all the great unknowns, too many to be counted, but just as heroic in their own right.

The photograph depicts a memorial wall with a monochromatic color scheme. The wall is covered with names of the fallen heroes from wars whose vessels sank in the sea, defeated generals, heroes who couldn't overcome the challenges they faced, along with unknown heroes who are equal to the greatest heroes known. The style used is a somber tone to respect the memory of those who have given their lives for others.

027-089.text: 19This is the meal equally set, this the meat for natural hunger,It is for the wicked just same as the righteous, I make appointmentswith all,I will not have a single person slighted or left away,The kept-woman, sponger, thief, are hereby invited,The heavy-lipp’d slave is invited, the venerealee is invited;There shall be no difference between them and the rest.
caption: A large banquet table is set and everyone is welcome to enjoy the food, regardless of their background or social status. The table is surrounded by a diverse group of people of different races, genders, and classes, all coming together to share a meal.

The photograph is styled in a realistic, gritty manner. It shows a large group of diverse people, gathered around an equally set table, filled with hearty food. There is no distinction between the people, as they all converse and enjoy each other’s company. A kept woman, sponger, thief, heavy-lipped slave, and a venerealee are all welcomed and included in the unifying event.

027-090.text: This is the press of a bashful hand, this the float and odor of hair,This the touch of my lips to yours, this the murmur of yearning,This the far-off depth and height reflecting my own face,This the thoughtful merge of myself, and the outlet again.
caption: An intimate, sensual scene between two individuals. The bashful person's hand is pressing against the other's skin while their hair emanates a pleasant scent. Lips are locked in a tender kiss while yearning and desire can be felt through soft murmurs. In the distance, a reflective surface mirrors their faces and the merging of their beings is apparent before separating once again.

The photograph is a close-up with a blur effect on the perimeter. A soft hand is gently pressing against tousled hair with a subtle scent. The image shows a pair of lips touching another's and the reverberation of their whispers. In the distance, there is a reflection of oneself, representing the unity of oneself with their surroundings.

027-091.text: Do you guess I have some intricate purpose?Well I have, for the Fourth-month showers have, and the mica on theside of a rock has.
caption: A picture of a person staring at the intricate design of a rock formation during a rainy day in the fourth month. The person is contemplating the beauty and purpose of nature.

The style would be impressionistic. The image would show a rainy day with a close-up on a rock containing mica. The rain showers would be visible in the background with blurred contours. The image would suggest an intricate purpose, echoing the complexity of nature's processes.

027-092.text: Do you take it I would astonish?Does the daylight astonish? does the early redstart twitteringthrough the woods?Do I astonish more than they?
caption: An image of nature unfolding in front of your eyes. The beauty of a redstart bird singing in the woods is just as astonishing as any other amazing phenomenon.

Abstract expressionism. An explosion of vibrant colors and sharp lines evoking the natural world. A sense of wonder and awe as the early morning light shines through the trees and the birds begin to chirp. The viewer is left to question their place in this world and their own capacity for astonishment.

027-093.text: This hour I tell things in confidence,I might not tell everybody, but I will tell you.
caption: A person leaning in close to whisper a secret into the ear of another person. The atmosphere is hushed and private, suggesting the importance and trust between the two individuals.
Minimalistic. A figure with a finger on the lips indicating secrecy, leaning in to whisper something into the ear of another figure.

027-094.text: 20Who goes there? hankering, gross, mystical, nude;How is it I extract strength from the beef I eat?
caption: An expressive portrait of a person with a curious and perplexed expression on their face, accompanied by an image of a raw piece of beef. The person seems to be wondering about the connection between the food they eat and their physical strength.

Surrealistic with vibrant colors. The picture depicts a mysterious, naked figure, with a large presence, staring towards the viewer. In front of them, hovering in mid-air, is a piece of meat, symbolizing their source of strength.

027-095.text: What is a man anyhow? what am I? what are you?
caption: A close-up of two faces, one questioning and one contemplative, looking at each other while surrounded by a vast and undefined world, evoking existential questions.

Surrealistic. The painting depicts a mirror with a reflection of a faceless, humanoid figure staring back at the viewer. The body appears to be made of various materials and textures, emphasizing the idea of a man's constructed identity.

027-096.text: All I mark as my own you shall offset it with your own,Else it were time lost listening to me.
caption: Two individuals standing across from each other and exchanging items. One person offers something they have marked as their own, while the other individual counterbalances by offering something of their own. The exchange represents the notion of reciprocity and the importance of giving and taking in relationships.
Minimalistic. An image of a set of weighing scales horizontally placed, with a hand reaching to lift one side while the other side is filled with miscellaneous items.

027-097.text: I do not snivel that snivel the world over,That months are vacuums and the ground but wallow and filth.
caption: A confident figure standing tall with a clear and upright posture, looking towards the bright sky while the chaotic world lays below.

A contrasting and surrealistic picture with an iridescent background, depicting a person standing firmly on the ground while the world itself seems to be snivelling behind them. The ground appears to be made of waste while the person stands tall representing resilience against chaos.

027-098.text: Whimpering and truckling fold with powders for invalids, conformitygoes to the fourth-remov’d,I wear my hat as I please indoors or out.
caption: The picture shows a person standing strong wearing a hat, while others are cowering and submitting beside them, holding boxes of medicine meant for the weak.

The visual style could be an avant-garde, abstract piece with elements of cubism. The artwork shows multiple versions of a person wearing a hat that looks whimsical indoors and outdoors. The figure seems to rebel against social conformity, represented by dull and colorless backgrounds, and away from shelves containing powders for the sickly.

027-099.text: Why should I pray? why should I venerate and be ceremonious?
caption: A person looking contemplative with their hands raised up in the air, trying to understand the concept of praying and paying respects.

Minimalist. A person stands with their arms crossed looking up at the sky, questioning why they should pray or partake in any formalities. The figure is surrounded by simple shapes and solid colors, conveying a sense of clarity and simplicity.

027-100.text: Having pried through the strata, analyzed to a hair, counsel’d withdoctors and calculated close,I find no sweeter fat than sticks to my own bones.
caption: An individual, having gone through extensive research and analysis, holds their hand to their chest in satisfaction. They have found their own personal sweet spot, gaining confidence in their own understanding of the subject matter.
In a minimalist style, a medical laboratory with a microscope and beakers, where a person is examining their own bone tissue through the microscope, with a look of contentment on their face.

027-101.text: In all people I see myself, none more and not one a barley-corn less,And the good or bad I say of myself I say of them.
caption: A series of mirrors reflecting the image of the same person infinitely, symbolizing the unity of humanity and the compassion that comes with recognizing oneself in others.

The photograph is taken from a bird-eye view angle of an observation deck filled with people, standing close together, looking down at a city bustling with life. The photograph has a mosaic effect, where each person is made up of several smaller pictures of people, symbolizing the line, "In all people I see myself". The photograph's color scheme is a playful mix of all hues, emphasizing diversity, a central theme of the stanza.

027-102.text: I know I am solid and sound,To me the converging objects of the universe perpetually flow,All are written to me, and I must get what the writing means.
caption: An image of a person standing with confidence, surrounded by the flow of the universe's infinite objects. All of these objects appear to be communicating with the person, who is determined to decipher their meaning.

In a surrealistic style, the picture shows a person standing on a rocky shoreline, with ocean waves crashing against the rocks around them. The person stands solid and confident, with a look of understanding as objects from the universe converge around them, including stars, galaxies, and planets. Each object has a unique symbol or design that expresses its meaning, which the person is able to decipher and understand.

027-103.text: I know I am deathless,I know this orbit of mine cannot be swept by a carpenter’s compass,I know I shall not pass like a child’s carlacue cut with a burntstick at night.
caption: A person standing with a confident and knowing expression, surrounded by carpenter's tools but with a compass untouched. In the background, a silhouette of a child holding a cut-out cardboard toy with sharp, burnt edges, representing the fleeting nature of mortal life.

The visual style is surrealist art. The image depicts a person with a glowing aura, encircled by a spiral pattern, standing in front of a night sky holding a compass. In the foreground, a wooden child's toy lies on the ground, severed in two with a burnt stick.

027-104.text: I know I am august,I do not trouble my spirit to vindicate itself or be understood,I see that the elementary laws never apologize,(I reckon I behave no prouder than the level I plant my house by,after all.)
caption: An image of a person standing confidently with their head held high, symbolizing pride and self-assurance. They stand near a modest home with a garden, indicating a humble nature. The person looks grounded and in touch with the natural world.

In a minimalistic style photograph, a person stands confidently in front of their home, built on level ground. They exude a sense of calm, knowing that their actions speak for themselves and do not require justification. The person fully embraces the natural laws of the world, without apology or need for validation.

027-105.text: I exist as I am, that is enough,If no other in the world be aware I sit content,And if each and all be aware I sit content.
caption: A person sits peacefully, looking content no matter who may or may not be around them.
Minimalistic. A person sitting cross-legged in a tranquil environment, perfectly content within themselves regardless of the presence or absence of others.

027-106.text: One world is aware and by far the largest to me, and that is myself,And whether I come to my own to-day or in ten thousand or tenmillion years,I can cheerfully take it now, or with equal cheerfulness I can wait.
caption: A calm and content individual stands at the center of the picture, surrounded by an expansive world. The figure is at peace with the present, and equally at peace with the uncertain future.

The photographic style is portrait with an individual standing at the edge of a cliff overlooking a vast, expansive landscape. The subject is lost in thought, contemplating their existence as a lone figure in an endless world.

027-107.text: My foothold is tenon’d and mortis’d in granite,I laugh at what you call dissolution,And I know the amplitude of time.
caption: A figure standing confidently on a solid granite base, laughing at the idea of complete disintegration with a clear understanding of the vastness of time.
Surrealist. A person with feet deeply rooted in solid granite, defiantly laughing at a dark and blurry background. An hourglass with sand flowing, indicating the perception and control of time.

027-108.text: 21I am the poet of the Body and I am the poet of the Soul,The pleasures of heaven are with me and the pains of hell are with me,The first I graft and increase upon myself, the latter I translateinto new tongue.
caption: An image showing the contrast between heaven and hell with a figure in the center holding and embracing both. The figure is seen grafting parts of heaven onto their body, growing and flourishing from its pleasures, while also translating the pains of hell into a new, transformative experience.

In a bold and abstract style, a single figure stands at the center of the image. The figure embodies both the body and soul, represented by two distinct levels. A vivid display of bright and dark shades mixed together symbolizes the joys and sorrows that are felt throughout the individual's life. The figure appears to be translating the pains of the dark side into something new and beautiful, represented by the brighter colors at the top.

027-109.text: I am the poet of the woman the same as the man,And I say it is as great to be a woman as to be a man,And I say there is nothing greater than the mother of men.
caption: A portrait of a person standing proudly, with one hand on their chest and the other raised in the air. The figure represents both genders equally and conveys the message that being a woman is just as significant as being a man. The image also portrays a strong emphasis on the importance of motherhood and the belief that it is the greatest role a person can have in creating and nurturing human life.

The visual style would be modern and abstract. A close-up portrait of a person with ambiguous gender features. The background is a mix of colors, symbolizing equality and diversity. The central focus is on the broad smile and the strong, confident gaze that exudes a sense of pride, strength, and equality.

027-110.text: I chant the chant of dilation or pride,We have had ducking and deprecating about enough,I show that size is only development.
caption: A muscular figure stands confidently, holding their arms up in pride. They are surrounded by smaller, scrawny figures who appear to be intimidated. The message is that physical size is a product of growth and development.

The picture appears contemporary. In the center, a person is standing with their arms extended high and wide, as if in celebration, and their face turned upward to the sky. The surrounding background seems to blend in a blue and purple haze, with shapes forming abstract patterns as they merge. The image conveys a message about pride and the importance of growth and size in human development.

027-111.text: Have you outstript the rest? are you the President?It is a trifle, they will more than arrive there every one, andstill pass on.
caption: An image of a marathon with many runners, where one runner is a little ahead. However, it is not a significant lead, as the rest of the runners are close behind and will likely catch up and continue running together.

Surrealism. An image of a crowded race of human-like figures running in a straight line with the exception of the front runner, who is a giant humanoid creature with a presidential sash draped across its chest. The creatures behind it seem unaware of the leader's existence, and are chasing after a glowing orange orb which symbolizes their ambition.

027-112.text: I am he that walks with the tender and growing night,I call to the earth and sea half-held by the night.
caption: The picture shows a person walking, surrounded by the soft, gentle darkness of the night. They are reaching out and calling to the earth and sea, as if embracing the natural world around them.

Magical realism style. A silhouette of a human figure is depicted walking on a beach during the sunset. The figure is extending their arms towards the earth and sea, as if calling them forth. Stars are twinkling in the sky and the night seems to be enveloping everything in a warm embrace.

027-113.text: Press close bare-bosom’d night--press close magnetic nourishing night!Night of south winds--night of the large few stars!Still nodding night--mad naked summer night.
caption: A dark and sultry night, with a clear sky scattered with a few bright stars. The atmosphere is charged with magnetism, and the night seems to be alive with energy. A feeling of madness and freedom permeates the air. The bare-chested figure, possibly a woman, seems to embrace and welcome the night.

Surrealist. In the foreground, a woman with a bare back is holding the dark, magnetic night close to her chest, with stars scattered in the background. The night is sultry and alive, with a touch of madness.

027-114.text: Smile O voluptuous cool-breath’d earth!Earth of the slumbering and liquid trees!Earth of departed sunset--earth of the mountains misty-topt!Earth of the vitreous pour of the full moon just tinged with blue!Earth of shine and dark mottling the tide of the river!Earth of the limpid gray of clouds brighter and clearer for my sake!Far-swooping elbow’d earth--rich apple-blossom’d earth!Smile, for your lover comes.
caption: A serene and tranquil earth with tall trees standing still, leaning towards the sky. The sun has just set, painting the sky in shades of orange and pink. The full moon is slowly rising and casting a blue hue across the earth's surface. The river is flowing peacefully and the clouds are gently passing by. The earth is adorned with blossoming apple trees and the air is filled with a pleasant fragrance. The earth is waiting for its lover to arrive with eagerness and delight.

An Impressionist painting with a blend of bright colors showcasing the beauty of nature. The painting features a river with trees and mountains in the background. In the foreground, there are apple blossoms and a full moon just starting to rise, with its blue light shining onto the earth. The overall mood of the painting is calm and serene, as if the earth is content and joyful with its surroundings.

027-115.text: Prodigal, you have given me love--therefore I to you give love!O unspeakable passionate love.
caption: An image of two people embracing, where one person is a prodigal who has been loved and is now returning that love passionately to the other.

Surrealist style. A man is embracing a formless entity with outstretched arms, which is radiating an aura of vibrant colors. Love, expressed through the vibrant colors, seems to swirl around them creating a fantastic and dreamlike atmosphere.

027-116.text: Thruster holding me tight and that I hold tight!We hurt each other as the bridegroom and the bride hurt each other.
caption: An image of two figures tightly holding onto one another. There is a sense of pain and intensity in their embrace, much like the intensity and passion between a bride and groom on their wedding night.

The visual style I would suggest is a modern abstract painting. The picture would be divided into two sections, both elongated and narrow, with one section representing the thruster and the other representing the speaker. The thruster section would be a bold and swirling mass of colors that conveys force and tension, while the speaker's section would be softer, with gentle curves and pastel colors. The two sections would meet in the middle, where they overlap and blend, symbolizing the mutual dependence and hurt that both parties are experiencing.

027-117.text: 22You sea! I resign myself to you also--I guess what you mean,I behold from the beach your crooked fingers,I believe you refuse to go back without feeling of me,We must have a turn together, I undress, hurry me out of sight of the land,Cushion me soft, rock me in billowy drowse,Dash me with amorous wet, I can repay you.
caption: A person standing at the beach, looking out at the sea with arms open wide. The sea has rough and uneven waves, and seems to be beckoning the person closer. The person seems willing to give in to the sea's embrace, ready to be rocked to sleep by its waves.

Surrealist. A figure lying on the edge of a beach with the sea in front of them, looking at the twisted and rough fingers of the waves as if they are alive. The figure partially undressed as if to go into the sea, with the sea beckoning them to come in. The waves appear as if they are wrapped around the figure's body, as if embracing them in a passionate way.

027-118.text: Sea of stretch’d ground-swells,Sea breathing broad and convulsive breaths,Sea of the brine of life and of unshovell’d yet always-ready graves,Howler and scooper of storms, capricious and dainty sea,I am integral with you, I too am of one phase and of all phases.
caption: A powerful ocean with tumultuous waves and an endless expanse. It is both a source of life and a graveyard, able to stir up violent storms or lay calm and unpredictable. A figure is shown, in tune with the sea, experiencing the same phases of life as represented by the ebb and flow of the water.

The photo is a stunning black and white seascape, capturing the essence of a dark stormy day at sea. The waves appear to be breathing heavily, rising and falling in unison with a powerful pulse. The picture gives the sense of an all-encompassing, overwhelming energy off the ocean, which is both breathtaking and foreboding. A fine art, impressionistic style gives the photo an ethereal and dreamlike quality.

027-119.text: Partaker of influx and efflux I, extoller of hate and conciliation,Extoller of amies and those that sleep in each others’ arms.
caption: An image of a figure standing in the middle of a flowing river, with their arms raised up high. On one side of the river, there are people hugging and showing signs of love, while on the other side, people are fighting and displaying signs of hate. The figure in the middle is celebrating both the love and hate, as well as the people sleeping in each other's arms.
Surreal. A figure standing in a river surrounded by the ebb and flow of the water. Above, a tangled mass of arms intermingled with bodies, displaying a combination of affection and enmity.

027-120.text: I am he attesting sympathy,(Shall I make my list of things in the house and skip the house thatsupports them?)
caption: A picture of a person with an arm extended in a gesture of attesting sympathy. In the background is a house that supports various objects, but is not highlighted or emphasized.

The visual style could be surrealism. The picture shows an open hand reaching out from a house made up of random household items. The hand appears to be declaring or testifying something to the world, inviting sympathy in return. The background is a blur, emphasizing the focus on the message being conveyed by the hand.

027-121.text: I am not the poet of goodness only, I do not decline to be the poetof wickedness also.
caption: A person with a dual nature, representing both good and evil.

The visual style is abstract.  The image is divided into two contrasting parts, with one half depicting a haloed angel and the other half portraying a dark and twisted demon. The overall message conveyed is that the artist is not limited to portraying just "goodness" but can also delve into darker and more complex themes.

027-122.text: What blurt is this about virtue and about vice?Evil propels me and reform of evil propels me, I stand indifferent,My gait is no fault-finder’s or rejecter’s gait,I moisten the roots of all that has grown.
caption: There is an image of a silhouette standing tall and indifferent. A black ink spill is propelling the figure forward on one side while a white ink spill is propelling the figure forward on the other side. The figure waters the roots of all the plants at their feet.

In an expressionist style, a lone figure standing amidst a chaotic and turbulent world. The figure appears to be indifferent while being propelled forward by the forces of evil and the desire for reform. The figure's actions are not judgmental, but nurturing, as they appear to tenderly water the roots of everything around them.

027-123.text: Did you fear some scrofula out of the unflagging pregnancy?Did you guess the celestial laws are yet to be work’d over and rectified?
caption: A person with a concerned expression, looking up towards the sky where planets are orbiting irregularly. The person is contemplating the hidden workings of the universe and questioning if they are flawed.

Surrealistic. In this picture, we see a pregnant woman standing in front of a large celestial sphere. The sphere is cracked, emanating light revealing a celestial body in flux. The woman appears anxious and fearful as she contemplates the ordering of the cosmos.

027-124.text: I find one side a balance and the antipedal side a balance,Soft doctrine as steady help as stable doctrine,Thoughts and deeds of the present our rouse and early start.
caption: A picture split in half diagonally with one side depicting a scale in perfect balance and the other side showing a figure in a meditative position, demonstrating balance in thoughts and deeds. The sun is rising in the background.

In the pop-art style, a picture of a person standing confidently on a tightrope that extends from one side of the image to the other. The tightrope represents balance, with bold and vibrant colors on both sides of the image. The person is looking forward with determination in their eyes, with the sun rising in the background, symbolizing the early start mentioned in the stanza.

027-125.text: This minute that comes to me over the past decillions,There is no better than it and now.
caption: A picture of a person embracing the present moment with open arms, while leaving the past behind.
Using a minimalistic visual style, a clock is shown with its second hand ticking. The focus is on the present moment and its significance.

027-126.text: What behaved well in the past or behaves well to-day is not such wonder,The wonder is always and always how there can be a mean man or an infidel.
caption: The picture shows an old, ancient artifact that has weathered the test of time. However, it is surrounded by mean, infidel people who seek to destroy it. The wonder lies in how something good and pure can exist in the midst of so much negativity.

Surrealism. A human silhouette looking out into a vast and abstract universe, contemplating the paradox that while many individuals have acted with decency and logic, there are those who choose to act in despicable ways.

027-127.text: 23Endless unfolding of words of ages!And mine a word of the modern, the word En-Masse.
caption: In the center of the picture, a hand is holding a book with infinite pages, representing the endless unfolding of words of ages. On the left side, modern buildings are visible, symbolizing the word En-Masse.
Minimalist. A towering stack of ancient, weathered books with a single modern book standing out in bright contrast.

027-128.text: A word of the faith that never balks,Here or henceforward it is all the same to me, I accept Time absolutely.
caption: A picture of a person standing with open arms on the edge of a cliff, overlooking a vast and beautiful landscape. The person has a serene expression on their face, indicating a deep faith and acceptance of the passage of time, regardless of the present or future.
Minimalistic. An image of an hourglass with white sand running down to the bottom half indicating the passing of time. A person's hand accepting the flow of sand.

027-129.text: It alone is without flaw, it alone rounds and completes all,That mystic baffling wonder alone completes all.
caption: A perfect circle made up of a mysterious and enthralling pattern that seems to have no beginning or end. The circle represents completion and wholeness, and is the ultimate representation of perfection.
Surrealistic. A perfect sphere that shines brightly, hovering in the center of a dark and mysterious room, surrounded by incomplete fragmented shapes.

027-130.text: I accept Reality and dare not question it,Materialism first and last imbuing.
caption: An individual standing tall amidst the chaos of the world, accepting and embracing the materials around them without questioning their purpose.

Minimalistic. A person standing with arms folded across their chest and gazing blankly ahead, accepting their reality. The background is plain and monochromatic to emphasize the simplicity of the subject. The person appears to be immovably anchored in staunch acceptance of their materialistic beliefs.

027-131.text: Hurrah for positive science! long live exact demonstration!Fetch stonecrop mixt with cedar and branches of lilac,This is the lexicographer, this the chemist, this made a grammar ofthe old cartouches,These mariners put the ship through dangerous unknown seas.This is the geologist, this works with the scalper, and this is amathematician.
caption: The painting depicts a group of people, each engaged in their own field of scientific study. One person collects stonecrop and cedar, while another studies cartouches. The sailors navigate hazardous waters, the geologist studies rocks, the chemist experiments with chemicals and the mathematician solves equations. The focus is on the celebration of science and the pursuit of knowledge.

The visual style can be a collage of various pictures, all put together in one frame. The pictures would include a scientist in a lab coat with test tubes, a person holding a large book, a group of sailors on a ship, and a person measuring rock formations. The collage can be made in a colorful and vibrant style to depict the excitement and thrill of various fields of science.

027-132.text: Gentlemen, to you the first honors always!Your facts are useful, and yet they are not my dwelling,I but enter by them to an area of my dwelling.
caption: A gathering of men in formal attire. One man stands out from the group, smiling and holding his hands out in appreciation. He appears to be passing through the group to enter into a grand and expansive area that is his true dwelling.

Surrealism. An image of a group of older men in suits with their faces melting and merging together to form a door. Through the door, a beautiful and strange world filled with colors and abstract shapes awaits.

027-133.text: Less the reminders of properties told my words,And more the reminders they of life untold, and of freedom and extrication,And make short account of neuters and geldings, and favor men andwomen fully equipt,And beat the gong of revolt, and stop with fugitives and them thatplot and conspire.
caption: The picture depicts a person pointing to reminders of life and freedom, and ignoring the reminders of material possessions. The person values both men and women equally, and encourages rebellion and escape.

A minimalist painting with abstract shapes in bold colors, symbolizing the struggle for freedom and independence. The shapes are arranged in a way that suggests the breaking of chains and the defiance of authority. The painting captures the spirit of rebellion and the quest for transcendence, with no regard for gender or social conventions.

027-134.text: 24Walt Whitman, a kosmos, of Manhattan the son,Turbulent, fleshy, sensual, eating, drinking and breeding,No sentimentalist, no stander above men and women or apart from them,No more modest than immodest.
caption: A portrait of a man with a wild, untamed appearance, representing the city he comes from. He embodies the raw physicality of life: eating, drinking, and engaging in procreation without shame. He doesn't hold himself above anyone else, but rather sees himself as an equal part of the human experience.

A black and white portrait photograph of a man with a rugged appearance, gazing directly at the camera with a confident & assertive expression. He appears to be consumed by life's indulgences- eating, drinking, and carnality. His demeanor reveals that he's not morally above anyone, nor does he try to be. The portrait captures his raw essence, unapologetically embracing every aspect of his being.

027-135.text: Unscrew the locks from the doors!Unscrew the doors themselves from their jambs!
caption: A pair of hands forcefully unscrewing a door lock with determination, and then proceeding to unscrew the door itself from its jambs.

The style of the picture would be modern or surrealistic. The picture would show a pair of disembodied hands unscrewing the locks from a large, ornate door. The doors would appear to be ethereal, with an otherworldly quality to them.

027-136.text: Whoever degrades another degrades me,And whatever is done or said returns at last to me.
caption: A chain reaction of people degrading one another, with each link in the chain connected to the next through a destructive force. At the end of the chain stands the artist, affected by every degrading action as they reflect upon the impact of their own behavior.

The photo is edited to look like a ripple effect in a lake. In the center of the photo, there is a person who appears to be degrading someone else. As the ripples move outwards, the person degrading the other becomes smaller and smaller until they are only a tiny dot at the edge of the photo. This image represents the idea that whatever negative actions and words we use towards others will eventually come back to us. It is done in a modern and abstract style, using cool toned blues and grays as the primary color palette to showcase a sense of tranquility.

027-137.text: Through me the afflatus surging and surging, through me the currentand index.
caption: A painting that depicts an intense surge of energy flowing through a person's body. The person's body is a conduit for this energy and the painting suggests that the energy is powerful and transformative.
Abstract expressionism. A vibrant, electric energy emanating from a central point, directing the flow of swirling colors and forms radiating in every direction.

027-138.text: I speak the pass-word primeval, I give the sign of democracy,By God! I will accept nothing which all cannot have theircounterpart of on the same terms.
caption: A determined figure standing with their hand raised in a gesture of inclusivity and equality for all.

In the Pop Art style, an image of two people standing together with their arms intertwined, fists raised in the air as a symbol of unity and democracy. The background is a bright, bold color such as yellow, with some text or symbol representing the "pass-word primeval."

027-139.text: Through me many long dumb voices,Voices of the interminable generations of prisoners and slaves,Voices of the diseas’d and despairing and of thieves and dwarfs,Voices of cycles of preparation and accretion,And of the threads that connect the stars, and of wombs and of thefather-stuff,And of the rights of them the others are down upon,Of the deform’d, trivial, flat, foolish, despised,Fog in the air, beetles rolling balls of dung.
caption: A collage of faces, some with expressions of sorrow and desperation. There are images of people who have been imprisoned or enslaved, along with dwarfs and thieves. The stars are connected by threads, and there are images of wombs and fathers. Other images include those of the deformed, the despised, and a beetle rolling a ball of dung.

The style of the picture is expressionistic. The image shows a set of intertwined, writhing figures twisted in agony. The backdrop is a swirling mass of scarlet and black, symbolizing despair and hopelessness. Bugs are scattered throughout the image, rolling balls of dung and adding an extra element of bizarre chaos.

027-140.text: Through me forbidden voices,Voices of sexes and lusts, voices veil’d and I remove the veil,Voices indecent by me clarified and transfigur’d.
caption: A figure stands in the center, their arms outstretched and head raised high. Clouds swirl around them, obscuring various images of taboo acts and desires. However, as the figure lifts their arms, the clouds start to part, revealing transformed and purified versions of these desires.

In an abstract style, the picture depicts a person with their hands placed over their ears, while multiple distorted, ghostly faces are shown whispering indecent and forbidden secrets in the background. However, as the person removes their hands from their ears, the faces are transformed into beautiful, ethereal beings.

027-141.text: I do not press my fingers across my mouth,I keep as delicate around the bowels as around the head and heart,Copulation is no more rank to me than death is.
caption: A person is depicted holding their index finger to their lips in a "shh" motion. The insides of the body are highlighted, with special emphasis placed on the heart and gut areas. The person shows signs of acceptance towards the universal experiences of both copulation and death.

Surrealistic. An abstract representation of a human body, the head and heart surrounded by delicate flowers, while the fingers are pressing on the bowels. The body is suspended in the air and surrounded by contrasting colors and textures, representing the equal importance and acceptance of both sexuality and mortality.

027-142.text: I believe in the flesh and the appetites,Seeing, hearing, feeling, are miracles, and each part and tag of meis a miracle.
caption: An image of a person experiencing the beauty of the world through their physical senses. The person is in awe of their ability to see, hear, and feel, seeing each part of their body as a miraculous creation.
Surrealist. An abstract depiction of various body parts and organs floating against a dark background, with bright colors illuminating each part like a miracle.

027-143.text: Divine am I inside and out, and I make holy whatever I touch or amtouch’d from,The scent of these arm-pits aroma finer than prayer,This head more than churches, bibles, and all the creeds.
caption: A person standing with arms outstretched, head raised to the sky, in a state of divine ecstasy. The air around them is filled with a beautiful fragrance, transforming everything it touches into something sacred. The power of their spiritual energy is greater than any church, Bible, or religious doctrine.

The visual style would be surrealism. The picture would depict a human figure with a divine aura surrounding them. The figure is shown touching something, which has been transformed into a holy object. The arm-pits of the figure emit a beautiful scent, which creates a mystical atmosphere. The head of the figure is larger than life and overshadowing all churches, bibles, and creeds.

027-144.text: If I worship one thing more than another it shall be the spread ofmy own body, or any part of it,Translucent mould of me it shall be you!Shaded ledges and rests it shall be you!Firm masculine colter it shall be you!Whatever goes to the tilth of me it shall be you!You my rich blood! your milky stream pale strippings of my life!Breast that presses against other breasts it shall be you!My brain it shall be your occult convolutions!Root of wash’d sweet-flag! timorous pond-snipe! nest of guardedduplicate eggs! it shall be you!Mix’d tussled hay of head, beard, brawn, it shall be you!Trickling sap of maple, fibre of manly wheat, it shall be you!Sun so generous it shall be you!Vapors lighting and shading my face it shall be you!You sweaty brooks and dews it shall be you!Winds whose soft-tickling genitals rub against me it shall be you!Broad muscular fields, branches of live oak, loving lounger in mywinding paths, it shall be you!Hands I have taken, face I have kiss’d, mortal I have ever touch’d,it shall be you.
caption: A picture of the human body, with each part contributing to the whole. The picture shows a mixture of natural elements such as fields, wind, and streams, along with human parts like the brain, blood, and breasts. The picture evokes a sense of unity between the human body and nature.

The visual style is surreal. A figure of a person made up of various natural elements such as wheat, hay, and sweet-flag, standing in a field of live oak trees. The milky way fills the sky above, and streams of light filter down to spotlight the figure. Each component of the figure fades into one another, seamlessly blending together to create a dream-like and otherworldly scene.

027-145.text: I dote on myself, there is that lot of me and all so luscious,Each moment and whatever happens thrills me with joy,I cannot tell how my ankles bend, nor whence the cause of my faintest wish,Nor the cause of the friendship I emit, nor the cause of thefriendship I take again.
caption: A person is standing in front of the ocean with their arms wide open, basking in the joy of being alive. They are completely enamored with themselves and everything that surrounds them. The small details of their body and their desires are a source of pleasure and fascination.

Surrealism. The image is of a person made up of multiple, fragmented versions of themselves, expressing their infatuation with themselves. The figure is surrounded by vibrant, pulsating colors and patterns that represent the joy they feel in each moment. The body language is fluid, with the ankles bent in an almost inhuman way, adding to the surreal and dreamlike atmosphere.

027-146.text: That I walk up my stoop, I pause to consider if it really be,A morning-glory at my window satisfies me more than the metaphysicsof books.
caption: A person standing in front of a stoop, looking at a morning-glory plant growing by their window. The person is contemplating the satisfaction they feel from nature's beauty compared to the complexity of philosophical concepts found in books.

The visual style is Impressionist. The picture shows a house with a stoop and a window. A person is standing on the stoop staring at a morning glory hanging from the window. In the background, there are stacks of open books, symbolizing metaphysics. The overall tone is one of peaceful contemplation and appreciation of nature.

027-147.text: To behold the day-break!The little light fades the immense and diaphanous shadows,The air tastes good to my palate.
caption: A beautiful landscape picture of a sunrise with the little light of dawn dissolving the large dark shadows. The picture gives a sense of freshness as if the air holds a pleasant taste.

Impressionistic. The picture shows a serene, misty morning with hints of sunlight appearing on the horizon. The shadows of the trees and structures around are still predominant but slowly thinning out. The soft glow of the light and the fresh morning air invoke a sense of peacefulness that can almost be tasted.

027-148.text: Hefts of the moving world at innocent gambols silently risingfreshly exuding,Scooting obliquely high and low.
caption: A view from high above the earth, with a lush green landscape extending below. Playful clouds dance and drift across the sky in every direction, some soaring high, while others descend gracefully towards the horizon. The panorama is a testament to the beauty and vitality of the natural world.

Abstract expressionism. A colorful depiction of the world's movements, with various hefts and sizes appearing to dance playfully. The shapes glide and soar, rising and falling in silence, and emitting fresh, vibrant energy along their path. Some of them even move at seemingly impossible angles as they navigate through space.

027-149.text: Something I cannot see puts upward libidinous prongs,Seas of bright juice suffuse heaven.
caption: A vibrant explosion of color and light emanating from an unseen force. The sky is filled with a radiant, almost electric energy that lifts everything in its reach.
Surrealism. A depiction of abstract prongs reaching upwards on a background of a bright, colorful, and flowing sea of juice.

027-150.text: The earth by the sky staid with, the daily close of their junction,The heav’d challenge from the east that moment over my head,The mocking taunt, See then whether you shall be master!
caption: A photograph of a sunset, with the horizon line where the earth meets the sky. In the background, the sun seems to be rising up on the other side of the earth. The photograph captures the moment when the sun has just risen and seems to be challenging the viewer to take mastery over the new day.

The visual style would be dramatic and illustrative. A powerful image of the earth and sky meeting at the horizon, with dramatic clouds overhead. In the foreground, a person stands with arms raised to the sky, as if challenging the world. In the distance, the sun rises from the east, casting a fiery glow over the whole scene.

027-151.text: 25Dazzling and tremendous how quick the sun-rise would kill me,If I could not now and always send sun-rise out of me.
caption: In the picture, a person is standing in front of a brilliant sunrise, holding their hand out as if to capture its essence. The sunrise represents their life force, without which they would perish.
Surrealism. A figure standing on a hill at dawn with the sun rising rapidly behind them. Rays of light shoot out of their body, illuminating the dark valley below.

027-152.text: We also ascend dazzling and tremendous as the sun,We found our own O my soul in the calm and cool of the daybreak.
caption: A breathtaking sunrise illuminating a mountain range, with a shadowy figure standing at the summit, gazing out at the world below in wonder and fulfillment.

A photograph created in the style of impressionism, depicting a sunburst at the break of dawn, with warm and vibrant colors. A figure is ascending towards the light, their pose and expression are peaceful and serene, as if they found their true self.

027-153.text: My voice goes after what my eyes cannot reach,With the twirl of my tongue I encompass worlds and volumes of worlds.
caption: A person standing on a mountaintop with their arms outstretched and their mouth open wide, as if trying to reach the unreachable. The vastness of the world surrounds them, stretching out into infinity.
In a surrealistic style, an abstract image of a figure's tongue elongating far beyond the range of their eyes, creating swirls and twists that encompass an entire galaxy of worlds and volumes.

027-154.text: Speech is the twin of my vision, it is unequal to measure itself,It provokes me forever, it says sarcastically,Walt you contain enough, why don’t you let it out then?
caption: An image of a person with wide-open eyes looking into the distance, perhaps standing on a hilltop or high place. The person's expression and body language suggest they are deep in thought or contemplation. The image also includes speech bubbles coming from the person's mouth with a sarcastic tone, urging the person to speak their mind.

Pop Art style. The picture shows a headshot of a man with a thought bubble overhead, in which a speech bubble is placed. The speech bubble mimics the way it is written, with bold and colorful letters. The man in the picture appears to be deep in thought, with a sarcastic thought cloud that seems to be "talking back" to him.
