027-249.text: Man or woman, I might tell how I like you, but cannot,And might tell what it is in me and what it is in you, but cannot,And might tell that pining I have, that pulse of my nights and days.
caption: Surrealism. Two shadowy figures (man and woman) standing in front of each other, unable to speak or communicate. The background is a clock that appears to be melting, symbolizing their inability to express their desire for each other, and the pain and longing that consumes them day and night.

The picture is of two individuals facing each other with a barrier in between them, unable to express their feelings. The barrier symbolizes the inability to communicate emotions and the longing that persists day and night. The photograph has a dark and moody filter.

027-250.text: Behold, I do not give lectures or a little charity,When I give I give myself.
caption: Minimalist. A person holding out their heart to another.
Minimalist. A hand giving a full-body reflection.

027-251.text: You there, impotent, loose in the knees,Open your scarf’d chops till I blow grit within you,Spread your palms and lift the flaps of your pockets,I am not to be denied, I compel, I have stores plenty and to spare,And any thing I have I bestow.
caption: With a pop-art style, a close-up of a hand pulling open the pockets of a pair of jeans, while colorful, abstract clouds surround them. The hand is holding a bag of something and looking forward, determined.

This would be a street photography-style picture of a confident person looking straight ahead. They stand in front of a person who is slouching and looking down, with their hands in their pockets, and the confident person is reaching into their purse or pocket, giving the impression that they are about to hand over something to the other person.

027-252.text: I do not ask who you are, that is not important to me,You can do nothing and be nothing but what I will infold you.
caption: Minimalist. A person holding out their hand with a welcoming gesture towards the viewer.
Surrealist. An image of two beings, one being larger and embracing the other, emphasizing the lack of importance of individual identity in the larger scheme of things.

027-253.text: To cotton-field drudge or cleaner of privies I lean,On his right cheek I put the family kiss,And in my soul I swear I never will deny him.
caption: Surrealist. The image shows a person leaning towards the face of a worker with a cotton field in the background. The worker's right cheek is being kissed by the person, and images of souls are floating around.

Social realism photography of someone embracing a cotton-field drudge or a cleaner of privies with a kiss on their right cheek, while the person taking the photograph (presumably the speaker of the stanza) internally vows never to deny him.

027-254.text: On women fit for conception I start bigger and nimbler babes.(This day I am jetting the stuff of far more arrogant republics.)
caption: Avant-garde abstract. Colors swirl and blend into a chaotic yet beautiful whole. A small abstract shape at the center grows and distorts, until it finally explodes into an enormous structure with many diverse parts, representing the potential for greatness in future generations.

Futuristic digital art style. The picture depicts a pregnant, athletic woman with enhanced strength, leaping forward into the air, representing evolved human society. The image is surrounded by a technologically advanced city or republic.

027-255.text: To any one dying, thither I speed and twist the knob of the door.Turn the bed-clothes toward the foot of the bed,Let the physician and the priest go home.
caption: Surrealism style. A figure, ideally depicted as a shadow, rushes through a door while turning the bed around so that it faces downwards. A doctor and priest fade away in the backdrop.
Photorealistic. A figure cloaked in black enters a dimly lit room and turns the bed-clothes back while a doctor and priest stand by the doorway.

027-256.text: I seize the descending man and raise him with resistless will,O despairer, here is my neck,By God, you shall not go down! hang your whole weight upon me.
caption: A black and white photograph of two people in a dark alleyway. One person is falling and the other is lifting them up with determination and strength.
Using a chiaroscuro lighting technique, a person's hand reaching down to grab someone, pulling them up with determination on their facial expression.

027-257.text: I dilate you with tremendous breath, I buoy you up,Every room of the house do I fill with an arm’d force,Lovers of me, bafflers of graves.
caption: Surrealist. An enormous figure with a gaping mouth exhaling wind and surrounded by an army in a domestic space. People who appreciate this figure are present and grave robbers are confounded.

In the style of abstract expressionism, various hues and shades of color swirl together in a chaotic, yet cohesive composition. The painting evokes a powerful emotion that uplifts and empowers the viewer, taking over every corner of the space it is displayed in. The intensity of the image hints at defiance in the face of death and an unwavering love for life.

027-258.text: Sleep--I and they keep guard all night,Not doubt, not decease shall dare to lay finger upon you,I have embraced you, and henceforth possess you to myself,And when you rise in the morning you will find what I tell you is so.
caption: Hyperrealism: A person (the speaker) hugging a sleeping figure (the listener) in bed, keeping watch throughout the night. Outside the window, the sun is rising and a menacing figure (doubt, decease) is retreating into darkness as the sun emerges.

The visual style could be impressionistic. The picture depicts a sleeping person with a vigilant guardian watching over them. Death and doubt stand at the door and the sleeping person is embraced by the safety and security of the vigilant guard.

027-259.text: 41I am he bringing help for the sick as they pant on their backs,And for strong upright men I bring yet more needed help.
caption: In an abstract expressionist style, a figure extends a helping hand both to a frail patient lying on their back and to a sturdy standing person, both accepting needed help.

Photography style: Black and white documentary. 

The picture shows a figure standing, holding a first aid kit-looking container. In the foreground, there are people lying on their backs, looking exhausted and sickly. In the background, there are strong, upright men looking on with anticipation as the figure approaches with aid.

027-260.text: I heard what was said of the universe,Heard it and heard it of several thousand years;It is middling well as far as it goes--but is that all?
caption: Surrealism. A person's ear getting larger and larger, listening to the sounds of the universe. The background is an abstract mix of stars and galaxies.

This photo would be surrealistic. A person stands in front of a vast, swirling galaxy, listening to whispers that seem to have been spoken for thousands of years. The person seems dissatisfied and wonders if this is all there is to the universe.

027-261.text: Magnifying and applying come I,Outbidding at the start the old cautious hucksters,Taking myself the exact dimensions of Jehovah,Lithographing Kronos, Zeus his son, and Hercules his grandson,Buying drafts of Osiris, Isis, Belus, Brahma, Buddha,In my portfolio placing Manito loose, Allah on a leaf, the crucifixengraved,With Odin and the hideous-faced Mexitli and every idol and image,Taking them all for what they are worth and not a cent more,Admitting they were alive and did the work of their days,(They bore mites as for unfledg’d birds who have now to rise and flyand sing for themselves,)Accepting the rough deific sketches to fill out better in myself,bestowing them freely on each man and woman I see,Discovering as much or more in a framer framing a house,Putting higher claims for him there with his roll’d-up sleevesdriving the mallet and chisel,Not objecting to special revelations, considering a curl of smoke ora hair on the back of my hand just as curious as any revelation,Lads ahold of fire-engines and hook-and-ladder ropes no less to methan the gods of the antique wars,Minding their voices peal through the crash of destruction,Their brawny limbs passing safe over charr’d laths, their whiteforeheads whole and unhurt out of the flames;By the mechanic’s wife with her babe at her nipple interceding forevery person born,Three scythes at harvest whizzing in a row from three lusty angelswith shirts bagg’d out at their waists,The snag-tooth’d hostler with red hair redeeming sins past and to come,Selling all he possesses, traveling on foot to fee lawyers for hisbrother and sit by him while he is tried for forgery;What was strewn in the amplest strewing the square rod about me, andnot filling the square rod then,The bull and the bug never worshipp’d half enough,Dung and dirt more admirable than was dream’d,The supernatural of no account, myself waiting my time to be one ofthe supremes,The day getting ready for me when I shall do as much good as thebest, and be as prodigious;By my life-lumps! becoming already a creator,Putting myself here and now to the ambush’d womb of the shadows.
caption: Surrealism. An image of a person wearing a magnifying glass around their neck, standing in front of a colorful, chaotic background. In the background are life-size lithograph prints of gods and goddesses from various cultures, snags-toothed hostelers, a mechanic's wife with a babe on her breast,  and angels whizzing scythes. The person in the foreground is holding a portfolio containing idols and images. The image represents the celebration of humanity, its diversity, and its flaws.

The photo is a surreal montage of various mythological gods and idols taken from various cultures and religions, brought together by an artist who's creatively interpreting them while staying true to their exact dimensions. The composition includes a powerful firefighter, a hardworking mechanic selling all he owns for his brother, and a host of other seemingly disparate but purposeful figures all occupying a square rod near the artist. The details are intricate and varied, with different textures of dung and dirt, angel's shirts blowing in the wind, and the artist waiting, poised to become a supreme creator.

027-263.text: 42A call in the midst of the crowd,My own voice, orotund sweeping and final.
caption: In a minimalistic style, the picture would show a lone man standing in a crowded street. He is in mid-sentence, with his mouth open wide and his arms outstretched as if he is projecting his voice to everyone around him.

Explosive and dramatic abstract expressionism. A solitary figure positioned in the center of the painting is passionately shouting amidst a chaotic crowd, with flowing circular strokes of various bright colors conveying a sense of urgency and finality.

027-264.text: Come my children,Come my boys and girls, my women, household and intimates,Now the performer launches his nerve, he has pass’d his prelude onthe reeds within.
caption: Photorealistic art piece. The performer stands on a stage, his body tense and ready to launch into movement. His audience, a diverse group of people, looks on with excitement and anticipation.

The image is a black and white photograph, taken at a crowded event, where a performer is standing with a musical instrument. The crowd is predominantly made up of children and women, with some men standing in the background. The artist looks confident and plays with emotion.

027-265.text: Easily written loose-finger’d chords--I feel the thrum of yourclimax and close.
caption: A minimalist abstract depiction of sound waves emanating from a guitar, with loose, abstract swirls representing the chords, and building to a crescendo of jagged lines at the pinnacle of the climax.
In an abstract expressionism style, a colorful illustration of a hand playing guitar chords with lines of energy emanating from the strings, ending in a vibrant burst of color.

027-266.text: My head slues round on my neck,Music rolls, but not from the organ,Folks are around me, but they are no household of mine.
caption: Surrealist. A person's head rotates on their neck as musical notes float and swirl around them. A group of people surrounds them, but they appear to be from a different world.
Surreal. A figure with a spinning head, musical notes and instruments swirling around them. The figure is surrounded by people who appear to be strangers.

027-267.text: Ever the hard unsunk ground,Ever the eaters and drinkers, ever the upward and downward sun, everthe air and the ceaseless tides,Ever myself and my neighbors, refreshing, wicked, real,Ever the old inexplicable query, ever that thorn’d thumb, thatbreath of itches and thirsts,Ever the vexer’s hoot! hoot! till we find where the sly one hidesand bring him forth,Ever love, ever the sobbing liquid of life,Ever the bandage under the chin, ever the trestles of death.
caption: Surrealism. A nightmarish dreamscape composed of hard, unsinkable terrain with suns rising and falling. There are figures of eaters, drinkers, and neighbors mixed together in a scifi-esque quest to find a hidden elusive figure. Meanwhile, life and death intersect in a series of chaotic and often unsettling ways.

Surrealism. A desert landscape with a hand sticking out of the ground, a group of people eating and drinking nearby, the sun is above and below, the air and tides are moving, there's a strange thorned thumb, and a mysterious creature hiding behind rocks. One person is crying while another is wearing a death mask.

027-268.text: Here and there with dimes on the eyes walking,To feed the greed of the belly the brains liberally spooning,Tickets buying, taking, selling, but in to the feast never once going,Many sweating, ploughing, thrashing, and then the chaff for paymentreceiving,A few idly owning, and they the wheat continually claiming.
caption: The photograph captures the busy city life of people selling and buying goods with coins in their palms, while a few wealthy individuals claim the profit of wheat harvested by the farmers sweating and toiling in the fields. The style is gritty and urban, emphasizing the disparities of wealth and labor.

This picture is a mixed media artwork with a busy marketplace in the foreground, where people are exchanging money and buying tickets, while in the background, hard-working farmers are seen sweating and reaping wheat with a few people enjoying the crop without putting in any effort.

027-269.text: This is the city and I am one of the citizens,Whatever interests the rest interests me, politics, wars, markets,newspapers, schools,The mayor and councils, banks, tariffs, steamships, factories,stocks, stores, real estate and personal estate.
caption: Shot in a gritty style with a wide-angle, is a bustling city street centering on a man in the middle of a crowded sidewalk. The various businesses and local government buildings in the background visualize the interests of its people that keep the man busy.

Realistic photography of a busy and bustling cityscape, dominated by towering skyscrapers and regular sidewalks. The city is in full swing, with citizens engaged in various activities such as politics, trade, education, and commerce.

027-270.text: The little plentiful manikins skipping around in collars and tail’d coatsI am aware who they are, (they are positively not worms or fleas,)I acknowledge the duplicates of myself, the weakest and shallowestis deathless with me,What I do and say the same waits for them,Every thought that flounders in me the same flounders in them.
caption: Surrealist. A group of little creatures in colorful outfits jumping and dancing around. One of them, a mirror reflection of the viewer, is standing still and staring, evidencing the concept that they are the same.

Surrealistic. The image displays a group of small manikins, dressed in formal attire, hop and skip playfully. As the camera zooms in on them, each manikin is revealed to be a miniature copy of the subject of the photograph, emphasizing the interconnectedness of all life.

027-271.text: I know perfectly well my own egotism,Know my omnivorous lines and must not write any less,And would fetch you whoever you are flush with myself.
caption: Pop Art. A person with a speech bubble above their head with the words "ME, ME, ME" in bold colors. The background is filled with lines of various shapes and sizes in explosive colors.

The picture depicts a person with their arms outstretched, flanked by lines of various objects, symbols and concepts that they desire. The portrait exudes self-importance and self-absorption with the subject's gaze focused on the viewer. The visual style could be pop art or contemporary art.

027-272.text: Not words of routine this song of mine,But abruptly to question, to leap beyond yet nearer bring;This printed and bound book--but the printer and theprinting-office boy?The well-taken photographs--but your wife or friend close and solidin your arms?The black ship mail’d with iron, her mighty guns in her turrets--butthe pluck of the captain and engineers?In the houses the dishes and fare and furniture--but the host andhostess, and the look out of their eyes?The sky up there--yet here or next door, or across the way?The saints and sages in history--but you yourself?Sermons, creeds, theology--but the fathomless human brain,And what is reason? and what is love? and what is life?
caption: An abstract picture that portrays the questioning of mundane aspects of existence. It presents diverse scenes, from a printed book to a powerful warship, but shifts the attention to what lies beyond the objects, implying a deeper and more profound meaning.

Surrealism. A photograph contains a series of images that are juxtaposed in a dream-like manner, including a book where the focus is on the printer and printing-office boy, a ship where the focus is on the captain and engineers, dishes where the focus is on the host and hostess, and the sky where the focus is on life's mysteries.

027-273.text: 43I do not despise you priests, all time, the world over,My faith is the greatest of faiths and the least of faiths,Enclosing worship ancient and modern and all between ancient and modern,Believing I shall come again upon the earth after five thousand years,Waiting responses from oracles, honoring the gods, saluting the sun,Making a fetich of the first rock or stump, powowing with sticks inthe circle of obis,Helping the llama or brahmin as he trims the lamps of the idols,Dancing yet through the streets in a phallic procession, rapt andaustere in the woods a gymnosophist,Drinking mead from the skull-cap, to Shastas and Vedas admirant,minding the Koran,Walking the teokallis, spotted with gore from the stone and knife,beating the serpent-skin drum,Accepting the Gospels, accepting him that was crucified, knowingassuredly that he is divine,To the mass kneeling or the puritan’s prayer rising, or sittingpatiently in a pew,Ranting and frothing in my insane crisis, or waiting dead-like tillmy spirit arouses me,Looking forth on pavement and land, or outside of pavement and land,Belonging to the winders of the circuit of circuits.
caption: This picture captures a person with various clothing garments from different cultures, engaging in various religious and secular practices. They may be depicted meditating under a tree, joining a procession, or participating in various rituals, all of which honor different gods and belief systems. The visual style is a blend of realism, surrealism, and impressionism, with bright colors and bold brushstrokes that convey energy and movement.

In a collage-like poster, a person is shown engaged in various religious and spiritual practices - lighting lamps, dancing in a phallic procession, praying in a church, beating a serpent-skin drum, and standing rapt in a forest. The poster is a mix of modern and ancient practices and various religious symbols.

027-274.text: One of that centripetal and centrifugal gang I turn and talk likeman leaving charges before a journey.
caption: Abstract Impressionism. A vibrant and colorful shot of a person spinning around with arms extended, as if engaged in a lively conversation with an invisible partner.

Cubist style. A person with their body turned in one direction, but their head turned to face the opposite direction, talking to a group of people. Their dialogue appears to be an exchange of ideas before setting out on a voyage.

027-275.text: Down-hearted doubters dull and excluded,Frivolous, sullen, moping, angry, affected, dishearten’d, atheistical,I know every one of you, I know the sea of torment, doubt, despairand unbelief.
caption: The style would be abstract expressionism. The image would depict a chaotic and dark ocean with various shapes and colors depicting emotions such as despair, doubt, and anger swirling around in it, all converging towards a central point where a figure stands, with his face painted to show "knowing" and confidence in the midst of it all.

The image is a close-up of a person surrounded by a sea of stormy and cloudy emotions. Doubt, despair, and disbelief seem to weigh heavy on the individual. The visual style is abstract with heavy contrast and saturation to emphasize the intensity of emotions.

027-276.text: How the flukes splash!How they contort rapid as lightning, with spasms and spouts of blood!
caption: Pop art style. An explosive and vibrant painting with a green and white whale tail in the center creating a splash with red and pink streaks around it, conveying the violent and rapid motion with a distressed texture.
Action photography with fast shutter speed. A whale's flukes soaring out of the water, splashing and contorting with violence, and blood spouting out in violent bursts.

027-277.text: Be at peace bloody flukes of doubters and sullen mopers,I take my place among you as much as among any,The past is the push of you, me, all, precisely the same,And what is yet untried and afterward is for you, me, all, preciselythe same.
caption: This would be a black and white photograph of a group of diverse people standing together peacefully, in silence. Their unique differences are united by their inclusivity of each other's experiences, pasts, and futures.
The image is a group of people standing together, as equals, and at peace with one another. A dense fog shrouds the background, while each person gazes toward the horizon with hopeful expression.

027-278.text: I do not know what is untried and afterward,But I know it will in its turn prove sufficient, and cannot fail.
caption: Abstract. A ray of light shining on an unknown, untried object. Its success is inevitable.
Surrealist. A person stands with a calm expression, but inside their body, there appears a mysterious, dark portal leading to an uncertain future, yet the person faces it with confidence.

027-279.text: Each who passes is consider’d, each who stops is consider’d, notsingle one can it fall.
caption: Photomontage style. A busy public street, with people of all ages, gender and race shown in a mosaic pattern of various emotions and expressions. Each person depicted has equal importance - the emphasis is on inclusivity and diversity, and the beauty of unique individuals.
With minimalistic and modern style, there is a dense stream of human silhouettes moving in a crowded space, each figure is equally considered, and the flow is unbroken.

027-280.text: It cannot fall the young man who died and was buried,Nor the young woman who died and was put by his side,Nor the little child that peep’d in at the door, and then drew backand was never seen again,Nor the old man who has lived without purpose, and feels it withbitterness worse than gall,Nor him in the poor house tubercled by rum and the bad disorder,Nor the numberless slaughter’d and wreck’d, nor the brutish koboocall’d the ordure of humanity,Nor the sacs merely floating with open mouths for food to slip in,Nor any thing in the earth, or down in the oldest graves of the earth,Nor any thing in the myriads of spheres, nor the myriads of myriadsthat inhabit them,Nor the present, nor the least wisp that is known.
caption: Surrealism. A desolate wasteland with a cemetery. A young couple lie in eternal slumber, and a small child tentatively peers in through the rusty gate. An old man sits alone, consumed by his bitterness, while a poor alcoholic lies in the gutter nearby. Amidst the vast expanse lie countless casualties of war, disease and destruction, and yet, in the midst of the chaos, a fragile orb floats to safety.

Surrealist style. A vast ocean with floating objects and creatures - a young man, young woman, little child looking in and pulling away, an old man with a sad expression, a poor man in a bathtub surrounded by alcohol bottles, countless destroyed ships, and thousands of mouths opened to catch food. In the distance, glowing spheres and planets with their own creatures and inhabitants.

027-281.text: 44It is time to explain myself--let us stand up.
caption: Minimalist. A person standing and gesturing forward with their hand, as if calling someone to stand up too.
Minimalist. The image shows two people standing up in front of each other. One seems to gesture towards the other as if about to speak.

027-282.text: What is known I strip away,I launch all men and women forward with me into the Unknown.
caption: Surrealistic. A group of people falling forward off a cliff edge, with their past selves stripped away by an unseen force.
Surrealist. A group of people floating through a void, with a few individuals being stripped of clothing and possessions while others hold hands and move forward into an abyss.

027-283.text: The clock indicates the moment--but what does eternity indicate?
caption: Surrealist. An old pocket-watch hanging off a tree, the hands spinning in opposite directions, while tree branches warp like ribbons.

A surrealist-inspired photograph of a clock with its hands pointing upwards. In the background, an infinite number of slightly blurred clocks fade into the distance, symbolizing the paradoxical nature of eternity.

027-284.text: We have thus far exhausted trillions of winters and summers,There are trillions ahead, and trillions ahead of them.
caption: An infinity sign on top of the image with an illustration of winter and summer landscapes that blend into each other, symbolizing the never-ending cycle of seasons.

In a minimalist or abstract style, two elongated shapes intertwine, representing the progression of time. Their lengths extend far beyond the borders, suggesting the vast expanse of the future and the countless seasons yet to come.

027-285.text: Births have brought us richness and variety,And other births will bring us richness and variety.
caption: Abstract. A collage of various colored circles seemingly dividing and expanding. Each circle represents a unique and diverse birth bringing richness and vitality to life.

A colorful depiction of newborns swaddled in blankets, resting peacefully in a nursery. The babies are diverse in ethnicity, gender, and size, symbolizing the richness and variety that new life brings.

027-286.text: I do not call one greater and one smaller,That which fills its period and place is equal to any.
caption: Minimalist. A black and white circular graphic with two equal halves, one curved upwards and one downwards, representing the equality of all things.
Minimalist. A black circle on a white canvas, representing equality and balance amongst all things.

027-287.text: Were mankind murderous or jealous upon you, my brother, my sister?I am sorry for you, they are not murderous or jealous upon me,All has been gentle with me, I keep no account with lamentation,(What have I to do with lamentation?)
caption: Surrealism. Two siblings, one with a dagger and the other with a look of fear. However, it is the figure in the background that dominates the scene, showing peace and calmness, with their hand outstretched, while the siblings are surrounded by clouds of sorrow.

Realistic. A person, likely the speaker, stands amidst a group of people who appear to be either angry or envious, while the speaker appears mournful or apologetic. Despite this, the speaker appears undisturbed by their surroundings.

027-288.text: I am an acme of things accomplish’d, and I an encloser of things to be.
caption: Minimalistic. The image is divided into two equal parts. The left has a check mark indicating a task completed (acme), while the right has a frame with a question mark (encloser).

Minimalist. A circle divided into halves; with one side filled with paintings, sculptures, and architecture, while the other half contains the outline of surreal, unimagined figures waiting to be brought to life.

027-289.text: My feet strike an apex of the apices of the stairs,On every step bunches of ages, and larger bunches between the steps,All below duly travel’d, and still I mount and mount.
caption: Surrealism photography style. A vast staircase, where each step shows different moments in time gathered in bunches, with the person ascending the stairs on the top.

This photographic portrait features a person's feet mid-step on a grand, spiraling staircase. The high-contrast capture presides over each step - every one a different dimension of time - as the feet continue to climb upward, leaving the ages behind.

027-290.text: Rise after rise bow the phantoms behind me,Afar down I see the huge first Nothing, I know I was even there,I waited unseen and always, and slept through the lethargic mist,And took my time, and took no hurt from the fetid carbon.
caption: Surrealism. A person stands on a path looking into the distance where an immense void rests. They stand tall as phantoms behind them rise and bow down. Oblivious to the chaos behind them, the figure stands resolute in their journey, taking their time despite surrounding danger.

The painting is in surrealism style. It features a person standing on a never-ending staircase with ghostly figures emerging behind them. The figure looks below to see an empty void and remembers being there before, waiting patiently through the mist, unaffected by the darkness around them.

027-291.text: Long I was hugg’d close--long and long.
caption:
Photography style: Close-up / Portrait. 
Subject: A person being hugged tightly by a loved one, conveying a warm and intimate embrace.
Surrealism. A pair of hands holding a person tightly, while the person appears to be melting into the hands.

027-292.text: Immense have been the preparations for me,Faithful and friendly the arms that have help’d me.
caption: Minimalist. A solitary figure standing in front of a vast and empty landscape. In the foreground, a hand extends, offering a helping hand, while in the background, preparations can be seen in the form of structures, vehicles, and various tools.

Surreal, with a large and towering object or structure on the left side of the image that represents the preparations made, while on the right side, a crowd of people with their arms outstretched resemble the faithful and friendly arms that have helped.

027-293.text: Cycles ferried my cradle, rowing and rowing like cheerful boatmen,For room to me stars kept aside in their own rings,They sent influences to look after what was to hold me.
caption: A surreal painting with a newborn baby in a cradle floating on a river with cheerful boatmen rowing, surrounded by stars keeping watch over it.

Surrealism. A baby's cradle that floats mid-air, with celestial bodies forming unique rings around the cradle's sides. Joyful boatmen row towards the cradle, and shooting stars reach out with glowing rays to safeguard the little one.

027-294.text: Before I was born out of my mother generations guided me,My embryo has never been torpid, nothing could overlay it.
caption: Surrealistic. A depiction of a maternal figure, holding a glowing embryo which is surrounded by ghostly apparitions of past family generations, guiding and protecting it.
Abstract. A bright light in the center of a dark void, surrounded by many tendrils that twist and turn before converging towards the light, suggesting guidance and unimpeded growth.

027-295.text: For it the nebula cohered to an orb,The long slow strata piled to rest it on,Vast vegetables gave it sustenance,Monstrous sauroids transported it in their mouths and deposited itwith care.
caption: A surrealistic landscape image of a giant orb seemingly made from gas and space debris held by prehistoric lizards that are carrying food in their mouths for the "living planet".

In a surrealistic style, a planet made of layers of different rocks and soils, sustained by giant vegetables with huge leaves towering over the scene. In the distance, a group of long-necked, prehistoric sauroids are carrying rocks in their mouths, in order to pile them on the planet's surface with great care.

027-296.text: All forces have been steadily employ’d to complete and delight me,Now on this spot I stand with my robust soul.
caption: Minimalist. A person standing on a hill, with a strong aura around them, and the sun shining down, casting long shadows across the landscape.
An abstract photo of light reflecting on water, captured at the perfect moment, with a central figure standing strong amidst the ripples.

027-298.text: 45O span of youth! ever-push’d elasticity!O manhood, balanced, florid and full.
caption: In the style of Pop Art, a vibrant and colorful close-up of a person's face in their mid-20s with bright, contrasting tones that highlight the energy and liveliness of youth. Their face is framed at a 45-degree angle, with their body in the background gradually fading into a balanced and stable position, signifying the transition from youth to manhood.

In the style of a cubist piece, a portrait of a person showing the transition from youth to adulthood. The left side is abstracted with jagged lines showing the elastic energy of youth, while the right side is a more realistic representation of a balanced and full-grown adult.

027-299.text: My lovers suffocate me,Crowding my lips, thick in the pores of my skin,Jostling me through streets and public halls, coming naked to me at night,Crying by day, Ahoy! from the rocks of the river, swinging andchirping over my head,Calling my name from flower-beds, vines, tangled underbrush,Lighting on every moment of my life,Bussing my body with soft balsamic busses,Noiselessly passing handfuls out of their hearts and giving them to be mine.
caption: The visual style is impressionist. The image is of a person surrounded by a swarm of floating figures. The figures are of people that suffocate the person with their touch, gathering around them and blur into one another - suggesting that they represent a collective rather than many individuals. The scene exudes both chaos and sensuality, as the figures swarm around the person, offering themselves up as a gift.

Using a somewhat abstract style, a collage of surreal imagery is shown, featuring a person with lips fused shut. Crowds of anonymous figures, naked and clothed, swarm around them, crying out day and night, while the person remains still and stoic. Birds flit around their head, and flowers, vines, and tangled underbrush all seem to grow out of their body.

027-300.text: Old age superbly rising! O welcome, ineffable grace of dying days!
caption: In the style of chiaroscuro, a black and white portrait of an elderly person with the wrinkles on their face artfully captured, exuding an air of dignity, while a soft light falls on the face, perhaps indicating the grace of dying days.

Surrealist. A painting that depicts an elderly person standing tall amidst a colorful and vibrant background. They are surrounded by floating clocks, signifying the inevitability of time, and their shadow is of a much younger individual - portraying the grace and wisdom of dying days.

027-301.text: Every condition promulges not only itself, it promulges what growsafter and out of itself,And the dark hush promulges as much as any.
caption: Abstract expressionism. The painting is divided in half - the left side is light and vivid, the right side is dark and brooding. The center of the painting is swirling with contrasting shades, forming a path leading from the dark to the light side.
In the style of black and white photography. An image of a seed that has grown into a bush. It is rooted in darkness and has grown towards an opening in the sky, bathed in light.

027-302.text: I open my scuttle at night and see the far-sprinkled systems,And all I see multiplied as high as I can cipher edge but the rim ofthe farther systems.
caption: A stunning photograph in surreal style, with a dark sky and brighter stars scattered across it. The stars go on forever, with no end in sight.

Astrophotography style. A starry sky, captured in the stillness of night, with numerous galaxies shining bright and twinkling in the far distant systems, stretching out beyond our observable universe.

027-303.text: Wider and wider they spread, expanding, always expanding,Outward and outward and forever outward.
caption: Futuristic. A swirling vortex or a time-lapse of a massive explosion, with rings of color expanding outwards endlessly.
Abstract art style. White and pastel colors fading into darker colors with sharp edges, representing an image of infinite expansion.

027-304.text: My sun has his sun and round him obediently wheels,He joins with his partners a group of superior circuit,And greater sets follow, making specks of the greatest inside them.
caption: Astrophotography. A close-up photo of the sun, surrounded by a vast number of stars and galaxies arranged in a circular pattern, with smaller specks barely visible inside them.

Astrophotography. A stunning picture of a bright sun shining in the center with other stars surrounding it in a cluster. Various sizes of stars are seen with some shining brightly like specks while the biggest sets show up as the most prominent.

027-305.text: There is no stoppage and never can be stoppage,If I, you, and the worlds, and all beneath or upon their surfaces,were this moment reduced back to a pallid float, it wouldnot avail the long run,We should surely bring up again where we now stand,And surely go as much farther, and then farther and farther.
caption: Hyperrealism. A hand reaching towards the sky with the earth cradled in the palm. The hand and earth are surrounded by a stretch of galaxies, nebulae, and stars, and the distance between them and the cosmic display is calculated to the millimeter.

Futuristic. A never-ending, spiral universe with stars whirling into the distance. A small planet rapidly expands, then collapses into itself, only to regenerate and continue to expand again in an infinite cycle.

027-306.text: A few quadrillions of eras, a few octillions of cubic leagues, donot hazard the span or make it impatient,They are but parts, any thing is but a part.
caption: The picture is a time-lapse of a vast universe, a few quadrillions of eras represented by the stars and galaxies in the foreground, and a few octillions of cubic leagues symbolized by the vast expanse of the universe in its background. The structure of time itself is represented through the hazy colors of the nebula and gaseous clouds.
Surrealist. A distorted clock with irregular numbers and shapes, stretching out into long octopus-like arms, while the background shows a futuristic, yet desolate space.

027-307.text: See ever so far, there is limitless space outside of that,Count ever so much, there is limitless time around that.
caption: Abstract. A zoomed-in view of a galaxy with a blending of colors portraying the vast, limitless space. A clock face at the center presents blurred hands to indicate the limitless time around it.

A minimalist black and white photograph of a person standing on the edge of a cliff, overlooking vast and endless landscapes of mountains, lakes, and forests. The photograph invokes a humbling sense of human scale and insignificance in comparison to the enormity of the world surrounding us.

027-308.text: My rendezvous is appointed, it is certain,The Lord will be there and wait till I come on perfect terms,The great Camerado, the lover true for whom I pine will be there.
caption: In the style of impressionism, the painting depicts a figure standing in the midst of a beautiful and lush meadow, with a feeling of joy and certainty evident in their posture and expression, as they look towards a distant point. The scenery is drenched in bright colours, and the sky above is painted with warm, energetic strokes.

A photograph using bokeh technique, with a blurry yet alluring background that has the sun setting on the horizon. In sharp focus, two figures are meeting under a big oak: they embrace, and their love is evident in their eyes.

027-309.text: 46I know I have the best of time and space, and was never measured andnever will be measured.
caption: Surrealistic. An image of a person floating in a cosmic space surrounded by galaxies and planets of various shapes and sizes. The person appears to exist outside of time and space, with no measurable physical dimensions.
In the style of abstract expressionism, a vibrant and colorful swirl of brushstrokes, portraying boundless time and limitless space.

027-310.text: I tramp a perpetual journey, (come listen all!)My signs are a rain-proof coat, good shoes, and a staff cut from the woods,No friend of mine takes his ease in my chair,I have no chair, no church, no philosophy,I lead no man to a dinner-table, library, exchange,But each man and each woman of you I lead upon a knoll,My left hand hooking you round the waist,My right hand pointing to landscapes of continents and the public road.
caption: Photographic style: Black and white journalistic photo. A lone person in a raincoat and hat walks along a dirt road while holding a walking stick, leading a group of people and pointing to a vast landscape ahead.

Photorealistic stained glass art style. A figure in a raincoat, hat, and hiking shoes walking through a colorful and vast landscape, leading a group of people up a hill while pointing towards great distances beyond.

027-311.text: Not I, not any one else can travel that road for you,You must travel it for yourself.
caption: Minimalist. A solitary person standing at the fork of a road, contemplating which path to take. No one else in sight.
Minimalist. A silhouette of a person standing at a fork in the road. The left road has footprints that lead to heartbreak and the right road is untouched.

027-312.text: It is not far, it is within reach,Perhaps you have been on it since you were born and did not know,Perhaps it is everywhere on water and on land.
caption: Landscape photography with an everywhere view. A shot taken from the top of the mountain range which spans a 360-degree view, encompassing both land and sea.

Postmodern. A vast and varied landscape stretching out before the viewer, but in the foreground, a single image repeated ad nauseam. Perhaps a sign on the horizon reads "you are here", but the viewer is unsure if it is the periphery of the scene or the very focus.

027-313.text: Shoulder your duds dear son, and I will mine, and let us hasten forth,Wonderful cities and free nations we shall fetch as we go.
caption: Photorealistic. A father and son, with their backs turned to the camera, hiking through a mountainous landscape. They are carrying their backpacks and walking towards a distant horizon with promise of exploration and excitement.
Photorealistic. In a vast green field, a father and son walk with backpacks on their shoulders, eager to explore the unknown as they trek through bustling cities and free nations.

027-314.text: If you tire, give me both burdens, and rest the chuff of your handon my hip,And in due time you shall repay the same service to me,For after we start we never lie by again.
caption: The visual would be photographed in a candid style with soft lighting. A hand resting on a hip suggestively. The subjects (who are potentially lovers) exchange burdens.

The photograph is in black and white, and it shows two people walking on a path. One of them appears tired and is leaning on the other. The second person has their hand on the first person's hip, and they are walking together towards the horizon.

027-315.text: This day before dawn I ascended a hill and look’d at the crowded heaven,And I said to my spirit When we become the enfolders of those orbs,and the pleasure and knowledge of every thing in them, shall webe fill’d and satisfied then?And my spirit said No, we but level that lift to pass and continue beyond.
caption: A black and white landscape photograph with a hill in the foreground and the starry night sky filling the image. The hill represents the limit of human knowledge and the vastness of the universe is shown beyond.

The image would be an over-exaggerated fantasy painting with the protagonist stood atop a hill overlooking a vibrant and busy galaxy above. The protagonist ponders the immense pleasure and knowledge that may be experienced by enclosing oneself around the orbs or galaxies; but their spirit replies with a negative response, indicating that the protagonist is merely passing through this level to obtain greater enlightenment beyond.

027-316.text: You are also asking me questions and I hear you,I answer that I cannot answer, you must find out for yourself.
caption: The picture is a close-up of two people conversing. One is asking a question, while the other is calmly looking into their eyes, implying that they don't have the answer, and it must be discovered personally. The visual style is in a surrealistic or abstract interpretation.

Surrealist. The picture shows a person standing in a room with multiple identical doors, each one leading to different paths. The person looks helpless and bewildered while listening to the whispers of different directions.

027-317.text: Sit a while dear son,Here are biscuits to eat and here is milk to drink,But as soon as you sleep and renew yourself in sweet clothes, I kiss youwith a good-by kiss and open the gate for your egress hence.
caption: The visual style is impressionism. The picture shows a mother and son having a picnic in a park, with a basket of biscuits and a bottle of milk on a blanket. The mother is kissing her son goodbye as he exits the park through an open gate.

The picture displays a cozy, warm room with a small child sitting at a wooden table with a glass of milk and plate of biscuits in front of them. A woman, presumably a mother, leans over the child to give them a goodnight kiss before opening the garden gate in the background, where the moon shines brightly, guiding the sleeping child on their journey.

027-318.text: Long enough have you dream’d contemptible dreams,Now I wash the gum from your eyes,You must habit yourself to the dazzle of the light and of everymoment of your life.
caption: Photorealistic with a touch of surrealism. The image depicts a person standing in front of a body of water, arms stretched out with water droplets falling from their fingertips. The person's eyes are closed, and their face is illuminated by a bright light shining down on them, washing away the "gum" from their eyes.
Surrealism. An individual being freed from a dream by the washing away of a gum-like substance from their eyes. They then become aware of the bright and illuminating world before them.

027-319.text: Long have you timidly waded holding a plank by the shore,Now I will you to be a bold swimmer,To jump off in the midst of the sea, rise again, nod to me, shout,and laughingly dash with your hair.
caption: With an abstract expressionism style, a person is shown timidly holding onto a board by the shore. Then they jump into the sea, swim confidently, and resurface with a laugh, having discarded the board.
A black and white photo of a person standing on the edge of a pier, hesitant about jumping in the water. In the second photo, the person jumps in the water with a big splash and a grin on their face.

027-320.text: 47I am the teacher of athletes,He that by me spreads a wider breast than my own proves the width of my own,He most honors my style who learns under it to destroy the teacher.
caption: The photograph is taken in high contrast black and white, emphasizing muscular athletes in various poses, with a teacher standing in the center with arms in the air. The athletes around the teacher are raising their arms and supposedly learning how to destroy their teacher's own accomplishments.
In a street art style, a gymnasium with a muscular athlete raising his arms in victory, with an inspirational quote about surpassing one's teacher next to him.

027-321.text: The boy I love, the same becomes a man not through derived power,but in his own right,Wicked rather than virtuous out of conformity or fear,Fond of his sweetheart, relishing well his steak,Unrequited love or a slight cutting him worse than sharp steel cuts,First-rate to ride, to fight, to hit the bull’s eye, to sail askiff, to sing a song or play on the banjo,Preferring scars and the beard and faces pitted with small-pox overall latherers,And those well-tann’d to those that keep out of the sun.
caption: Realistic painting. A boy standing tall with a determined expression, his physicality encapsulating his journey to manhood in his own way. His ruggedness and love for life reflected in his love for his girlfriend, a good steak, and proficiency in various activities such as archery, rowing, and music. He favors the natural battlescars of life over pristine appearances.

The photograph shows a man with scars on his face indicative of smallpox, a beard and a warm tan. He is wicked but in control of his own power, enjoying steak and singing songs on the banjo. He is a proficient fighter and sportsman, having no qualms with love unrequited or losing in battle.

027-322.text: I teach straying from me, yet who can stray from me?I follow you whoever you are from the present hour,My words itch at your ears till you understand them.
caption: Surrealist. A figure walks down a twisted and winding path, but a giant ear, representing the "itch" of understanding, appears in the sky, following and listening attentively.
Surrealist. A disembodied ear hovers, while a shadowy figure tries to move away but is connected to the ear via a tiny, taut thread.

027-323.text: I do not say these things for a dollar or to fill up the time whileI wait for a boat,(It is you talking just as much as myself, I act as the tongue of you,Tied in your mouth, in mine it begins to be loosen’d.)
caption: The picture is in modern and abstract art style. It shows two figures, one with a tied mouth and the other with a loosened mouth, seemingly deep in conversation. The exchange is intimate and the emotion is palpable.

The photograph captures two people in a deep conversation, with one person playing the role of the listener, who intently tries to comprehend the other's thoughts and ideas. The visual style is candid, as if the photographer happened to be passing by while the conversation took place.

027-324.text: I swear I will never again mention love or death inside a house,And I swear I will never translate myself at all, only to him or herwho privately stays with me in the open air.
caption: The photo appears to be a solitary figure standing in the middle of an empty field staring at the horizon. The sky is a mix of purples and oranges as the sun has set while the figure swears an oath under their breath. The photography style is black and white with an emphasis on tonal range.

The photo is minimalist with a single person standing in an open field with a serious expression. The focus is on the person, who is facing the camera, their back towards a house with a blurred foreground and background.

027-325.text: If you would understand me go to the heights or water-shore,The nearest gnat is an explanation, and a drop or motion of waves key,The maul, the oar, the hand-saw, second my words.
caption: A close-up photograph of a tiny gnat on a blade of grass by the water's edge. A wooden oar, an old hand-saw, and a hammer lay in the foreground.

This photo is taken from a high altitude overlooking a water-shore. In detail, the photo includes the presence of gnats, tiny drops of water, and the movements of waves. Tools, such as the maul, oar or hand-saw, represent the nature of the photo.

027-326.text: No shutter’d room or school can commune with me,But roughs and little children better than they.
caption: A closeup of a person's face with an empty classroom behind them. A group of rough looking people to the left and a group of children to the right, both groups looking lively and curious. The person in the center is smiling warmly, connecting more with the people outside the classroom than with their official colleagues. The style is realistic with a focus on facial expressions and body language.

Expressionistic. A figure standing alone in a vast open space, disconnected from the shuttered institutions behind. In the foreground, roughs and children play freely, enjoying their vibrant environment.

027-327.text: The young mechanic is closest to me, he knows me well,The woodman that takes his axe and jug with him shall take me withhim all day,The farm-boy ploughing in the field feels good at the sound of my voice,In vessels that sail my words sail, I go with fishermen and seamenand love them.
caption: Using the impressionist style, the picture is a panoramic landscape of a rural countryside with a river flowing through it. A young mechanic is standing in the foreground, holding tools with a smile, surrounded by a woodman with his axe and jug and a farm-boy plowing the field, all of whom are looking towards the river where a boat is sailing, carrying men and women who are sounding joyful at the water.

In a soft impressionist style, a series of images: a young mechanic with a warm smile, a woodman with an axe slung over his shoulder and a jug in hand, a farm-boy with a plow in hand and a slight smile on his face. Lastly, a scene of the ocean with boats and ships, all of them with spoken words floating above them.

027-328.text: The soldier camp’d or upon the march is mine,On the night ere the pending battle many seek me, and I do not fail them,On that solemn night (it may be their last) those that know me seek me.My face rubs to the hunter’s face when he lies down alone in his blanket,The driver thinking of me does not mind the jolt of his wagon,The young mother and old mother comprehend me,The girl and the wife rest the needle a moment and forget where they are,They and all would resume what I have told them.
caption: This would be a series of black and white photographs, captured using a documentary style. The images would feature soldiers resting and preparing for battle, hunters lying alone in their blankets, mothers pausing from their work, and others from different walks of life all seeking and finding the same thing - a sense of deep understanding that connects them all.

The photograph is captured in black and white, set during wartime. Soldiers are seen resting and walking on a bleak landscape. Family members at home pause in their daily tasks to think of their loved ones in the military. The image shows the bond between those fighting and the loved ones left behind, suspended in a moment of hope and sadness. The photograph captures the raw humanity of war.

027-329.text: 48I have said that the soul is not more than the body,And I have said that the body is not more than the soul,And nothing, not God, is greater to one than one’s self is,And whoever walks a furlong without sympathy walks to his ownfuneral drest in his shroud,And I or you pocketless of a dime may purchase the pick of the earth,And to glance with an eye or show a bean in its pod confounds thelearning of all times,And there is no trade or employment but the young man following itmay become a hero,And there is no object so soft but it makes a hub for the wheel’d universe,And I say to any man or woman, Let your soul stand cool and composedbefore a million universes.
caption: The photograph is a surreal and abstract image symbolizing the interconnectedness of the soul and body. A person is walking alone on a road, carrying nothing but a sense of self-identity. The landscape around them is a blurry mix of people, objects, and ideas that overwhelm the senses.

The picture is of a person standing still in front of an endless expanse of different universes, galaxies, and planets. The person stands confidently and with a sense of self-importance, knowing that with their empathy and outlook, they can conquer anything in life.

027-330.text: And I say to mankind, Be not curious about God,For I who am curious about each am not curious about God,(No array of terms can say how much I am at peace about God andabout death.)
caption: The photograph feels serene, with its muted and warm colors. It shows a person looking up into the sky, surrounded by trees and nature. They seem to be deep in thought, maybe contemplating the mysteries of the universe, but they also seem at peace with the idea that some things are beyond human understanding.

In a minimalistic style, an individual with outstretched hands and a calm expression on their face, standing before a vast, immeasurable void; hinting at the peace and acceptance of the mysteries of life and death.

027-331.text: I hear and behold God in every object, yet understand God not in the least,Nor do I understand who there can be more wonderful than myself.
caption: Surrealistic. A person standing in a vast, open field surrounded by various objects that appear to be coming to life. The person is awestruck and overwhelmed, yet still confident in their own wonder.

Surrealism. An image of a person's eyes gazing out, surrounded by various everyday objects, which have a prominent, otherworldly presence. The person is shadowed and appears to be contemplating their existence, hinting that a beautiful mystery lies within.

027-332.text: Why should I wish to see God better than this day?I see something of God each hour of the twenty-four, and each moment then,In the faces of men and women I see God, and in my own face in the glass,I find letters from God dropt in the street, and every one is sign’dby God’s name,And I leave them where they are, for I know that wheresoe’er I go,Others will punctually come for ever and ever.
caption: Realistic impressionism. A mosaic of human faces presented in a grid. The center of the mosaic shows the reflection of the speaker, all connected by random letters strewn sporadically throughout the mosaic.

This picture is a mosaic of several photographs capturing different people, taken throughout a day. Each individual is unique, but they all share a spiritual presence that is translated through their facial expressions. The background is a busy city street with scraps of paper on the ground, and in the reflection of a broken mirror, you can see the phrase "I see God in everyone" etched faintly.

027-333.text: 49And as to you Death, and you bitter hug of mortality, it is idle totry to alarm me.
caption: In an expressionist style, a person embracing Death, with contrasting emotions of fear and acceptance.
Dramatic, surrealism style photograph of a person embracing shadows and skeletons, unafraid of the impending embrace of mortality.

027-334.text: To his work without flinching the accoucheur comes,I see the elder-hand pressing receiving supporting,I recline by the sills of the exquisite flexible doors,And mark the outlet, and mark the relief and escape.
caption: Minimalist. A hand holding onto another hand for support during a medical procedure. A person sitting by a doorframe watching the occurrences within the room.
Surrealist. A surreal image of an older pair of hands holding a younger pair of hands. The younger hands are coming out of a flexible door, and there is a sense of relief and escape.

027-335.text: And as to you Corpse I think you are good manure, but that does notoffend me,I smell the white roses sweet-scented and growing,I reach to the leafy lips, I reach to the polish’d breasts of melons.
caption: A playful and colorful pop art piece with bright pink and green hues. A garden overflowing with ripe melons and fresh white roses, with a small compost heap in the background.
Surrealistic. A garden with a corpse in the center as the soil, and white rose bushes and melon vines growing from it.

027-336.text: And as to you Life I reckon you are the leavings of many deaths,(No doubt I have died myself ten thousand times before.)
caption: The photo is taken from a high angle over a desert landscape with dried up trees and plants. A skull is visible in the foreground, surrounded by bones with a person lying nearby. The photo captures the cycle of birth and death, with life being the accumulation of death. The visual style is black and white with a high contrast to represent the harshness of life in the desert.

A surrealist photograph with a distorted figure made of various different objects, such as flowers and bones, representing Life as a result of many deaths. The figure is fragmented, alluding to the idea that Life is the byproduct of many past lives.

027-337.text: I hear you whispering there O stars of heaven,O suns--O grass of graves--O perpetual transfers and promotions,If you do not say any thing how can I say any thing?
caption: The picture is dark with only stars in the night sky visible. The grass in the foreground is blurred creating a dreamy effect.
Surrealism. A person standing in a barren landscape looking up at the sky filled with many stars, as the sun and grass grow from their own body.

027-338.text: Of the turbid pool that lies in the autumn forest,Of the moon that descends the steeps of the soughing twilight,Toss, sparkles of day and dusk--toss on the black stems that decayin the muck,Toss to the moaning gibberish of the dry limbs.
caption: The picture is stylized like an autumn landscape painting. In the foreground lies a murky pool with decaying stems and branches, surrounded by autumn foliage. The moon is visible above the trees, casting a pale light on the landscape.
Surrealism. A dark and eerie forest with a murky pond in the center. The moon is descending in the background and light sparkles can be seen coming from the decaying black branches of the trees.

027-339.text: I ascend from the moon, I ascend from the night,I perceive that the ghastly glimmer is noonday sunbeams reflected,And debouch to the steady and central from the offspring great or small.
caption: The image is a fast-forward time-lapse of a majestic full moon sinking beyond the horizon, an eerie and mystic night sky transitioning to a gloriously bright daybreak with shimmering light reflecting on a peaceful sea, and ends with a zoomed-out shot of a vast and tranquil landscape. The visual style is a blend of surrealism and realism.
A dark-toned image with a crescent moon at the bottom and a sunrise at the top, showing the transition from night to day. Radiant and vibrant sunbeams can be seen on the edges of the image.

027-340.text: 50There is that in me--I do not know what it is--but I know it is in me.
caption: Abstract expressionism. A surrealistic painting of a human figure with a translucent body that is filled with a mysterious and vibrant energy.
Abstract painting with a focus on a colorful, unidentified form in the center resembling an emotion or essence that cannot be named.

027-341.text: Wrench’d and sweaty--calm and cool then my body becomes,I sleep--I sleep long.
caption: In a dark and moody tone, a photo of a man who looks like he just finished a long, tiring workout. As he dozes off in a comfortable bed, his body is now still and peaceful.

In a hyper-realistic style, a person is seen in two frames side by side. In the first frame, the person's face is contorted in sweat and exertion. In the second frame, the same person is seen lying peacefully in a deep sleep.

027-342.text: I do not know it--it is without name--it is a word unsaid,It is not in any dictionary, utterance, symbol.
caption: Surrealist. A person stands in a vast landscape with a thought bubble above their head. Inside the thought bubble, there is nothing but empty space.
Abstract expressionism style painting. A person standing in front of a giant, blank canvas, struggling to convey the indescribable feeling in their head.

027-343.text: Something it swings on more than the earth I swing on,To it the creation is the friend whose embracing awakes me.
caption: Surrealist. An individual attached to a giant, amorphous form that looks like a cross between an octopus and a nebula. The individual reaches out to the form with outstretched arms, embracing it.

Surreal. A person is suspended mid-air, not swinging from the Earth, but from a giant flower-like object. The surrounding world appears distorted and dream-like, while the flower provides a sense of safety and familiarity.

027-344.text: Perhaps I might tell more. Outlines! I plead for my brothers and sisters.
caption: The picture would be a simple but striking image of a person with their hand outstretched as if to ask or plead for something. The viewer can sense a strong emotion emanating from the subject, such as a passionate desire to speak out or fight for something they believe in. The visual style could be minimalist, with bold lines and simple shapes, or more abstract with swirling, textured brushstrokes.
Minimalist art style. A hand, reaching out towards many other hands, as if in a plea or motion to help others.

027-345.text: Do you see O my brothers and sisters?It is not chaos or death--it is form, union, plan--it is eternallife--it is Happiness.
caption: Surrealistic. The picture shows a tangled mass of chaos and death, but on closer inspection, reveals a form and order to the chaos. The image is surrounded by a glowing aura, evoking the feeling of eternal life and happiness.
In a surreal and impressionistic style, a composition of light and colors blend to create an abstract expression of unity and joyfulness, where the divine and earthly merge into one.

027-346.text: 51The past and present wilt--I have fill’d them, emptied them.And proceed to fill my next fold of the future.
caption: Surrealism. A person stands in front of a massive hourglass, which represents the passage of time. The sand drains out of the bottom and fills the top, symbolizing the constant flow of past and present as the person gazes intently towards the future, ready to take it on.

Abstract. The picture is split into two halves, one representing the past and one representing the present. The past half is filled up and the present half is spilling out, while the future half is partially outlined in front of both halves.

027-347.text: Listener up there! what have you to confide to me?Look in my face while I snuff the sidle of evening,(Talk honestly, no one else hears you, and I stay only a minute longer.)
caption: The photograph is taken from a low angle, focusing on someone looking down towards the camera. The setting sun casts long shadows around them. The photo has an intimate feel, like a moment of vulnerability captured candidly.
A photograph in black and white with a soft vignette. An individual with their head turned enjoying the tranquility of the evening.

027-348.text: Do I contradict myself?Very well then I contradict myself,(I am large, I contain multitudes.)
caption: The photograph is split between two contrasting parts. On the left, a person with a content expression sits in front of a plain background. On the right, the same person stands in a busy street market with countless people in view.

The surrealistic image of an individual standing in front of a distorted mirror, their reflection splitting apart into multiple fragmented images, representing the complexity and contradictions that exist within one person.

027-349.text: I concentrate toward them that are nigh, I wait on the door-slab.
caption: Abstract. A figure leans toward a door, their attention focused on what is on the other side. The door is a colorful slab, with no discernible features.
Surreal. A person's hand reaching out to an open door, as if waiting for someone to pass through. The rest of the photo is out of focus, with just the faint outline of figures in the distance.

027-350.text: Who has done his day’s work? who will soonest be through with his supper?Who wishes to walk with me?
caption: Street photography. A man carrying his tool kit walking down an alleyway, looking towards the viewer, while other people having dinner in their homes peek curiously through the windows, one of them standing outside and gesturing towards the man with the tool kit.
Street photography style. Two silhouetted figures with a sunset in the background, one figure appears to be finishing their meal while the other extends their hand to invite them on a walk.

027-351.text: Will you speak before I am gone? will you prove already too late?
caption: Photography style would be street photography. A person stands alone on a street corner looking back with a hopeful expression while a group of people in the distance walk away with their backs turned.
Surrealism. A clock melting away on a barren wasteland as a person desperately tries to speak into a melt phone, but with their mouth tied.

027-352.text: 52The spotted hawk swoops by and accuses me, he complains of my gaband my loitering.
caption: In the style of impressionism, the picture depicts a spotted hawk flying past a person, seemingly scolding them. The person is standing idly and chatting away, seemingly not minding the hawk's judgement.

The picture is in the style of an oil painting. The main focus is a spotted hawk, capturing its movement and speed as it swoops through the air. In the background, there's an individual with their head hung low, looking remorseful as though the hawk is scolding them.

027-353.text: I too am not a bit tamed, I too am untranslatable,I sound my barbaric yawp over the roofs of the world.
caption: Expressionistic. An individual standing on the edge of a tall building, screaming into the abyss below, a silhouette amidst the foreground of a cityscape.
Surrealist. A person with wild hair stands atop a building, their mouth wide open in a soundless scream, the surrounding roofs and sky distorted and dreamlike.

027-354.text: The last scud of day holds back for me,It flings my likeness after the rest and true as any on the shadow’d wilds,It coaxes me to the vapor and the dusk.
caption: Photographically subdued with dramatic contrast. The fading sun lingers behind a lone figure, whose silhouette provides a striking contrast against the dusky wilderness. The figure seems to be beckoned towards the hazy mist that envelopes the scene.
The image is shot in soft focus with the sun setting behind a forest, casting long dark shadows. A lone figure stands staring back at the camera, with the sun casting a glowing haze around its edges.

027-355.text: I depart as air, I shake my white locks at the runaway sun,I effuse my flesh in eddies, and drift it in lacy jags.
caption: With a Surrealist style, there is a depiction of a person's head transformed into a white cloud, hair strands merging with the sun's rays. The body becomes a series of lace-like patterns that ripple and swirl with the wind.
Surrealism. A ghostly figure with flowing, white hair leaving the ground with a trail of wispy, lace-like shapes left behind. The sun in the background is escaping fast.

027-356.text: I bequeath myself to the dirt to grow from the grass I love,If you want me again look for me under your boot-soles.
caption: Realistic Landscape Photography. A closeup of grass, dirt, and the sole of a shoe. The sole of the shoe is positioned over a patch of dirt and grass, as if looking for something that was once there.
A minimalistic black and white photo of a pair of worn boots standing in a field of tall green grass. The boots are slightly sunk in the grass and hint at a person's presence there before.

027-357.text: You will hardly know who I am or what I mean,But I shall be good health to you nevertheless,And filter and fibre your blood.
caption: Surrealism. A human heart that takes the form of a tree sprouting within a body.

Photography style: Abstract. A person is outlined in varying shades of brown with a green-blue background. Within the outline of the person is what appears to be light filtering and moving through their veins.

027-358.text: Failing to fetch me at first keep encouraged,Missing me one place search another,I stop somewhere waiting for you.
caption: Surrealistic. A person standing on a road, with many paths leading to nowhere. The person looks lost, yet they seem patient and content, as if knowing they are waiting for someone to find them.

Surrealistic. A person is in the middle of a maze, looking around confused and lost. The maze appears to shift and change as they move, with each path leading to a different, strange location. However, they cannot see the figure following closely behind, seeming to know exactly where they are going.

028-001.text: To the garden the world anew ascending,Potent mates, daughters, sons, preluding,The love, the life of their bodies, meaning and being,Curious here behold my resurrection after slumber,The revolving cycles in their wide sweep having brought me again,Amorous, mature, all beautiful to me, all wondrous,My limbs and the quivering fire that ever plays through them, forreasons, most wondrous,Existing I peer and penetrate still,Content with the present, content with the past,By my side or back of me Eve following,Or in front, and I following her just the same.
caption: Realism. A group of people walk through a garden, each generation linked by their ties to life and love, their bodies showing the signs of age and experience. The central figure is a mature, amorous figure, with energy coursing through his body as he gazes ahead at the woman he loves.

Surrealist. A human figure is seen emerging out of a garden with plants and flowers surrounding them. The figure's body contains a vibrant, colorful fire that spreads through its entire body, signifying their reawakening. The figure is accompanied by others, but their bodies glow brighter and more vibrant than anyone or anything around them, signifying their unique and powerful presence in the world.

029-001.text: From pent-up aching rivers,From that of myself without which I were nothing,From what I am determin’d to make illustrious, even if I stand soleamong men,From my own voice resonant, singing the phallus,Singing the song of procreation,Singing the need of superb children and therein superb grown people,Singing the muscular urge and the blending,Singing the bedfellow’s song, (O resistless yearning!O for any and each the body correlative attracting!O for you whoever you are your correlative body! O it, more than allelse, you delighting!)From the hungry gnaw that eats me night and day,From native moments, from bashful pains, singing them,Seeking something yet unfound though I have diligently sought itmany a long year,Singing the true song of the soul fitful at random,Renascent with grossest Nature or among animals,Of that, of them and what goes with them my poems informing,Of the smell of apples and lemons, of the pairing of birds,Of the wet of woods, of the lapping of waves,Of the mad pushes of waves upon the land, I them chanting,The overture lightly sounding, the strain anticipating,The welcome nearness, the sight of the perfect body,The swimmer swimming naked in the bath, or motionless on his backlying and floating,The female form approaching, I pensive, love-flesh tremulous aching,The divine list for myself or you or for any one making,The face, the limbs, the index from head to foot, and what it arouses,The mystic deliria, the madness amorous, the utter abandonment,(Hark close and still what I now whisper to you,I love you, O you entirely possess me,O that you and I escape from the rest and go utterly off, free and lawless,Two hawks in the air, two fishes swimming in the sea not morelawless than we;)The furious storm through me careering, I passionately trembling.The oath of the inseparableness of two together, of the woman thatloves me and whom I love more than my life, that oath swearing,(O I willingly stake all for you,O let me be lost if it must be so!O you and I! what is it to us what the rest do or think?What is all else to us? only that we enjoy each other and exhausteach other if it must be so;)From the master, the pilot I yield the vessel to,The general commanding me, commanding all, from him permission taking,From time the programme hastening, (I have loiter’d too long as it is,)From sex, from the warp and from the woof,From privacy, from frequent repinings alone,From plenty of persons near and yet the right person not near,From the soft sliding of hands over me and thrusting of fingersthrough my hair and beard,From the long sustain’d kiss upon the mouth or bosom,From the close pressure that makes me or any man drunk, faintingwith excess,From what the divine husband knows, from the work of fatherhood,From exultation, victory and relief, from the bedfellow’s embrace inthe night,From the act-poems of eyes, hands, hips and bosoms,From the cling of the trembling arm,From the bending curve and the clinch,From side by side the pliant coverlet off-throwing,From the one so unwilling to have me leave, and me just as unwillingto leave,(Yet a moment O tender waiter, and I return,)From the hour of shining stars and dropping dews,From the night a moment I emerging flitting out,Celebrate you act divine and you children prepared for,And you stalwart loins.
caption: Art Deco. A large, colorful montage of images depicting human life and nature, including a raging storm, a naked swimmer in a bath, birds pairing, waves crashing ashore, various body parts, and an oath of inseparableness between two lovers.

Surrealist. An abstract depiction of a man's consciousness in colorful, tactile forms. His thoughts, desires and memories materialize as curved shapes and flowing textures that blend together, revealing glimpses of physical intimacy, natural landscapes, and human connection.

030-001.text: 1I sing the body electric,The armies of those I love engirth me and I engirth them,They will not let me off till I go with them, respond to them,And discorrupt them, and charge them full with the charge of the soul.
caption: Surrealist. A glowing human figure surrounded and embraced by a group of similarly glowing figures. They remain persistent until the embodied figure finally surrenders to their desires and fills them with the pulsating energy of the soul.

With the use of high contrast black and white photography, there are multiple bodies embracing each other in a circle. The muscles and veins in their arms are detailed and prominent, with a strong emphasis on the connection and flow of energy.

030-002.text: Was it doubted that those who corrupt their own bodies conceal themselves?And if those who defile the living are as bad as they who defile the dead?And if the body does not do fully as much as the soul?And if the body were not the soul, what is the soul?
caption: The visual style is abstract expressionism with dark and murky overtones. The picture depicts a distorted human form amidst a swirl of murky colors, questioning whether those who harm their bodies are really hiding the truth, if those who harm the living are as guilty as those who harm the dead, and if the soul does more than the body can.
