The image depicts a figure standing amidst various celestial objects and holding a sphere that represents the earth, emphasizing their connection to the natural world and the cosmos. The background consists of a blending of colors that symbolize the past and the present, leading towards the figure, who represents immortality.

This image is a surrealistic depiction of a person, who is metaphorically embodied by a colossal melting Earth, with the sun and moon theatrically hanging in the backdrop, signifying the cosmological significance of the person as they are the center of the universe, holding the present, past, and future simultaneously.

093-020.poem: A Song of the Rolling Earth
093-020.text: Each man to himself and each woman to herself, is the word of thepast and present, and the true word of immortality;No one can acquire for another--not one,Not one can grow for another--not one.
caption: A minimalistic black and white social commentary piece. Two silhouetted individuals stand back to back, holding their own weight. The figures merge together in the center to form one shape.

The photo shows a group of diverse individuals standing alone in a vast landscape, as they reach upwards towards a glowing sun. Each person is uniquely captured, with varied expressions and body postures. The colours are warm and earthy, as the picture radiates a sense of freedom and self-reliance.

093-021.poem: A Song of the Rolling Earth
093-021.text: The song is to the singer, and comes back most to him,The teaching is to the teacher, and comes back most to him,The murder is to the murderer, and comes back most to him,The theft is to the thief, and comes back most to him,The love is to the lover, and comes back most to him,The gift is to the giver, and comes back most to him--it cannot fail,The oration is to the orator, the acting is to the actor and actressnot to the audience,And no man understands any greatness or goodness but his own, orthe indication of his own.
caption: The visual style would be impressionism. The painting shows a choir singing on a stage with the lead singer in the center. A classroom with a teacher pointing to a blackboard. A shadowy figure staring at a reflection while clutching a bag. A couple in a park holding hands. A person giving a gift. An orator speaking to an empty room.

A surrealistic painting of a swirl of colorful ribbons and light, each representing a different act or skill. A ribbon for singing, teaching, murder, theft, love, gifting, oratory, and acting all weave together, but each of the ribbons somehow returns the most to the one who created that particular act of greatness.

093-022.poem: A Song of the Rolling Earth
093-022.text: 3I swear the earth shall surely be complete to him or her who shallbe complete,The earth remains jagged and broken only to him or her who remainsjagged and broken.
caption: The picture showcases a person looking at the earth, with the surface of the earth appearing complete and whole to them, while jagged and broken to someone who is incomplete. This picture is in a modern art style with abstract shapes and colours representing the brokenness.
Minimalistic. A before-and-after comparison. In the before, a person standing on a fragmented earth. In the after, a complete earth close to them.

093-023.poem: A Song of the Rolling Earth
093-023.text: I swear there is no greatness or power that does not emulate thoseof the earth,There can be no theory of any account unless it corroborate thetheory of the earth,No politics, song, religion, behavior, or what not, is of account,unless it compare with the amplitude of the earth,Unless it face the exactness, vitality, impartiality, rectitude ofthe earth.
caption: In a black and white photograph, a person stands in a vast and open green plain, dwarfed by the towering mountain range behind them. The person's face is calm and still, as if in deep contemplation.

The photograph is shot in black and white, capturing the expanse of a desert scape. The texture of the cracked earth dominates the foreground, with the horizon reaching out under a clear sky, reminding the viewer of the greatness and power of nature.

093-024.poem: A Song of the Rolling Earth
093-024.text: I swear I begin to see love with sweeter spasms than that whichresponds love,It is that which contains itself, which never invites and never refuses.
caption: Abstract expressionism. A burst of bright colors and squiggly lines, with an explosion of emotion at the center. It is the very essence of love, wild and uncontained, never asking or demanding anything in return.
Surrealism. An image of a heart-shaped object, on fire with hot pink and orange tones. The object is encapsulated in a larger object, delicately suspended in mid-air, showing its infinite contents.

093-025.poem: A Song of the Rolling Earth
093-025.text: I swear I begin to see little or nothing in audible words,All merges toward the presentation of the unspoken meanings of the earth,Toward him who sings the songs of the body and of the truths of the earth,Toward him who makes the dictionaries of words that print cannot touch.
caption: Surrealism. A person's face divided in half with one side being composed of books and letters, while the other side has trees and mountains. The trees and mountains whisper unspoken secrets, while the letters and books tell unheard meanings of the earth.

Surrealism. An abstract landscape featuring a human figure singing, surrounded by earthly objects and symbols, with letters and words floating around in a stream of consciousness, leading towards a dictionary.

093-026.poem: A Song of the Rolling Earth
093-026.text: I swear I see what is better than to tell the best,It is always to leave the best untold.
caption: Minimalist photography. A person standing on a mountain top, gazing out at a breathtaking landscape. The true beauty of the scene isn't being photographed, but rather the person's reaction to it.

Minimalist in style, the picture depicts an individual standing at the edge of a cliff overlooking a beautiful sunset. They are silent, choosing to bask in the natural beauty of the moment instead of endlessly describing it.

093-027.poem: A Song of the Rolling Earth
093-027.text: When I undertake to tell the best I find I cannot,My tongue is ineffectual on its pivots,My breath will not be obedient to its organs,I become a dumb man.
caption: A charcoal sketch of a person with mouth open, but no sound coming out. They look frustrated and defeated.

The image portrays a person attempting to speak but unable to do so, with their mouth open but no sound coming out. The picture is a close-up, emphasizing the frustration and disappointment on the person's face while their breath swirls around them in invisible outlines. The color treatment is monochromatic, with only shades of grey to emphasize the despondence of the subject.

093-028.poem: A Song of the Rolling Earth
093-028.text: The best of the earth cannot be told anyhow, all or any is best,It is not what you anticipated, it is cheaper, easier, nearer,Things are not dismiss’d from the places they held before,The earth is just as positive and direct as it was before,Facts, religions, improvements, politics, trades, are as real as before,But the soul is also real, it too is positive and direct,No reasoning, no proof has establish’d it,Undeniable growth has establish’d it.
caption: With an abstract style, an explosion of colors that showcases the different facets of the earth. Different objects, including religious, political, and trade symbols, are present. These objects have not changed, but the soul is a new addition, denoted by a bright orb in the center.

Surrealist. A landscape of vibrant colors and patterns, with abstract elements that represent various aspects of life such as politics, trades, and religion. In the center, a glowing orb symbolizes the undeniable growth of the soul, which is just as real and vibrant as the other elements of life.

093-029.poem: A Song of the Rolling Earth
093-029.text: 4These to echo the tones of souls and the phrases of souls,(If they did not echo the phrases of souls what were they then?If they had not reference to you in especial what were they then?)
caption: Abstract expressionist painting of two overlapping sound waves. The waves are built up with jagged lines and a wild color palette, conveying the echoes of souls and phrases through their frenzied movement.
Surrealist. A pair of large, elongated ears floating in mid-air, as if listening to the whispers of souls. The background is a shaded void with ghostly faces that manifest faintly around the ears.

093-030.poem: A Song of the Rolling Earth
093-030.text: I swear I will never henceforth have to do with the faith that tellsthe best,I will have to do only with that faith that leaves the best untold.
caption: Monochromatic minimalism. A lone figure stands at a crossroad, one path leads to a censored sign that says "the best", the other path leads to an open and empty road. The figure takes the empty path with a sense of determination.

The image is focused on the silhouette of a person standing on top of a rocky cliff, looking out towards a vast expanse of water that seems to go on forever. The sunset creates a vivid orange gradient in the sky, and the person's arms are outstretched as they let go of all their doubts and fears, embracing the unknown with a serene expression.

093-031.poem: A Song of the Rolling Earth
093-031.text: Say on, sayers! sing on, singers!Delve! mould! pile the words of the earth!Work on, age after age, nothing is to be lost,It may have to wait long, but it will certainly come in use,When the materials are all prepared and ready, the architects shall appear.
caption: The photograph is taken at a construction site showing a group of workers engaged in building a structure with the raw materials of the earth. There is an old-fashioned and historical touch evident in the photograph.

Abstract art, in warm colors. Busy, layered brushstrokes depict the never-ending work of workers, digging, shaping, and creating with elements from the earth. Everything remains, waiting for the moment when they will be molded and built into something meaningful.

093-032.poem: A Song of the Rolling Earth
093-032.text: I swear to you the architects shall appear without fall,I swear to you they will understand you and justify you,The greatest among them shall be he who best knows you, and enclosesall and is faithful to all,He and the rest shall not forget you, they shall perceive that youare not an iota less than they,You shall be fully glorified in them.
caption: Surrealism/Abstract art, featuring a group of people standing in front of a grand, symbolic structure. The people are looking towards the structure with wonder and amazement while the structure itself has several layers of complexity, representing the different architects who have contributed to its creation. Each architect, including the greatest among them, is faithfully represented in the structure, which symbolizes the glory of the individual.

The scene depicts an architect who stands in the middle, surrounded by a group of other skilled people who share his knowledge and vision. They render their utmost respect to him, and the picture exudes a sense of unity, trust, and understanding among them as they collaborate in the creation of something truly great. The visual style of the picture is Renaissance art, and it focuses on the details of the garments, architecture, and expressions of the individuals in it.

094-001.poem: Youth, Day, Old Age and Night
094-001.text: Youth, large, lusty, loving--youth full of grace, force, fascination,Do you know that Old Age may come after you with equal grace,force, fascination?
caption: Surrealist. In the picture, a youthful person is shown with all their vitality and force, but looming behind them is the transparent image of an elderly person. The image portrays the passing and cyclical nature of life.

A striking contrast of two portraits, side-by-side: A glowing, vivacious young person, filled with vitality and charisma; and an elderly person, equally dignified and statuesque, with the wisdom of years evident in the lines of their face.

094-002.poem: Youth, Day, Old Age and Night
094-002.text: Day full-blown and splendid-day of the immense sun, action,ambition, laughter,The Night follows close with millions of suns, and sleep andrestoring darkness.
caption: In an impressionist painting style, a bright and colorful day scene with a large sun dominating the sky, full of people engaged in various activities, laughing and striving towards their goals. Below, a night scene with millions of tiny stars glittering in the darkness, while people rest peacefully.

Surrealist. A bright and vibrant sun-filled day is on the left side, while the right side shows a dark night sky filled with millions of twinkling stars. In the middle, is an abstract image that represents the transition from daytime to nighttime, where action and ambition turn into sleep and restoring darkness.

095-001.text: 1Come said the Muse,Sing me a song no poet yet has chanted,Sing me the universal.
caption: Grayscale high contrast photography. A cloudy sky with a spotlight shining on a solo singer with their mouth open, ready to sing a song no one has heard.

The image is a close up of a muse with their finger to their lips, gesturing for silence. Their expression is contemplative yet pleading. The background is a starry sky, emphasizing the idea of the universal.

095-002.text: In this broad earth of ours,Amid the measureless grossness and the slag,Enclosed and safe within its central heart,Nestles the seed perfection.
caption: Surrealism. A large, otherworldly seed sits at the center of the earth, surrounded by rough and unfinished terrain. The seed appears delicate and flawless, untouched by the coarseness that surrounds it.
Macro photography, an image of a tiny seed nestled within the center of a flower that is surrounded by discarded debris, representing the beauty and potential hidden within the chaos of life.

095-003.text: By every life a share or more or less,None born but it is born, conceal’d or unconceal’d the seed is waiting.
caption: Photomontage. A series of images of different people, some prominent and some obscure, with a seed at the center of each image, representing the potential within each individual life.
Abstract Expressionism. A vibrant, multicolored canvas with many seeds hidden amongst the swirls and textures. Each seed represents a life, waiting to be born and grow.

095-004.text: 2Lo! keen-eyed towering science,As from tall peaks the modern overlooking,Successive absolute fiats issuing.
caption: Black and white photograph of a peak as seen from a distance with a silhouette of a person on top. Smoke fumes coming out of a factory chimney in the background.

The photograph would show an elevated view of a panoramic mountain range or city skyline with a central figure representing "keen-eyed towering science." The figure might potentially appear as a silhouette in the foreground with their arms raised towards the heavens.

095-005.text: Yet again, lo! the soul, above all science,For it has history gather’d like husks around the globe,For it the entire star-myriads roll through the sky.
caption: Surrealist. An ethereal soul floating above a globe-shaped husk, while the stars and galaxies spiral around it in a cosmic dance.

A picture of a person standing on a mountaintop, with arms raised, gazing up at the starry sky. The stars are in motion, streaming across the sky, and the person seems to be gathering knowledge from the universe. The style is impressionistic, with bold brushstrokes and rich colors conveying the sense of movement and wonder.

095-006.text: In spiral routes by long detours,(As a much-tacking ship upon the sea,)For it the partial to the permanent flowing,For it the real to the ideal tends.
caption: Abstract art with a splash of vibrant colors, swirling in dynamic patterns that mimic the spiral movement of ocean currents. The colors dissolve into each other, blurring the boundaries between them and creating a sense of flow and movement.

The picture is done in an abstract expressionist style. A pattern of a black and white spiral leads the eye into a vast expanse of blue, representing the sea. The chaos of the spiral is contrasted by the clarity of the blue, capturing the relationship between the permanence of the sea and the ever-changing course of a ship tacking through it.

095-007.text: For it the mystic evolution,Not the right only justified, what we call evil also justified.
caption: A surrealist painting with elements of darkness and light intertwined. Within the murky colors and shadows, a strand of light leads to a realm of illuminated colors representing spiritual evolution with perfect balance between both good and evil forces.
Abstract expressionism. A chaotic and colorful explosion on the canvas that represents the concept of justifying both good and evil in the process of a mystical evolution.

095-008.text: Forth from their masks, no matter what,From the huge festering trunk, from craft and guile and tears,Health to emerge and joy, joy universal.
caption: Surrealist style photograph with a tree trunk in the center of the frame, faces of multiple people wearing masks are emerging from it. The faces have expressions of relief and contentment as they leave their masks behind. There is a rainbow in the background.
Surrealism. A tree stump has opened up, and people are pouring out of it, joyful and healthy. They abandon their masks and leave behind craft, guile, and tears.

095-009.text: Out of the bulk, the morbid and the shallow,Out of the bad majority, the varied countless frauds of men and states,Electric, antiseptic yet, cleaving, suffusing all,Only the good is universal.
caption: In a futuristic, surrealistic art piece, a towering figure made of metal and wires stands amidst a crowd of people made of broken, twisted pieces. The figure emanates a bright, clean light which highlights the few people who are whole and untouched, representing the idea that only the good is universal amidst the vast majority of deceitful, corrupt individuals.

This is a minimalist black and white photograph of a single bright light shining through a dark room. The bright light appears pure and cleansing, cutting through the shadows and illuminating everything in its path while leaving only the goodness of the world.

095-010.text: 3Over the mountain-growths disease and sorrow,An uncaught bird is ever hovering, hovering,High in the purer, happier air.
caption: Surrealism. A large mountain range with an enormous bird, hovering in the sky above. The mountain range is barren and lifeless, but the bird symbolizes hope in the purer air.
In the style of impressionism, the mountain seems to be made of millions of brush strokes. A small bird flying just over the tips of the mountains, where the air is cleaner and crisper.

095-011.text: From imperfection’s murkiest cloud,Darts always forth one ray of perfect light,One flash of heaven’s glory.
caption: The image shows a dark, cloudy sky with a single bright ray of sunlight breaking through the clouds, illuminating the area below in a dazzling and heavenly light. The style can be impressionist with brushstrokes or a colorful abstract style.
Surrealist photography with the imperfection taking the form of a cloud that has a hole through which a beam of bright light is shining on a dark and dreary landscape.

095-012.text: To fashion’s, custom’s discord,To the mad Babel-din, the deafening orgies,Soothing each lull a strain is heard, just heard,From some far shore the final chorus sounding.
caption: In an abstract expressionist style, a chaotic and noisy city street is overshadowed by a distant lighthouse, with a faint but soothing sound of music heard coming from it.
Abstract expressionism. Vibrant colors and chaotic lines depict the confusion and noise of a city, with a faint melody in the distance giving a spark of hope.

095-013.text: O the blest eyes, the happy hearts,That see, that know the guiding thread so fine,Along the mighty labyrinth.
caption: This image in the style of abstract expressionism uses bold colors, lines, and movement to celebrate the joy of understanding the intricacies of life; represented by a complex, intricate labyrinth which is made clear by a bright and colorful guiding thread.
Surrealist. A single, giant eye glimpsed through a knotted and twisting maze. Small, happy hearts can be seen inside the maze peering out.

095-014.text: 4And thou America,For the scheme’s culmination, its thought and its reality,For these (not for thyself) thou hast arrived.
caption: Postmodernist. A monumental sculpture of a rising sun made of steel that represents America's arrival at the culmination of its thoughts and aspirations.
A pop art inspired image, featuring America as a star-spangled superhero triumphantly reaching the peak of a mountain peak, with the sun rising behind her.

095-015.text: Thou too surroundest all,Embracing carrying welcoming all, thou too by pathways broad and new,To the ideal tendest.
caption: In a surrealistic style, a single figure with outstretched arms, embracing and carrying various objects of different sizes and shapes, walking along a path that twists and turns in unexpected ways leading towards a bright and hopeful horizon.

In a surrealist style, the image contains a figure with multiple faces embracing various individuals of different sizes and shapes. The figure is standing on a twisting and winding path that leads to an ideal, glowing light at the end.

095-016.text: The measure’d faiths of other lands, the grandeurs of the past,Are not for thee, but grandeurs of thine own,Deific faiths and amplitudes, absorbing, comprehending all,All eligible to all.
caption: Surrealism. An abstract landscape with intricate patterns and symbols representing different faiths and cultures. All the symbols are converging towards a central point, which signifies the idea that all faiths and cultures are equal and represent an individual's own unique greatness.

In a modern art style, a picture shows multiple cultures and historical periods blending together to form a new and unique landscape. People of different races and religions are holding hands and forging new traditions from the old.

095-017.text: All, all for immortality,Love like the light silently wrapping all,Nature’s amelioration blessing all,The blossoms, fruits of ages, orchards divine and certain,Forms, objects, growths, humanities, to spiritual images ripening.
caption: Luminous and ethereal. A glowing light that embraces all in its path - from the budding flowers and ripe fruits to the joyful people who are transformed into spiritual beings.

A vivid surrealist artwork, with a landscape of enormous proportions. The image is an immersive experience, with the viewers feeling as though they are surrounded by the image. It features a lush orchard filled with different fruits and flowers in various stages of growth, with a divine light wrapping around the environment. The figures on the back drop are gradually transforming from earthly forms to spiritual beings.

095-018.text: Give me O God to sing that thought,Give me, give him or her I love this quenchless faith,In Thy ensemble, whatever else withheld withhold not from us,Belief in plan of Thee enclosed in Time and Space,Health, peace, salvation universal.
caption: In the style of surrealism, a person stands with outstretched arms in front of a colorful and distorted background. In the background, there are ambiguous images of health, peace, and salvation, while a mysterious plan enclosed in Time and Space is symbolized by clocks and swirling galaxies.

Surrealism. A person holding a brightly lit quenchless faith. The figure is surrounded by a cosmic ensemble, where an enclosed realm of time and space embraces the idea of health, peace, and universal salvation.

095-019.text: Is it a dream?Nay but the lack of it the dream,And failing it life’s lore and wealth a dream,And all the world a dream.
caption: Surrealism. The picture depicts an individual in various dreamlike states with a contrast between light and dark - reflecting a struggle and lack of direction between reality and abstract dreams that one has experienced causing them to question life itself.
Surrealist. An individual sitting on a cloud, below them is a cityscape with clocks that say zero. In front of them is a large mirror reflecting a figure with wings.

096-001.text: Come my tan-faced children,Follow well in order, get your weapons ready,Have you your pistols? have you your sharp-edged axes?Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: The photograph captures a group of tan-faced young adults, walking in an organised and orderly manner, while geared up and ready for a wild west adventure with their pistols and sharp-edged axes. The style of the photograph is sepia-toned vintage western.
A dark sepia tone photo of pioneers in a line, walking towards an unknown frontier. Each person carries their own weapon and tools: pistols, rifles, and sharp-edged axes.

096-002.text: For we cannot tarry here,We must march my darlings, we must bear the brunt of danger,We the youthful sinewy races, all the rest on us depend,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: In the style of Impressionism, a group of young and strong individuals are marching forward into the distance, with a sense of adventure and purpose. The viewer can feel the excitement and determination of the pioneers as they lead the way.
Landscape photography in a natural forest, with a group of young adventurers traversing through the woods, leading the way with determination and strength to blaze the trail.

096-003.text: O you youths, Western youths,So impatient, full of action, full of manly pride and friendship,Plain I see you Western youths, see you tramping with the foremost,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: The camera captures a group of young men with bright, energetic expressions on their faces. They're walking confidently across an open field with tall grass and small shrubs, dressed in plaid shirts and sturdy boots. Their steps suggest a journey, a pioneering spirit.

Road trip photography. A group of young men, all friends, walking towards the camera with mountains and open road in the background. The style is slightly understated yet still capturing the exciting and adventurous mood.

096-004.text: Have the elder races halted?Do they droop and end their lesson, wearied over there beyond the seas?We take up the task eternal, and the burden and the lesson,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: In a post-apocalyptic and desolate world, a group of new and young individuals continue to push forward despite the struggles and weight they bear. They carry a light that burns bright as they travel towards an unknown future.

A black and white, high-contrast photo of a group of tired, elderly people standing by the ocean, contrasted with a group of young and determined pioneers standing poised on a cliff above the sea, ready to start their journey.

096-005.text: All the past we leave behind,We debouch upon a newer mightier world, varied world,Fresh and strong the world we seize, world of labor and the march,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: With a Futurism art style, a group of pioneers moves forward through a portal, leaving behind the old world and embracing the new one ahead of them, full of labor and progress.

A black and white shot of a group of people walking away from a cloudy and obscure background, with their backs turned to the camera. They are leaving behind a dark and murky past and stepping towards a bright and expressive future. The photograph is grainy and has rough edges, adding to the rawness and pioneering spirit of the image.

096-006.text: We detachments steady throwing,Down the edges, through the passes, up the mountains steep,Conquering, holding, daring, venturing as we go the unknown ways,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: Using a Futurism visual style, a group of people energetically journeying through mountainous landscapes, fearlessly conquering the challenging terrain ahead.

Film noir. A group of silhouetted figures embarking on a journey into the unknown, leaving the safety of the known world behind as they venture up steep mountains and through dangerous passes, always pushing further towards their ultimate goal.

096-007.text: We primeval forests felling,We the rivers stemming, vexing we and piercing deep the mines within,We the surface broad surveying, we the virgin soil upheaving,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: The photo is shot from a ground level, showing a group of rugged, adventurous and determined individuals tearing down thick, dense forest with axes in their hands. Behind them, they have dug deep pits into the earth, and a vast area of virgin soil is upturned, with rivers in the distance. The photo is in sepia tone, with the pioneers permanently etched in time.

The image is in the style of an impressionist painting. A group of pioneers working in the forest, felling trees, diverting rivers, and mining deep into the mountains. The landscape surrounding these pioneers is pristine, untouched, and wild.

096-008.text: Colorado men are we,From the peaks gigantic, from the great sierras and the high plateaus,From the mine and from the gully, from the hunting trail we come,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: The picture shows a group of rugged men standing in front of the Rocky Mountains in a dramatic black and white style. The men are dressed in rough clothing and hold pickaxes and rifles, representing their connection to the land and their pioneering spirit.

The image features a group of rugged and adventurous men standing atop a vast mountain in Colorado. They are positioned to look out over the great expanse of wilderness below them, with a sense of pride and strength emanating from each of them. The photograph is styled in a monochrome palette with a gritty, powerful aesthetic that emphasizes the men's resilience and their connection to the wild landscape around them.

096-009.text: From Nebraska, from Arkansas,Central inland race are we, from Missouri, with the continentalblood intervein’d,All the hands of comrades clasping, all the Southern, all the Northern,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: Incorporating a documentary photography style, a diverse group of people from different states in middle America standing together and clasping hands, representing unity and pioneering spirit.
Illustrated in a sepia tone, a diverse group of pioneers from different regions come together with clasped hands, representing unity and a collective spirit.

096-010.text: O resistless restless race!O beloved race in all! O my breast aches with tender love for all!O I mourn and yet exult, I am rapt with love for all,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: Impressionistic. A group of people, diverse in age, race, and gender, walking purposefully forward with open arms towards a distant horizon as the sun sets behind them. The sky is a mix of blues, yellows, oranges, and pinks.
Collage-style. An image of diverse people holding hands with their eyes closed as if they are in prayer. The backdrop is a sunset scene filled with vast landscapes and majestic mountains.

096-011.text: Raise the mighty mother mistress,Waving high the delicate mistress, over all the starry mistress,(bend your heads all,)Raise the fang’d and warlike mistress, stern, impassive, weapon’d mistress,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: The visual style is abstract expressionism. A depiction of a powerful female figure with numerous arms and weapons in a fierce stance. She is raising a delicate figure with one arm while the other points to the stars.

The picture exhibits an art deco style, with a central figure of a goddess holding a staff with a star on top. Above her, delicate petals and ribbons wave. In contrast, below her, an aggressive goddess wielding a sword glares at the viewer. In the background, pioneers trek across a mountain range.

096-012.text: See my children, resolute children,By those swarms upon our rear we must never yield or falter,Ages back in ghostly millions frowning there behind us urging,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: Photomontage. A group of determined children facing forward. In the background, a faded layer of ghostly pioneers stretching back for ages, pointing and urging them forward.

In an expressionist style, a group of determined and steadfast children are shown facing forward. An uncountable swarm looms behind them, urging them forward while an army of ghostly figures from ages past lines the background.

096-013.text: On and on the compact ranks,With accessions ever waiting, with the places of the dead quickly fill’d,Through the battle, through defeat, moving yet and never stopping,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: Impressionist painting. A group of pioneers trekking through a barren landscape, determinedly pushing through battle and defeat, while new members add to their ranks relentlessly until the places of the fallen are filled.
Action shot in a sketch or watercolor style with a group of pioneer wagons moving westward with the frontier ahead of them. The wagon train is surrounded by trees with a sunset in the background.

096-014.text: O to die advancing on!Are there some of us to droop and die? has the hour come?Then upon the march we fittest die, soon and sure the gap is fill’d.Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: Street photography style. A group of people walking in a line, with one figure falling behind, looking weak. A confident figure leading the pack, staring ahead expectantly.

In a Pop Art style, a group of pioneers marching towards the horizon. Some of them falling behind, while others continue on with determination. The phrase "Pioneers! O pioneers!" is incorporated in bold letters.

096-015.text: All the pulses of the world,Falling in they beat for us, with the Western movement beat,Holding single or together, steady moving to the front, all for us,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: Symbolic. A group of people holding hands, moving forward with the sun setting behind them. The landscape is vast and there is a sense of unity and progress in their movement.

A photograph with the sun setting behind silhouettes of people walking on a dirt path, with a vast expanse of land stretching out ahead of them. The figures are all moving in unison, in a steady forward march.

096-016.text: Life’s involv’d and varied pageants,All the forms and shows, all the workmen at their work,All the seamen and the landsmen, all the masters with their slaves,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: A collage of various scenes from daily life, including a crowd of people from different professions and people from various social ranks. Each person depicts their own story and their own struggles, yet they are all woven together as a whole. The piece is composed in a colorful and bright pop art style to capture the essence of diversity and inclusivity.

Realistic / representational painting. A vibrant and bustling city scene showcasing a diverse range of people at work and play. The view captures people engaged in daily life, including sailors, dock workers, pioneers, and their enslaved counterparts, all contributing to the city's energy and growth. The painting's title is likely "Pioneers! O pioneers!" to reflect the optimism and industry of the subjects.

096-017.text: All the hapless silent lovers,All the prisoners in the prisons, all the righteous and the wicked,All the joyous, all the sorrowing, all the living, all the dying,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: A black and white photograph with a panoramic view of a vast land, showing a combination of happy and sad faces of diverse men and women from all works of life.

The scene depicts a vast field full of people, some of whom are smiling and some are frowning. Some of these people are in chains or behind bars, while others are raising their arms in the air like victors. The scene has a western, Americana art style with the people portrayed in a specific manner.

096-018.text: I too with my soul and body,We, a curious trio, picking, wandering on our way,Through these shores amid the shadows, with the apparitions pressing,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: An impressionist painting of three figures wandering along a misty shoreline with tall trees and shadows behind them. They press forward through the apparitions, a curious trio forging their way.

In the style of impressionism, a painting of a trio of people walking on a beach with the shadows of apparitions visible in the background. The people are smiling and happy, with a sense of adventure in the air.

096-019.text: Lo, the darting bowling orb!Lo, the brother orbs around, all the clustering suns and planets,All the dazzling days, all the mystic nights with dreams,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: The photograph is composed of several orbs rotating inside a dark room, the largest orb is emitting light that illuminates the others. The visual style is surrealism.

The piece is created in the style of abstract expressionism. Fiery oranges and reds are set against a dark black and blue background, swirling and darting around a central orb shape. Smaller orbs and shapes dance around the main form, creating a feeling of movement and energy.

096-020.text: These are of us, they are with us,All for primal needed work, while the followers there in embryo wait behind,We to-day’s procession heading, we the route for travel clearing,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: Photomontage. A group of people, some with tools, work together in a field while others watch from a distance. In the foreground, a group sets out on a journey, leaving the rest behind.
A rural landscape, with the people working on farms, harvesting crops, and building homes. In the distance, we see the silhouette of a procession of people, heading towards the horizon.

096-021.text: O you daughters of the West!O you young and elder daughters! O you mothers and you wives!Never must you be divided, in our ranks you move united,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: A large group of women walking along a western trail, headed towards a sunset. They wear a mixture of pioneer and modern clothing and carry various tools and provisions. Their strides are strong and united, representing the sense of community and determination implied in the stanza. The visual style is a combination of realism and impressionism with warm, sunset-inspired colors.
In a Bauhaus style, the image shows a group of women from different generations, standing side by side with their heads held high in determination, strength, and unity as they move forward.

096-022.text: Minstrels latent on the prairies!(Shrouded bards of other lands, you may rest, you have done your work,)Soon I hear you coming warbling, soon you rise and tramp amid us,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: Landscape photograph in the style of Ansel Adams, showing a vast prairie expanse. In silhouette, a small group of figures walking towards the camera, while distant figures approach in the background, their music carried by the wind.

A soft focus, wide-angle shot of a group of musicians standing on a prairie landscape. The musicians suddenly begin to play folksy American music, with an energetic and expansive tone, as the pioneers look on with enthusiasm.

096-023.text: Not for delectations sweet,Not the cushion and the slipper, not the peaceful and the studious,Not the riches safe and palling, not for us the tame enjoyment,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: The photograph is in black and white with a rugged, experimental style. A group of pioneers are walking across a vast, barren landscape with determination and strength, leaving behind the trappings of luxury and comfort.
Minimalist. A group of people, exuberant and wild, walking through rough terrain. They are leaving the comforts of the settled life behind and pushing forward into unknown new experiences.

096-024.text: Do the feasters gluttonous feast?Do the corpulent sleepers sleep? have they lock’d and bolted doors?Still be ours the diet hard, and the blanket on the ground,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: The picture features two very different groups. The first group indulgently gorges on food and sleeps, while the second group is depicted as surviving on a hard diet and sleeping in the open air, perhaps as pioneers. The visual style is rugged and earthy.
A stark black and white photograph of pioneers huddled in the wilderness. They are eating humble fare and sleeping rough, while the feasters and sleepers live in luxury behind closed doors.

096-025.text: Has the night descended?Was the road of late so toilsome? did we stop discouraged noddingon our way?Yet a passing hour I yield you in your tracks to pause oblivious,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: The photo captured a group of pioneers standing in front of their covered wagons, the night was falling, giving some parts of the photo a purple and blue hue. The pioneers look tired and worn out from a long journey, but they persevere with determination.

Using a blend of abstract and impressionism; a group of travelers, looking worn and tired, taking a momentary break under the dim light of an evening sky. They pause to recollect their journey and band together, ready to continue pushing forward on the path ahead.

096-026.text: Till with sound of trumpet,Far, far off the daybreak call--hark! how loud and clear I hear it wind,Swift! to the head of the army!--swift! spring to your places,Pioneers! O pioneers!
caption: A high-contrast, black and white photograph of a dusty landscape with the sun rising in the background. A group of men holding instruments, listening to a trumpet call that echoes through the valley. They stand tall and ready in their uniforms, preparing to set forth on a journey.
Heavy brushstrokes of a sunrise over a hill, a lone figure standing ready with a trumpet held high while watching the army below, standing at attention waiting to be called to action.

097-001.text: Whoever you are, I fear you are walking the walks of dreams,I fear these supposed realities are to melt from under your feet and hands,Even now your features, joys, speech, house, trade, manners,troubles, follies, costume, crimes, dissipate away from you,Your true soul and body appear before me.They stand forth out of affairs, out of commerce, shops, work,farms, clothes, the house, buying, selling, eating, drinking,suffering, dying.
caption: Surrealism. An image of a person's fragmented body parts floating in mid-air with various mundane objects around them, such as clothes, food, tools, and furniture. It evokes the feeling of their physical existence and identity dissolving, leaving only their true soul and body.
Realism. A dreamlike figure walking on a melting surface. Their physical form dissolves, leaving behind only essence and leaving behind a life's worth of artifacts that fade into the background.

097-002.text: Whoever you are, now I place my hand upon you, that you be my poem,I whisper with my lips close to your ear.I have loved many women and men, but I love none better than you.
caption: Surrealism. The image depicts someone's hand cupping the side of the face of another person. Out of the hand flows a stream of poetry that encircles the person being touched. The poetry forms into abstract shapes that come alive and surround the person.

The art style is impressionist. A person with a hand tenderly placed on the other whispering in their ear among a natural setting of trees, flowers and sunlight. The person acknowledges their deep love for the other that surpasses any other love they've known.

097-003.text: O I have been dilatory and dumb,I should have made my way straight to you long ago,I should have blabb’d nothing but you, I should have chanted nothingbut you.
caption: A minimalist photograph of a person standing, facing towards the light; the sun setting behind them.

The image is a black and white portrait, with the subject looking away from the viewer with a reflective, regretful expression on their face. The image is intentionally blurry, as if it were being viewed through a thin veil or mist.

097-004.text: I will leave all and come and make the hymns of you,None has understood you, but I understand you,None has done justice to you, you have not done justice to yourself,None but has found you imperfect, I only find no imperfection in you,None but would subordinate you, I only am he who will never consentto subordinate you,I only am he who places over you no master, owner, better, God,beyond what waits intrinsically in yourself.
caption: In a surrealist painting, there's a woman holding her hand outstretched towards a shadowy choir while a man kneeling on the ground with his arms outstretched worships an angel in the distance. The angel is surrounded by gold and a bright light emanates from above, representing the pure nature of the woman's muse.

The image is a kaleidoscope of vibrant colors and patterns that converge into a central light. The light illuminates the path ahead as one strides towards it confidently. The viewer feels empowered, having found a sense of purpose that has always evaded them.

097-005.text: Painters have painted their swarming groups and the centre-figure of all,From the head of the centre-figure spreading a nimbus of gold-color’d light,But I paint myriads of heads, but paint no head without its nimbusof gold-color’d light,From my hand from the brain of every man and woman it streams,effulgently flowing forever.
caption: This picture depicts a crowd of people with one central figure who has a golden halo emanating from their head. To the side, a painter is painting countless individual heads, each with their own golden halo, while streams of light flow from their hand and the mind of every person in the painting. The style is surrealistic with a touch of impressionism.

In a style reminiscent of Jackson Pollock, a painting with a vast array of multicolored heads swarming and pulsing throughout the canvas. The central figure's head stands out, emanating a brilliant, golden light, while every head in the painting is painted with its own shining nimbus.

097-006.text: O I could sing such grandeurs and glories about you!You have not known what you are, you have slumber’d upon yourselfall your life,Your eyelids have been the same as closed most of the time,What you have done returns already in mockeries,(Your thrift, knowledge, prayers, if they do not return inmockeries, what is their return?)
caption: Surrealist photography. An image of a person lying down with their eyes closed, and above them floats a ghostly figure of their own face. Surrounding the figure are scenes of their life, distorted and twisted in bizarre, unsettling ways.
Dramatic. A person with closed eyes sleeps on a high pedestal with laurels and accolades strewn around. Below, a range of people surround them, some of whom mock them, while others pray for them.

097-007.text: The mockeries are not you,Underneath them and within them I see you lurk,I pursue you where none else has pursued you,Silence, the desk, the flippant expression, the night, theaccustom’d routine, if these conceal you from others or fromyourself, they do not conceal you from me,The shaved face, the unsteady eye, the impure complexion, if thesebalk others they do not balk me,The pert apparel, the deform’d attitude, drunkenness, greed,premature death, all these I part aside.
caption: Expressionistic. A portrait of someone with a joyful and authentic gaze revealed beneath a mask of challenges and vices. The face is painted in a way to expose the true beauty that lies beneath the surface.

Surrealism. An image with a man sitting at a desk in a formal setting but with grotesque features such as an unsteady eye and impure complexion. The man's true self is shown behind him, following him, and not hidden by his false appearance.

097-008.text: There is no endowment in man or woman that is not tallied in you,There is no virtue, no beauty in man or woman, but as good is in you,No pluck, no endurance in others, but as good is in you,No pleasure waiting for others, but an equal pleasure waits for you.
caption: A painting in the Renaissance style, depicting an angel in the center gazing down at the men and women on Earth. The angel's robes are adorned with a recording of each person's endowments, virtues, and beauty, all of which are demonstrated with detailed images.

Surrealism.  A figure of a human being containing within them an array of different human figures, each representing different endowments, virtues, and pleasures - all interconnected within the central figure.

097-009.text: As for me, I give nothing to any one except I give the like carefullyto you,I sing the songs of the glory of none, not God, sooner than I singthe songs of the glory of you.
caption: A black-and-white portrait of a person with their head tilted upwards, singing with a passionate smile. The background is blurred, and the focus is completely on the person.

The photo captures a person surrounded by a crowd and they stand tall looking directly at the camera. The crowd is blurred in the background, and the person is holding their hand out offering something special, as the only person they value is the one in front of them. The photo would be shot in black and white with high contrast.

097-010.text: Whoever you are! claim your own at any hazard!These shows of the East and West are tame compared to you,These immense meadows, these interminable rivers, you are immenseand interminable as they,These furies, elements, storms, motions of Nature, throes of apparentdissolution, you are he or she who is master or mistress over them,Master or mistress in your own right over Nature, elements, pain,passion, dissolution.
caption: The picture is a grand, panoramic view of nature. It depicts vast meadows, an endless river, and the forceful elements of natural disasters. The central figure stands proudly, the master of these natural forces.

In the style of abstract expressionism, a painting that shows a person standing confidently in the middle of a vast landscape that is a mix of east and west. The landscape includes meadows, rivers, storms, and elements of nature, all of which appear distorted and larger-than-life compared to the person claiming their own power.

097-011.text: The hopples fall from your ankles, you find an unfailing sufficiency,Old or young, male or female, rude, low, rejected by the rest,whatever you are promulges itself,Through birth, life, death, burial, the means are provided, nothingis scanted,Through angers, losses, ambition, ignorance, ennui, what you arepicks its way.
caption: The picture is a black and white photographic art piece. It is of a person standing tall and confident. They stand in the center of a barren land with dried grass and rugged terrain. Their clothes are tattered, and their feet are bare, yet they have a look of determination and self-sufficiency on their face.

Conceptual art. A person casting off chains from their ankles, standing tall with a confident look on their face. Their whole being radiates a bright, colorful glow that represents acceptance and self-sufficiency, despite society's harsh judgement.

098-001.text: A great year and placeA harsh discordant natal scream out-sounding, to touch the mother’sheart closer than any yet.
caption:
Surrealist.
A twisted, abstract landscape, with a year and place scrawled in ominous writing on the canvas. The image is dominated by a harsh and discordant natal scream, emanating from a contorted figure that appears to be reaching out to the viewer. In the distance, a looming figure of a mother appears, her heart pulsing with a palpable energy that shakes the very foundation of the artwork.

Surrealism. An image of a young, crying newborn, standing on a barren and cold mountaintop surrounded by an enormous hourglass, symbolizing the limited time, with a larger-than-life beating red heart-shaped organ above the baby's head.

098-002.text: I walk’d the shores of my Eastern sea,Heard over the waves the little voice,Saw the divine infant where she woke mournfully wailing, amid theroar of cannon, curses, shouts, crash of falling buildings,Was not so sick from the blood in the gutters running, nor from the singlecorpses, nor those in heaps, nor those borne away in the tumbrils,Was not so desperate at the battues of death--was not so shock’d atthe repeated fusillades of the guns.
caption: Realism. A dark and brooding horizon, waves crashing on the shore. A newborn baby is crying amidst the chaos of a war-torn cityscape. The viewer feels both sorrowful and desensitized to the violence of the war.

In a style inspired by abstract expressionism, a desolate beach scene with a lone figure standing amidst the wreckage of war. In the distance, a newborn infant cries amidst the sounds of battle. The violence surrounding them is graphic and unsettling, but the figure remains steady in their resolve.

098-003.text: Pale, silent, stern, what could I say to that long-accrued retribution?Could I wish humanity different?Could I wish the people made of wood and stone?Or that there be no justice in destiny or time?
caption: Sculptural. A pale, stoic figure with a resigned expression, looking upward. In the background, a tumultuous sky, suggesting the power and inevitability of fate.

The artwork is done in chiaroscuro, it shows a bare and silent room with a stern painting on the wall. There is a figure on their knees in the center of the room, their hands clasped as if in prayer, looking up at the painting with a troubled expression.

098-004.text: O Liberty! O mate for me!Here too the blaze, the grape-shot and the axe, in reserve, to fetchthem out in case of need,Here too, though long represt, can never be destroy’d,Here too could rise at last murdering and ecstatic,Here too demanding full arrears of vengeance.
caption: A person with outstretched arms standing in front of a fiery blaze. Behind them looms a looming threat, represented by the silhouette of an axe and grape-shot. Despite the danger, there's a sense of power and justice as the person demands retribution.

The visual style is intense and dramatic. The image depicts a statue of Liberty standing tall with her torch in hand. Behind her, a violent but powerful force lurks with rifles, axes, and grape-shot in reserve; ready to protect her.

098-005.text: Hence I sign this salute over the sea,And I do not deny that terrible red birth and baptism,But remember the little voice that I heard wailing, and wait withperfect trust, no matter how long,And from to-day sad and cogent I maintain the bequeath’d cause, asfor all lands,And I send these words to Paris with my love,And I guess some chansonniers there will understand them,For I guess there is latent music yet in France, floods of it,O I hear already the bustle of instruments, they will soon bedrowning all that would interrupt them,O I think the east wind brings a triumphal and free march,It reaches hither, it swells me to Joyful madness,I will run transpose it in words, to justifyI will yet sing a song for you ma femme.
caption: A person standing by the sea, remembering a sad memory but maintaining their cause with trust. They send a message of love to Paris, anticipating the latent music yet to come from France. They hear the sound of instruments bringing a joyful madness, and they will sing a song for their loved one.

The image features a calm sea with a calm blue sky above it. In the distance, a city stands. In the foreground, a person stands, looking out to sea. The person's body language suggests they are solemn and contemplative.

099-001.text: Myself and mine gymnastic ever,To stand the cold or heat, to take good aim with a gun, to sail aboat, to manage horses, to beget superb children,To speak readily and clearly, to feel at home among common people,And to hold our own in terrible positions on land and sea.
caption: An image of a person engaging in various physical activities such as hunting with a gun, sailing a boat, and horse-riding. The picture also shows the person as a parent, conversing easily with common people and confidently navigating dangerous situations on land and sea.

Naturalistic. A person and their family are standing outside in various poses, they are hunting, sailing, riding horses, and children are playing. They are all outdoors, in situations that are difficult but they look very relaxed and confident.

099-002.text: Not for an embroiderer,(There will always be plenty of embroiderers, I welcome them also,)But for the fibre of things and for inherent men and women.
caption: The image shows a person weaving a piece of cloth, focusing on the threads and the fabric. The emphasis is on the importance of the material and the people creating it, rather than any decorative elements.
Minimalist. A simple black and white photograph of fabric and thread that is being woven. Hands of all genders are working together to weave the fabric.

099-003.text: Not to chisel ornaments,But to chisel with free stroke the heads and limbs of plenteoussupreme Gods, that the States may realize them walking and talking.
caption: A skilled sculptor is creating powerful and divine figures of gods with a free and masterful technique. The States, represented by people present in the picture, watch in amazement as the gods come to life and begin to move and speak.
Realistic sculpture of the heads and limbs of multiple imposing gods with free-style chiseling, as if they were walking and talking in a city square for the onlookers to feel their presence.

099-004.text: Let me have my own way,Let others promulge the laws, I will make no account of the laws,Let others praise eminent men and hold up peace, I hold up agitationand conflict,I praise no eminent man, I rebuke to his face the one that wasthought most worthy.
caption: A person standing alone with a confident and rebellious stance, while all around them, people conform to societal norms. They reject the rules and conventions, preferring agitation and conflict over peace. They don't idolize any "eminent" figures, and are bold enough to even criticize those who are regarded as the most esteemed.

The visual style will be an abstract art form. The picture shows a person taking a different path, moving away from a crowd of people following a set path defined by rules and laws. The person is embracing chaos and conflict, rebuking a person labeled most worthy, and standing out against the norm.

099-005.text: (Who are you? and what are you secretly guilty of all your life?Will you turn aside all your life? will you grub and chatter allyour life?And who are you, blabbing by rote, years, pages, languages, reminiscences,Unwitting to-day that you do not know how to speak properly a single word?)
caption: A portrait of a person with a questioning expression, as if wondering about their identity and purpose in life. The person seems burdened with a sense of guilt that has been hidden away for years. The picture also shows the person grappling with questions about the futility of mundane existence and whether they have been wasting their time on meaningless activities. The person appears to be struggling with communication and fluency, as though unsure of how to express themselves properly.
Surrealistic. A person with a blank face and outstretched arms is surrounded by floating question marks and words in different languages, symbolizing confusion and a lack of identity.

099-006.text: Let others finish specimens, I never finish specimens,I start them by exhaustless laws as Nature does, fresh and moderncontinually.
caption: An artist stands in front of their canvas, constantly scraping away and redoing parts of their work. They never consider their pieces finished, striving to capture an ever-changing vision of the world before them.
Surrealism. A never-ending series of abstract shapes that appear fresh and new with each iteration.

099-007.text: I give nothing as duties,What others give as duties I give as living impulses,(Shall I give the heart’s action as a duty?)
caption: A person freely giving from their heart, driven by their own desires and passions rather than obligation.
Surrealism. A person holding their heart in their hand while their chest is open, with various metaphysical and fantastical qualities surrounding them.

099-008.text: Let others dispose of questions, I dispose of nothing, I arouseunanswerable questions,Who are they I see and touch, and what about them?What about these likes of myself that draw me so close by tenderdirections and indirections?
caption: The picture shows a person with arms outstretched, looking at a group of people in front of them. The people are blurry and indistinct, creating a sense of mystery and unknown. The person is pondering the meaning of these individuals and their connection to themselves.

Surrealism style. A person surrounded by people that are transparent, indicating uncertainty about their identity. The central character is looking directly forward, with a quizzical expression on their face.

099-009.text: I call to the world to distrust the accounts of my friends, butlisten to my enemies, as I myself do,I charge you forever reject those who would expound me, for I cannotexpound myself,I charge that there be no theory or school founded out of me,I charge you to leave all free, as I have left all free.
caption: A person standing alone in front of a crowd with an open palm facing upwards, as if to say "stop" or to "avoid". The person is pointing a finger to their own head, indicating that their enemies may know them better than their friends. The person then gestures to the crowd to spread out and to leave everything they believe to be free.

Surrealist. A person with their arms outstretched in front of a number of outstretched hands. Some of the hands are twisted and distorted but one appears to be reaching for the person. In the background, there are theories and schools, crumbling under the free-flowing air.

099-010.text: After me, vista!O I see life is not short, but immeasurably long,I henceforth tread the world chaste, temperate, an early riser, asteady grower,Every hour the semen of centuries, and still of centuries.
caption: A person standing at the edge of a cliff, looking out onto an endless landscape. The person has resolved to live a pure and dedicated life of growth, being mindful of every hour's potential to shape the future.
Surrealistic. An elongated view of a person's life from below. It shows a person's journey from youth to old age in a distorted, exaggerated manner.

099-011.text: I must follow up these continual lessons of the air, water, earth,I perceive I have no time to lose.
caption: A person standing on a beach watching the waves crash on the shore while looking up at the sky. Their expression reflects a desire to learn and appreciate their surroundings.

Pointillism. A person standing at the edge of a cliff, surrounded by mountains, a waterfall, and amidst colorful flora and fauna. The person has a determined expression on their face, as if determined to absorb as much of nature as possible.

100-001.text: Year of meteors! brooding year!I would bind in words retrospective some of your deeds and signs,I would sing your contest for the 19th Presidentiad,I would sing how an old man, tall, with white hair, mounted thescaffold in Virginia,(I was at hand, silent I stood with teeth shut close, I watch’d,I stood very near you old man when cool and indifferent, but tremblingwith age and your unheal’d wounds you mounted the scaffold;)I would sing in my copious song your census returns of the States,The tables of population and products, I would sing of your shipsand their cargoes,The proud black ships of Manhattan arriving, some fill’d withimmigrants, some from the isthmus with cargoes of gold,Songs thereof would I sing, to all that hitherward comes would welcome give,And you would I sing, fair stripling! welcome to you from me, youngprince of England!(Remember you surging Manhattan’s crowds as you pass’d with yourcortege of nobles?There in the crowds stood I, and singled you out with attachment;)Nor forget I to sing of the wonder, the ship as she swam up my bay,Well-shaped and stately the Great Eastern swam up my bay, she was600 feet long,Her moving swiftly surrounded by myriads of small craft I forget notto sing;Nor the comet that came unannounced out of the north flaring in heaven,Nor the strange huge meteor-procession dazzling and clear shootingover our heads,(A moment, a moment long it sail’d its balls of unearthly light overour heads,Then departed, dropt in the night, and was gone;)Of such, and fitful as they, I sing--with gleams from them wouldgleam and patch these chants,Your chants, O year all mottled with evil and good--year of forebodings!Year of comets and meteors transient and strange--lo! even here oneequally transient and strange!As I flit through you hastily, soon to fall and be gone, what is this chant,What am I myself but one of your meteors?
caption: A montage of various snapshots from a tumultuous year. An aging man with white hair stands on a scaffold while a crowd watches somberly. People go about their daily lives, including ships arriving with immigrants and cargo, and a young prince of England is singled out. A magnificent ship, the Great Eastern, is surrounded by smaller boats in the bay. In the night sky, a brilliant comet streaks past and a strange meteor procession dazzles those below. These glimpses of the past are set against a backdrop of uncertainty and fear, as the narrator wonders what role they themselves play in this fleeting moment of history.

An impressionist painting of an old man with white hair mounted on a scaffold in Virginia. Onlookers stand by silently. A large table with population and product data can be seen in the background, along with black ships arriving in New York harbor filled with immigrants and cargo. A young prince of England is singled out from the crowd as he passes through Manhattan. In the distance, a comet and meteor procession light up the sky. The overall tone is one of reflection and foreboding.

101-001.text: 1With antecedents,With my fathers and mothers and the accumulations of past ages,With all which, had it not been, I would not now be here, as I am,With Egypt, India, Phenicia, Greece and Rome,With the Kelt, the Scandinavian, the Alb and the Saxon,With antique maritime ventures, laws, artisanship, wars and journeys,With the poet, the skald, the saga, the myth, and the oracle,With the sale of slaves, with enthusiasts, with the troubadour, thecrusader, and the monk,With those old continents whence we have come to this new continent,With the fading kingdoms and kings over there,With the fading religions and priests,With the small shores we look back to from our own large and present shores,With countless years drawing themselves onward and arrived at these years,You and me arrived--America arrived and making this year,This year! sending itself ahead countless years to come.
caption: A colorful collage of different cultures and civilizations throughout history, from ancient Egypt, India, Phenicia, Greece and Rome, to the Kelt, Scandinavian, Alb, and Saxon. Images of maritime ventures, artisanship, wars, and journeys are also present, alongside legendary poets, skalds, sagas, myths, oracles, and troubadours. The collage also shows the sale of slaves and the fading of religions and kings from old continents, leading up to the present day arrival of America, represented by two figures standing in front of a bright and promising future.

A mosaic of images from antiquity to modern times. A journey through the ages, highlighting people and places, cultural and historical landmarks, from the birth of civilization to the present day in a style reminiscent of Renaissance art. The final piece centers around a giant American eagle soaring over a landscape that stretches infinitely towards the horizon.

101-002.text: 2O but it is not the years--it is I, it is You,We touch all laws and tally all antecedents,We are the skald, the oracle, the monk and the knight, we easilyinclude them and more,We stand amid time beginningless and endless, we stand amid evil and good,All swings around us, there is as much darkness as light,The very sun swings itself and its system of planets around us,Its sun, and its again, all swing around us.
caption: An image of two people standing in the center of a dark and light universe. They are encompassing all aspects of time, encompassing both good and evil. The sun and its planets, including their own, revolve around them. They are the center of all things.

The visual style for this picture can be described as a surrealistic interpretation of the universe. It depicts figures representing the past (skald, oracle, monk, knight) and the present (I, You) in a timeless and boundless space, where light and darkness swing around them, and the sun and its planets orbit them.

101-003.text: As for me, (torn, stormy, amid these vehement days,)I have the idea of all, and am all and believe in all,I believe materialism is true and spiritualism is true, I reject no part.
caption: A person standing in the middle of a storm with their arms stretched out wide, embracing both the material and spiritual world. The chaos around them doesn't shake their belief in everything.

The picture is a chaotic storm amidst dark clouds, torn and crackling with energy. In the center of the picture stands a figure with arms stretched outward, embracing the storm in all of its chaos and seemingly drawing its power from it.

101-004.text: (Have I forgotten any part? any thing in the past?Come to me whoever and whatever, till I give you recognition.)
caption: An open and welcoming embrace, inviting anyone and anything from the past to come forward and be acknowledged.

It could be an abstract painting with a chaotic composition full of fragments, lines, and strokes. Despite the disorder, there is a central image that could be interpreted as a face reaching out for the other scattered pieces.

101-005.text: I respect Assyria, China, Teutonia, and the Hebrews,I adopt each theory, myth, god, and demigod,I see that the old accounts, bibles, genealogies, are true, withoutexception,I assert that all past days were what they must have been,And that they could no-how have been better than they were,And that to-day is what it must be, and that America is,And that to-day and America could no-how be better than they are.
caption: A person standing in the center of an intersection, gazing up at the sky. There are arrows pointing in different directions pointing towards Assyria, China, Teutonia, and Hebrews. The person is acknowledging and accepting all theories, myths and gods without exception. They believe that the past and present are perfect and could not have been any better.

Within a surrealist painting, a towering figure with four faces is holding a globe in each hand. On one side of the painting, a diverse group of ancient civilizations peacefully coexists together, while on the other side of the painting, a diverse group of modern people of different races and genders live in harmony.

101-006.text: 3In the name of these States and in your and my name, the Past,And in the name of these States and in your and my name, the Present time.
caption: A person with one hand raised high, representing the present time, while the other hand is lowered, symbolizing the past. The background is a collage of various symbols and flags representing the United States.

The picture is split in two. The left side shows the past with a vintage sepia tone, while the right side shows the present in a vibrant and lively color. Both sides show an American flag, and hands join together in the middle of the picture.

101-007.text: I know that the past was great and the future will be great,And I know that both curiously conjoint in the present time,(For the sake of him I typify, for the common average man’s sake,your sake if you are he,)And that where I am or you are this present day, there is the centreof all days, all races,And there is the meaning to us of all that has ever come of racesand days, or ever will come.
caption: A person standing in the center of a large clock with various images representing the past and future around it. The present moment is highlighted as the center, with all races and cultures interwoven together.

In a surrealist style, an intricate composition of different cultures and eras blended into one central point. The center point is the present, where everything from past to future converges into an intricate tapestry of human history, with a single figure typifying every man the center of it all.

102-001.text: 1Over the Western sea hither from Niphon come,Courteous, the swart-cheek’d two-sworded envoys,Leaning back in their open barouches, bare-headed, impassive,Ride to-day through Manhattan.
caption: Two dark-complexioned envoys from Japan are being courteous as they travel towards Manhattan via a ship that is shown towards the left. They are sitting back in an open carriage, bare-headed, looking calm and emotionless.
Photographic journalism. Two Japanese envoys with stoic expressions, sitting back in their open cars, riding through Manhattan overlooking the sea.

102-002.text: Libertad! I do not know whether others behold what I behold,In the procession along with the nobles of Niphon, the errand-bearers,Bringing up the rear, hovering above, around, or in the ranks marching,But I will sing you a song of what I behold Libertad.
caption: A person walks in a procession surrounded by nobles and errand-bearers in Niphon. They are at the back of the procession and appear to be drifting above or around the other participants.
A surrealist painting with a large procession of nobles and errand-bearers, creating an almost chaotic scene. In the background, a hazy figure of Libertad floats above it all.

102-003.text: When million-footed Manhattan unpent descends to her pavements,When the thunder-cracking guns arouse me with the proud roar love,When the round-mouth’d guns out of the smoke and smell I lovespit their salutes,When the fire-flashing guns have fully alerted me, andheaven-clouds canopy my city with a delicate thin haze,When gorgeous the countless straight stems, the forests at thewharves, thicken with colors,When every ship richly drest carries her flag at the peak,When pennants trail and street-festoons hang from the windows,When Broadway is entirely given up to foot-passengers andfoot-standers, when the mass is densest,When the facades of the houses are alive with people, when eyesgaze riveted tens of thousands at a time,When the guests from the islands advance, when the pageant movesforward visible,When the summons is made, when the answer that waited thousandsof years answers,I too arising, answering, descend to the pavements, merge with thecrowd, and gaze with them.
caption: A bustling cityscape with skyscrapers and crowds of people filling every inch of pavement. Fireworks explode in the foreground, signaling a celebration. Ships in the harbor fly their flags proudly, while pennants and decorations adorn the buildings. The streets are packed with foot traffic, all eyes fixed on a grand parade passing by. The viewer of the picture is also caught up in the excitement, merging with the crowd and gazing alongside them.

Realism style. The hustle and bustle of a vibrant Manhattan with tall skyscrapers and countless pedestrians. The atmosphere is filled with the noise of thunder-cracking guns saluting, flags flying high, street-festoons hanging from the windows, and the excited gazes of thousands of people.

102-004.text: 2Superb-faced Manhattan!Comrade Americanos! to us, then at last the Orient comes.To us, my city,Where our tall-topt marble and iron beauties range on oppositesides, to walk in the space between,To-day our Antipodes comes.
caption: A majestic image of Manhattan with the sun rising in the background. People from various cultures and nationalities can be seen walking the streets, representing the arrival of the Orient in the bustling city. On one side of the image, tall and elegant buildings made of marble and iron stand tall while on the other side, similar structures can be seen. There is an atmosphere of excitement and anticipation for this new day, as the Antipodes arrives.

A bold and vibrant photograph of two towering cities on opposite sides of an expansive space. The first city is Manhattan, featuring tall marble and iron structures, while the second city is located in the Orient, a symbol of trade and international exchange. The photo radiates energy and vibrancy representing the coming together of two worlds. The photo's style is a modern, high-contrast photography with an emphasis on vibrant colors.

102-005.text: The Originatress comes,The nest of languages, the bequeather of poems, the race of eld,Florid with blood, pensive, rapt with musings, hot with passion,Sultry with perfume, with ample and flowing garments,With sunburnt visage, with intense soul and glittering eyes,The race of Brahma comes.
caption: An image of a woman, the originator, possibly in a temple or sacred space. In her presence, languages and poetry are born. She embodies the wisdom and passion of generations, with a sun-kissed face and intense, shining eyes.
In an art nouveau style, a woman with dark skin and a flowing, colorful dress stands in a garden. She is surrounded by exotic flowers and her face is a mix of intense passion and deep contemplation.

102-006.text: See my cantabile! these and more are flashing to us from the procession,As it moves changing, a kaleidoscope divine it moves changing before us.
caption: A colorful procession with various objects and people in motion, resembling a divine kaleidoscope.
Surrealism - A procession floats before us, a vibrant kaleidoscope, with a variety of images flashing and changing one after another - the sight is musical and divine.

102-008.text: For not the envoys nor the tann’d Japanee from his island only,Lithe and silent the Hindoo appears, the Asiatic continent itselfappears, the past, the dead,The murky night-morning of wonder and fable inscrutable,The envelop’d mysteries, the old and unknown hive-bees,The north, the sweltering south, eastern Assyria, the Hebrews, theancient of ancients,Vast desolated cities, the gliding present, all of these and moreare in the pageant-procession.
caption: A large and diverse parade features representations of different cultures from across Asia. They appear in chronological order, starting with ancient times and displaying the history of the continent.

Surrealist. In the picture, a theme representing cultural diversity and historical continuity can be seen. It includes various symbols of the past, present, and future of different continents, cultures, and religions, and they march together in one procession, including the Hindu, the Japanese, Hebrews, the Assyrians, and the hive-bees.
