231-004.text: Not you alone proud truths of the world,Nor you alone ye facts of modern science,But myths and fables of eld, Asia’s, Africa’s fables,The far-darting beams of the spirit, the unloos’d dreams,The deep diving bibles and legends,The daring plots of the poets, the elder religions;O you temples fairer than lilies pour’d over by the rising sun!O you fables spurning the known, eluding the hold of the known,mounting to heaven!You lofty and dazzling towers, pinnacled, red as roses, burnish’dwith gold!Towers of fables immortal fashion’d from mortal dreams!You too I welcome and fully the same as the rest!You too with joy I sing.
caption: A picture of a grand cathedral with intricate towers and pinnacles that glisten in the sunlight. The walls are decorated with colorful frescos depicting ancient myths and legends from around the world. In the foreground, individuals of various cultures and time periods stand together in awe of the magnificent structure, appreciating the diverse fables and stories that have inspired it.

Surrealist: A towering stack of ancient books, overflowing with fables and legends from every corner of the world. A brilliant red glow emanates from between the pages, casting everything with a fiery, gold reflection.

231-005.text: Passage to India!Lo, soul, seest thou not God’s purpose from the first?The earth to be spann’d, connected by network,The races, neighbors, to marry and be given in marriage,The oceans to be cross’d, the distant brought near,The lands to be welded together.
caption: A world map with various countries and oceans interconnected by a web of lines, symbolizing the unity and harmony of different cultures and races. A bright light shines over the map, as if portraying the divine purpose behind this union.

In a globe-like structure, continents and oceans are interconnected and interwoven by an intricate web of metallic ropes, symbolizing global integration and connectivity. Within this connection, people of different races, ethnicities and cultures are depicted in various modes of intermingling, such as marriages or simple conversations. The view is panoramic, and the horizon extends into infinity, hinting at endless possibilities.

231-006.text: A worship new I sing,You captains, voyagers, explorers, yours,You engineers, you architects, machinists, yours,You, not for trade or transportation only,But in God’s name, and for thy sake O soul.
caption: A painting of diverse characters of all genders and races standing together, holding hands, looking to the sky as they sing in unison. There are captains, voyagers, and explorers wearing sea-faring clothes, and engineers, architects, and machinists in suits with tools in their hands. It is clear that they are not engaged in a commercial trade or transportation as they raise their voices in worship. It is all in the name of God and for the benefit of the soul.

In Cubism style, a composite image of varied professions including explorers, engineers, and architects gathered together. They are all singing in worship, their expressions and movement indicating that they are united in their purpose and dedication to a higher power.

231-007.text: 3Passage to India!Lo soul for thee of tableaus twain,I see in one the Suez canal initiated, open’d,I see the procession of steamships, the Empress Engenie’s leading the van,I mark from on deck the strange landscape, the pure sky, the levelsand in the distance,I pass swiftly the picturesque groups, the workmen gather’d,The gigantic dredging machines.
caption: A panoramic view of the Suez Canal with a procession of steamships led by the Empress Eugenie at the forefront. A group of workmen can be seen in the distance, along with a strange, but beautiful landscape. Giant dredging machines are working on the canal.

A lively and colorful photograph in the style of impressionism with a sweeping landscape of the Suez canal, busy steamships as they pass through the canal, with the Empress Eugenie's ship leading the way, and giant dredging machines working in the distance.

231-008.text: In one again, different, (yet thine, all thine, O soul, the same,)I see over my own continent the Pacific railroad surmounting every barrier,I see continual trains of cars winding along the Platte carryingfreight and passengers,I hear the locomotives rushing and roaring, and the shrill steam-whistle,I hear the echoes reverberate through the grandest scenery in the world,I cross the Laramie plains, I note the rocks in grotesque shapes,the buttes,I see the plentiful larkspur and wild onions, the barren, colorless,sage-deserts,I see in glimpses afar or towering immediately above me the greatmountains, I see the Wind river and the Wahsatch mountains,I see the Monument mountain and the Eagle’s Nest, I pass thePromontory, I ascend the Nevadas,I scan the noble Elk mountain and wind around its base,I see the Humboldt range, I thread the valley and cross the river,I see the clear waters of lake Tahoe, I see forests of majestic pines,Or crossing the great desert, the alkaline plains, I beholdenchanting mirages of waters and meadows,Marking through these and after all, in duplicate slender lines,Bridging the three or four thousand miles of land travel,Tying the Eastern to the Western sea,The road between Europe and Asia.
caption: A panoramic view of a vast and diverse landscape. In the foreground, a long train winds its way through the plains and mountains, passing by rock formations, wildflowers, and deserts. The steaming locomotive whistles sharply, and the echo resounds through the peaks. Majestic mountains, including the Wind River, Wahsatch, and Humboldt Range are visible in the distance. The train appears to be connecting two distant shores of the continent, bridging thousands of miles of land travel.

The picture is a realistic landscape of the American West during the building of the Pacific railroad, with a focus on the train travel. From the Laramie Plains to the mountain ranges, and across the clear waters of Lake Tahoe, the artist captures the journey, with the railroad tying the Eastern to the Western sea as the focal point.

231-009.text: (Ah Genoese thy dream! thy dream!Centuries after thou art laid in thy grave,The shore thou foundest verifies thy dream.)
caption: A ghostly Genoese explorer looking out over a vast sea with a look of wonder and excitement on his face. The shore in the distance, an indication that his dreams have come true.

Post-impressionist. A figure lying in a grave with undulating waves crashing against the rocky shore in the background. The face in the casket held a peaceful smile as if their dreams had been fulfilled.

231-010.text: 4Passage to India!Struggles of many a captain, tales of many a sailor dead,Over my mood stealing and spreading they come,Like clouds and cloudlets in the unreach’d sky.
caption: An image of a turbulent ocean with dark clouds looming in the sky. The ship struggles to navigate through the rough waters, while the spirits of fallen sailors and the memories of their battles linger in the air like ghostly clouds.

Abstract impressionism. A tumultuous and blurred image portraying a journey to India, with abstract shapes of various shades of blue and green representing the uneasy mood of the travelers, dotted with small bright interruptions that symbolize the tales of struggle and loss.

231-011.text: Along all history, down the slopes,As a rivulet running, sinking now, and now again to the surface rising,A ceaseless thought, a varied train--lo, soul, to thee, thy sight,they rise,The plans, the voyages again, the expeditions;Again Vasco de Gama sails forth,Again the knowledge gain’d, the mariner’s compass,Lands found and nations born, thou born America,For purpose vast, man’s long probation fill’d,Thou rondure of the world at last accomplish’d.
caption: A shallow river running through a landscape of hills and valleys. At points, the river disappears from view, then surfaces again. The ever-present river illustrates the infinite and varied thoughts that have occurred throughout history. The viewer's gaze rises and sees the images of plans and voyages, from Vasco de Gama's journey to the development of the mariner's compass. The scene concludes with the viewer absorbing the purpose and completion of human exploration, with a wide shot of the rounded world, America being born.

Realistic oil painting style. A river flowing down a mountain with varied landscapes on both sides. Ships and boats, carrying different flags, are sailing through the river, while mountains, trees, and towns are seen in the distance. It's a representation of the progress of history and the ventures of humanity.

231-012.text: 5O vast Rondure, swimming in space,Cover’d all over with visible power and beauty,Alternate light and day and the teeming spiritual darkness,Unspeakable high processions of sun and moon and countless stars above,Below, the manifold grass and waters, animals, mountains, trees,With inscrutable purpose, some hidden prophetic intention,Now first it seems my thought begins to span thee.
caption: A breathtaking view of the cosmos, with a vast sphere floating in space. It is covered with visible power and beauty, lit by alternating light and day, as well as dark spiritual shadows. Countless stars, the sun, and moon stretch out above, while below lies a world teeming with life; grass, water, animals, mountains, and trees. There is an inscrutable purpose, and a hidden prophetic intention seems to be implied in this magnificent image.

A wide cosmic image with a swirling rounded shape dominating the center, with visible textures of light and shade, surrounded by suns, moons, and stars of different sizes. Below the cosmic image, there are mountains, forests, glades, and various animals that can be seen.

231-013.text: Down from the gardens of Asia descending radiating,Adam and Eve appear, then their myriad progeny after them,Wandering, yearning, curious, with restless explorations,With questionings, baffled, formless, feverish, with never-happy hearts,With that sad incessant refrain, Wherefore unsatisfied soul? andWhither O mocking life?
caption: Two figures, Adam and Eve, descending from lush gardens of Asia. Their numerous offspring follow and wander about with curious, restless minds. They are baffled and never satisfied, always questioning the meaning of life and their existence.

In a surreal style, Adam and Eve, with their many descendants, descend from an Asian garden. They wander aimlessly, yearning, and questioning their existence with a never-ending refrain: "Why is the soul unsatisfied?" and "Where is life leading us?"

231-014.text: Ah who shall soothe these feverish children?Who Justify these restless explorations?Who speak the secret of impassive earth?Who bind it to us? what is this separate Nature so unnatural?What is this earth to our affections? (unloving earth, without athrob to answer ours,Cold earth, the place of graves.)
caption: A group of restless children are depicted staring at the vast, cold and lifeless earth. They look troubled and feverish, as they seek an answer to their unquenchable curiosity. The earth looks indifferent, as if it has no capacity to answer them, leaving the children's explorations fruitless. The earth is portrayed as a place of the dead, with graves scattered all over.
This photograph depicts a desolate, cold and lifeless earth with no signs of affections. A group of lost and restless explorers are wandering around the barren land with a futile search for answers.

231-015.text: Yet soul be sure the first intent remains, and shall be carried out,Perhaps even now the time has arrived.
caption: A person gazing ahead with determination in their eyes, overlooking a calm ocean.

Surrealist. A digital art piece of a shining crystal sitting on a hand, with a holographic image of the universe emanating from within. The surrounding space is a blend of abstract and realistic components that come together to produce a stunning piece.

231-016.text: After the seas are all cross’d, (as they seem already cross’d,)After the great captains and engineers have accomplish’d their work,After the noble inventors, after the scientists, the chemist, thegeologist, ethnologist,Finally shall come the poet worthy that name,The true son of God shall come singing his songs.
caption: A serene seascape painting with towering ships crossing the ocean in the background. An array of famous explorers, scientists, inventors and engineers from history are depicted as ghostlike figures walking out of the canvas, looking accomplished. Finally, a divine, haloed figure - the true poet and son of God - is seen entering the scene.

Photorealistic. A figure standing at the edge of a body of water looking out, with a bridge in the background symbolising the accomplishment of great engineering feats. A single ray of light shining down on them from the sky as they sing songs of wonder and glory.

231-017.text: Then not your deeds only O voyagers, O scientists and inventors,shall be justified,All these hearts as of fretted children shall be sooth’d,All affection shall be fully responded to, the secret shall be told,All these separations and gaps shall be taken up and hook’d andlink’d together,The whole earth, this cold, impassive, voiceless earth, shall becompletely Justified,Trinitas divine shall be gloriously accomplish’d and compacted bythe true son of God, the poet,(He shall indeed pass the straits and conquer the mountains,He shall double the cape of Good Hope to some purpose,)Nature and Man shall be disjoin’d and diffused no more,The true son of God shall absolutely fuse them.
caption: A painting of a ship at sea, voyagers on board. The ship is sailing towards a bright, glowing horizon. The hearts of the voyagers are depicted as unburdened and at peace. All distances and separations are bridged as if they never existed. The whole earth is bathed in light and all things are justified. In the glowing sky, a divine presence watches over the ship, guiding it towards the horizon where the poet will fulfill his great purpose, fusing nature and man together at last.

The artwork is painted in a surreal style, depicting scientists, adventurers, and inventors unified with their respective discoveries. All gaps and separations are vanishing while the earth and nature are brought seamlessly together in harmony by the poet, who conquers mountains, passes straits, and doubles the cape of Good Hope.

231-018.text: 6Year at whose wide-flung door I sing!Year of the purpose accomplish’d!Year of the marriage of continents, climates and oceans!(No mere doge of Venice now wedding the Adriatic,)I see O year in you the vast terraqueous globe given and giving all,Europe to Asia, Africa join’d, and they to the New World,The lands, geographies, dancing before you, holding a festival garland,As brides and bridegrooms hand in hand.
caption: A large globe is in the center of the picture. Europe, Asia, and Africa are portrayed as brides holding hands and wearing garlands on their heads while standing on the globe. Meanwhile, the New World is represented as a groom with his hand extended towards the other continents, ready to join them. The year is depicted as a glowing light in the background.

The picture is a celebratory affair, with lush greenery and ocean tides as the backdrop. The bride and groom, continents, and oceans shake hands in the middle, with Europe, Africa, and Asia coming together to form a beautiful united globe.

231-019.text: Passage to India!Cooling airs from Caucasus far, soothing cradle of man,The river Euphrates flowing, the past lit up again.
caption: A serene panoramic view of a river flowing through lush hills, with a gentle breeze blowing from a distant mountain range. The scene evokes a sense of ancient history and humanity's birthplace.
Realism. A vast landscape with mountains in the background and a river flowing in the foreground. The scene is illuminated by the setting sun, casting a warm light on the landscape.

231-020.text: Lo soul, the retrospect brought forward,The old, most populous, wealthiest of earth’s lands,The streams of the Indus and the Ganges and their many affluents,(I my shores of America walking to-day behold, resuming all,)The tale of Alexander on his warlike marches suddenly dying,On one side China and on the other side Persia and Arabia,To the south the great seas and the bay of Bengal,The flowing literatures, tremendous epics, religions, castes,Old occult Brahma interminably far back, the tender and junior Buddha,Central and southern empires and all their belongings, possessors,The wars of Tamerlane,the reign of Aurungzebe,The traders, rulers, explorers, Moslems, Venetians, Byzantium, theArabs, Portuguese,The first travelers famous yet, Marco Polo, Batouta the Moor,Doubts to be solv’d, the map incognita, blanks to be fill’d,The foot of man unstay’d, the hands never at rest,Thyself O soul that will not brook a challenge.
caption: A vibrant painting depicting many historical events and cultures from around the globe. In the center, a glowing figure represents the soul. In the background, the Indus and Ganges rivers flow while China, Persia, Arabia, and southern empires can be seen with their possessions. Religious texts and famous expeditions are depicted with Venetians, Byzantium leaders, Arabs, Moslems, and Portuguese traders traveling alongside Marco Polo and Batouta the Moor. There are still blanks on the world map to fill in, and there is a ceaseless flow of human progress. The soul is always ready for the next challenge.

A busy, vibrant tapestry of imagery depicting the rivers Indus and Ganges, Alexander the Great dying while on his war march, lands stretching from Persia to Arabia, and all the people, literature, and wars that have taken place there. The picture is highly detailed and emotive, capturing the spirit of the vast, multilayered history that has shaped these lands.

231-021.text: The mediaeval navigators rise before me,The world of 1492, with its awaken’d enterprise,Something swelling in humanity now like the sap of the earth in spring,The sunset splendor of chivalry declining.
caption: A painting of medieval sailors standing in a boat looking out to sea. In the background, the world of 1492 is depicted, showing new opportunities and hope. The sailors' faces show determination and courage for the journey ahead. The vibrant colors of sunset represent the decline of chivalry's splendor.
Impressionist. A vast blue ocean, ships of medieval navigators rising in the horizon, with the sunset evoking a sense of chivalrous decline, as humanity is stirred with awakened enterprise.

231-022.text: And who art thou sad shade?Gigantic, visionary, thyself a visionary,With majestic limbs and pious beaming eyes,Spreading around with every look of thine a golden world,Enhuing it with gorgeous hues.
caption: A huge and somber silhouette stands tall against a golden background, with radiant eyes and grandiose limbs that seem to be spreading light and color with every glance.
Surrealistic art style. An enormous, ghostly figure with a divine and mesmerizing gaze, emanating colorful and vivid hues, creating a new and mesmerizing realm.

231-023.text: As the chief histrion,Down to the footlights walks in some great scena,Dominating the rest I see the Admiral himself,(History’s type of courage, action, faith,)Behold him sail from Palos leading his little fleet,His voyage behold, his return, his great fame,His misfortunes, calumniators, behold him a prisoner, chain’d,Behold his dejection, poverty, death.
caption: A majestic figure steps forward to the spotlight in a grand play, dominating the attention of the other performers. This is the admiral, a historical representation of courage, action, and faith. Watch him sail from Palos with his fleet, and then see his return, great fame, and subsequent misfortunes. See how his detractors chain and imprison him, leading to his dejection, poverty, and eventual death.

Using a chiaroscuro style, a figure walks confidently onto the stage, with others bowing in deference. The focal point is an Admiral with a determined look on his face, leading a small fleet of ships from Palos. He is shown in various scenes during his historic journey, including moments of misfortune, imprisonment, and poverty, leading ultimately to the end of his life.

231-024.text: (Curious in time I stand, noting the efforts of heroes,Is the deferment long? bitter the slander, poverty, death?Lies the seed unreck’d for centuries in the ground? lo, to God’s dueoccasion,Uprising in the night, it sprouts, blooms,And fills the earth with use and beauty.)
caption: An imposing figure stands tall in the passage of time. They are observing the trials of great heroes. The hero's efforts are met with bitter adversity such as poverty, death, and slander. The hero's seed has lain forgotten in the earth for centuries. However, when the time is ripe, it bursts forth in an explosion of life and blooms, filling the world with its beauty and usefulness.

With a photo-realistic style, the painting depicts a curious figure looking to the horizon observing the efforts of various heroic figures. They stand in a barren ground observing a lone seed lying unreckoned for centuries. The seed suddenly sprouts, blooming into a variety of flora that spreads across the barren land, providing sustenance and beauty.

231-025.text: 7Passage indeed O soul to primal thought,Not lands and seas alone, thy own clear freshness,The young maturity of brood and bloom,To realms of budding bibles.
caption: A person is depicted, with their soul represented as a shining energy rising from their body. The background shows a serene landscape with blooming flowers and young plants. The overall theme is of the youthful new beginnings of life, and the possibilities that await the soul.
Using an impressionist style, a serene landscape with a river flowing through it as seen from the perspective of the soul. The bright colors of spring, including flowers in bloom, filling the image.

231-026.text: O soul, repressless, I with thee and thou with me,Thy circumnavigation of the world begin,Of man, the voyage of his mind’s return,To reason’s early paradise,Back, back to wisdom’s birth, to innocent intuitions,Again with fair creation.
caption: A person is sailing on a boat with an invincible soul. They are starting a journey around the world to explore the voyages of human mind's return to reason's early paradise, where innocent intuitions and fair creations live.

The artwork depicts two figures, one representing the soul and the other representing the mind, holding hands and standing on a shore gazing out at the vast horizon. The world in front of them is filled with wonder, beauty, and possibility, as if they are about to embark on a great journey. In the distance, a lush wilderness and clear blue waters beckon them forward, inviting the mind to start its voyage into the unknown, on a quest to rediscover the innocent intuitions of wisdom's birth.

231-027.text: 8O we can wait no longer,We too take ship O soul,Joyous we too launch out on trackless seas,Fearless for unknown shores on waves of ecstasy to sail,Amid the wafting winds, (thou pressing me to thee, I thee to me, O soul,)Caroling free, singing our song of God,Chanting our chant of pleasant exploration.
caption: A beautiful seascape with a sailing ship in the distance. A silhouetted couple stands at the shore, holding hands and eagerly looking out to the horizon. The sky is filled with wafting clouds, suggesting a journey into the unknown. The couple's joyful expressions indicate their fearless spirit as they set forth to explore new lands. They sing a song of God and pleasant exploration.

The photograph displays an endless ocean landscape, two silhouettes standing at the shore ready to embark on their journey. The ocean is calm, the sky is painted with warm colors of sunset, and birds flying by as if to send them off on their journey.

231-028.text: With laugh and many a kiss,(Let others deprecate, let others weep for sin, remorse, humiliation,)O soul thou pleasest me, I thee.
caption: A joyful picture of two people embracing and kissing, while others in the background weep and lament with feelings of guilt and shame. In the foreground, the free-spirited couple embraces each other with a carefree attitude.
The visual style is contemporary and abstract. The picture shows two individuals laughing and kissing with a multicolored background. The souls of the individuals are united as one.

231-029.text: Ah more than any priest O soul we too believe in God,But with the mystery of God we dare not dally.
caption: A painting featuring two individuals, where one of them is a priest and the other is an ordinary individual. The two are standing facing one another and the image portrays a sense of mutual agreement and understanding as they both believe in God. However, there is an air of caution and respect as they do not attempt to comprehend or determine the mystery of God.

Surrealism. The picture depicts two figures whose hands are replaced with branches or roots, staring at a nebulous figure above. The nebulous, colorful figure represents the mystery of God that both the figures acknowledge, but do not fully comprehend.

231-030.text: O soul thou pleasest me, I thee,Sailing these seas or on the hills, or waking in the night,Thoughts, silent thoughts, of Time and Space and Death, like waters flowing,Bear me indeed as through the regions infinite,Whose air I breathe, whose ripples hear, lave me all over,Bathe me O God in thee, mounting to thee,I and my soul to range in range of thee.
caption: A person standing at the edge of the ocean or on top of a hill or laying awake at night with their eyes closed. A stream of water flowing in the background and the person's body is gradually being covered by the water. The person's face shows a sense of peace as they let the water carry them away to infinite regions. Finally, the picture ends with a bright, golden light encompassing the person and their soul as they ascend towards the heavens.

Dramatic Baroque. The image features a figure with arms outstretched standing on a mountain peak, surrounded by swirling clouds and flowing water. The figure's expression is one of awe and reverence, as they take in the endless expanse of the universe.

231-031.text: O Thou transcendent,Nameless, the fibre and the breath,Light of the light, shedding forth universes, thou centre of them,Thou mightier centre of the true, the good, the loving,Thou moral, spiritual fountain--affection’s source--thou reservoir,(O pensive soul of me--O thirst unsatisfied--waitest not there?Waitest not haply for us somewhere there the Comrade perfect?)Thou pulse--thou motive of the stars, suns, systems,That, circling, move in order, safe, harmonious,Athwart the shapeless vastnesses of space,How should I think, how breathe a single breath, how speak, if, outof myself,I could not launch, to those, superior universes?
caption: A depiction of a bright light that shines brilliantly in the middle of a vast and dark universe. The light is the source of all life and the center of everything that is good, true, and loving. The stars and planets of the universe are all moving in perfect harmony, guided by this powerful and transcendent force. The picture also suggests that there is a yearning for connection with this force, and a desire to understand it more fully.

Surrealist style. The image is a cluster of celestial bodies, as if they are arteries and veins, with a central glowing orb radiating colors outward. In the foreground, a lone figure stands with arms outstretched towards the center, as if searching for meaning and connection within the universe.

231-032.text: Swiftly I shrivel at the thought of God,At Nature and its wonders, Time and Space and Death,But that I, turning, call to thee O soul, thou actual Me,And lo, thou gently masterest the orbs,Thou matest Time, smilest content at Death,And fillest, swellest full the vastnesses of Space.
caption: A person is seen shrinking as they think of God, Nature, Time and Death. However, they turn towards their soul, represented by a bright light, which has the ability to control the universe and concepts like Time and Death. The soul expands and fills up the vast space around it.

Abstract Expressionism. A picture of a person shriveling at the thought of God, but turning towards their soul (pictured as a colorful orb). The soul masterfully controls the universe, allowing the person to confront and conquer their fears of nature, time, space, and death. The painting depicts a sense of expansion and contentment with the vastness of the universe.

231-033.text: Greater than stars or suns,Bounding O soul thou journeyest forth;What love than thine and ours could wider amplify?What aspirations, wishes, outvie thine and ours O soul?What dreams of the ideal? what plans of purity, perfection, strength?What cheerful willingness for others’ sake to give up all?For others’ sake to suffer all?
caption: A bright, radiant sun-like sphere, representing the soul, is soaring through the vast expanse of the universe, outshining all the stars in its way. The sphere depicts love, aspirations, and wishes more expansive than our own. It symbolizes the abundance of ideal dreams, plans of purity, perfection, and strength. It depicts the willingness to sacrifice and suffer for the sake of others.

Surrealism. A figure that is either a soul or one with wings that take up nearly the whole canvas, that glowing and floating above a starry sky. The figure emanates a loving aura while below people are looking up in amazement.

231-034.text: Reckoning ahead O soul, when thou, the time achiev’d,The seas all cross’d, weather’d the capes, the voyage done,Surrounded, copest, frontest God, yieldest, the aim attain’d,As fill’d with friendship, love complete, the Elder Brother found,The Younger melts in fondness in his arms.
caption: A ship sailing on a stormy sea, facing enormous waves and turbulent winds. In the far distance, the sun is setting, indicating a long journey. Upon reaching the other side of the dark, stormy sea, the ship finds itself embraced by a loving and welcoming figure with outstretched arms who has achieved a personal goal. A sense of mutual love and respect between the two figures is palpable.

Using a surrealist style, the image shows a ship journeying through rough seas, reaching the end of the voyage, whereupon the soul is greeted by a God-like entity. The image depicts an emotional reunion between the soul and their loved one.

231-035.text: 9Passage to more than India!Are thy wings plumed indeed for such far flights?O soul, voyagest thou indeed on voyages like those?Disportest thou on waters such as those?Soundest below the Sanscrit and the Vedas?Then have thy bent unleash’d.
caption: An image of a soul soaring towards the horizon with wings fully spread wide. The soul is traveling far distances, perhaps to India, and has the freedom to choose its journey across vast oceans with no specific course. The Sanskrit script and Vedas can be seen in the background as symbols of the rich culture and traditions of the region.

The photograph captures a soaring bird, its wings outstretched, hovering over the infinite expanse of the ocean. The image showcases the courage and adventurousness of the bird as it ventures towards far-flung horizons, exploring uncharted territories.

231-036.text: Passage to you, your shores, ye aged fierce enigmas!Passage to you, to mastership of you, ye strangling problems!You, strew’d with the wrecks of skeletons, that, living, never reach’d you.
caption: A dark and turbulent sea with storm clouds in the background. The waves are crashing against jagged rocks. In the foreground, there is a boat with a determined sailor, staring out towards the direction of the stormy sea, as if in search of answers to the challenging problems of life. On the boat rests scattered bones of previous sailors who attempted, but never succeeded in conquering the challenges of the sea.
Surrealist. A person walks on a path toward a large ocean with violent waves, while skeletal remains surround them on either side.

231-037.text: Passage to more than India!O secret of the earth and sky!Of you O waters of the sea! O winding creeks and rivers!Of you O woods and fields! of you strong mountains of my land!Of you O prairies! of you gray rocks!O morning red! O clouds! O rain and snows!O day and night, passage to you!
caption: A magnificent landscape painting showing the vast beauty of nature, consisting of a panoramic view of a river gracefully curving through a lush forest. Mountain range standing tall in the background with hints of snow on their peaks. The sky, filled with clouds and appearing like an infinite canvas captured during both the day and night.
Surreal. A large hand reaching out toward a vast, open seascape. The hand is enormous, consuming everything it touches — forests, mountains, clouds, rocks.

231-039.text: O sun and moon and all you stars! Sirius and Jupiter!Passage to you!
caption: A stunning night sky filled with countless shining stars and two prominently shining orbs, the moon and sun. The brightest star, Sirius, and the gas giant Jupiter also form part of this celestial wonder. The scene evokes a sense of longing and a desire to travel through space towards these objects.

Surrealism. The silhouette of a person standing on the edge of a cliff, reaching out towards the moon and stars. The person appears to elongated and reaching as if their physical body is stretching towards the sky.

231-040.text: Passage, immediate passage! the blood burns in my veins!Away O soul! hoist instantly the anchor!
caption: A black and white image of a person standing at the edge of a pier, looking out at the vast, open sea. The wind is blowing their hair and clothes, and their face is contorted with excitement and anticipation. The person is ready to embark on a new journey and is urging their soul to take flight and leave any doubts or fears behind.

The photo is dark and blurry, with a hint of motion blur. The silhouette of someone is standing on the edge of a cliff, the background is the ocean, the hair and clothing of the silhouette are waving wildly in the wind. The image emits a sense of urgency and eagerness.

231-041.text: Cut the hawsers--haul out--shake out every sail!Have we not stood here like trees in the ground long enough?Have we not grovel’d here long enough, eating and drinking like mere brutes?Have we not darken’d and dazed ourselves with books long enough?
caption: A group of sailors with their ship docked at a pier, preparing to set sail. The sailors are working together to hoist the sails and release the ropes connecting them to the dock. The atmosphere is one of excitement and energy, as if the sailors are eager to leave the stagnant life behind, symbolized by the trees and books in the background.

The image is done in black and white, and it shows a group of people standing in front of a forest. One person has his arms raised and seems to be calling out to the others, urging them to move forward. The trees in the background appear almost ominous and oppressive, as if they are keeping the people trapped in place.

231-042.text: Sail forth--steer for the deep waters only,Reckless O soul, exploring, I with thee, and thou with me,For we are bound where mariner has not yet dared to go,And we will risk the ship, ourselves and all.
caption: A sailboat on the open sea with an adventurer at the helm, gazing out into the horizon. They're accompanied by a beaming soul, symbolizing courage and exploration. Together they're ready to sail far into the unknown waters, both fully aware of the risk that lies ahead.

In the style of abstract expressionism, a painting with bold strokes and bright colors of a sailboat in rough seas. The boat is surrounded by dark and unknown waters, but the passengers are determined and unafraid to explore the depths.

231-043.text: O my brave soul!O farther farther sail!O daring joy, but safe! are they not all the seas of God?O farther, farther, farther sail!
caption: An image of a sailor on a ship, gazing out towards the horizon with a determined look on their face. The waves are choppy, but the sailor has a sense of joy and adventure as they push forward into the vast ocean that seems to stretch out endlessly. The ship sails towards the distant horizon, seeking out new adventures and experiences, as the sailor's brave soul guides them further and further into the unknown.

The picture is done in an abstract, surrealist style with a ship on rough seas, and the soul is the sail. Its colors dramatically highlight the contrasting elements of the struggle and the daring joy of sailing farther into the unknown.

232-001.text: A batter’d, wreck’d old man,Thrown on this savage shore, far, far from home,Pent by the sea and dark rebellious brows, twelve dreary months,Sore, stiff with many toils, sicken’d and nigh to death,I take my way along the island’s edge,Venting a heavy heart.
caption: An elderly man has washed up on a deserted and rocky beach. He appears to have suffered much, and was stranded for a year. His journey along the shoreline is slow due to illnesses and tiredness from his previous struggles. His emotions are heavy as he reflects on his experience.

Realistic painting of an old, rugged man lying on a beach next to a wrecked boat. He's surrounded by high and tumultuous waves, after struggling to survive 12 months in isolation on this deserted island, and his face expresses weariness, sadness, and pain.

232-002.text: I am too full of woe!Haply I may not live another day;I cannot rest O God, I cannot eat or drink or sleep,Till I put forth myself, my prayer, once more to Thee,Breathe, bathe myself once more in Thee, commune with Thee,Report myself once more to Thee.
caption: A haggard and desperate figure, with deep creases on their forehead and bloodshot eyes, is slumped over. They seem engulfed in sorrow, the weight of their grief almost unbearable. They look skyward with a faint trace of hope, as if praying for an end to their misery.

The visual style would be impressionism. The picture shows a melancholic individual, sitting at the side of a river or a lake, their back facing the viewer, with trees and nature surrounding them. The person looks pensive and lost in thoughts, while the sun sets, casting an orange and violet hue over everything.

232-003.text: Thou knowest my years entire, my life,My long and crowded life of active work, not adoration merely;Thou knowest the prayers and vigils of my youth,Thou knowest my manhood’s solemn and visionary meditations,Thou knowest how before I commenced I devoted all to come to Thee,Thou knowest I have in age ratified all those vows and strictly kept them,Thou knowest I have not once lost nor faith nor ecstasy in Thee,In shackles, prison’d, in disgrace, repining not,Accepting all from Thee, as duly come from Thee.
caption: A picture of an elderly man with a serene expression, gazing upwards as if in prayer. The image is surrounded by smaller images that depict different stages of his life - a young man deep in meditation, a man in his prime hard at work, and a prisoner kneeling in a cell. In each phase, the man is devoted to a higher calling, unwavering in his faith and thankful for all that has come to him.

The photo has a dark background with an older person holding their hands in front of them in prayer. The person is framed by light peeking in from a stained-glass window, conveying a sense of hope and faith.

232-004.text: All my emprises have been fill’d with Thee,My speculations, plans, begun and carried on in thoughts of Thee,Sailing the deep or journeying the land for Thee;Intentions, purports, aspirations mine, leaving results to Thee.
caption: A series of drawings depicting a person's different pursuits - sailing on a ship, trekking through a desert, and brainstorming in thought. In each drawing, the individual is completely engrossed in their pursuit and there is a small glowing image of another person in the distance who represents the person's love and devotion.

This picture could be a collage, split into two halves. The left side would be a ship sailing across a tumultuous sea, while the right side shows a traveler walking along a lonely road. The background is filled with hues of blue that represent the sea and a warm golden color that represents the land.

232-005.text: O I am sure they really came from Thee,The urge, the ardor, the unconquerable will,The potent, felt, interior command, stronger than words,A message from the Heavens whispering to me even in sleep,These sped me on.
caption: A person standing confidently in front of a bright light, with their hand on their chest while looking upwards. The light streams radiantly behind them, as if it were a message from the Heavens guiding them.

Surrealistic. The image consists of a figure (the poet, Walt Whitman) floating in outer space. Surrounding him are streaks of light representing the urge, ardor, and will. In the distance, a galaxy is visible with a bright light shining through it, symbolizing the message from the heavens.

232-006.text: By me and these the work so far accomplish’d,By me earth’s elder cloy’d and stifled lands uncloy’d, unloos’d,By me the hemispheres rounded and tied, the unknown to the known.
caption: A picture of an expansive globe with its hemispheres rounding and tying. The globe appears to be rejuvenated, with previously cloyed and stifled lands now uncloyed and loosened. The viewer sees a figure close to the globe, with arms outstretched, appearing to take credit for the achievement.

The image shows a pair of hands lifting the earth's crust, releasing the trapped and suffocated land masses below. The hands then proceed to pull the two world hemispheres closer together, connecting the known and mysterious territories. This scene is presented in a surrealistic style with exaggerated colors and proportions.

232-007.text: The end I know not, it is all in Thee,Or small or great I know not--haply what broad fields, what lands,Haply the brutish measureless human undergrowth I know,Transplanted there may rise to stature, knowledge worthy Thee,Haply the swords I know may there indeed be turn’d to reaping-tools,Haply the lifeless cross I know, Europe’s dead cross, may bud andblossom there.
caption: A vast scenic view of fields and lands, possibly with some undergrowth. There is a vision of transformation as brutish and ignorant ways may evolve and change into something worthwhile. Swords are seen as powerless tools transformed into a symbol for harvesting crops. A dead cross seems to come alive with buds and blossoms symbolizing a hopeful renewal.
Surrealist. A barren landscape contrasts with a field where the ordinary crosses are transformed into a flowering tree, set against a darkly lit horizon.

232-008.text: One effort more, my altar this bleak sand;That Thou O God my life hast lighted,With ray of light, steady, ineffable, vouchsafed of Thee,Light rare untellable, lighting the very light,Beyond all signs, descriptions, languages;For that O God, be it my latest word, here on my knees,Old, poor, and paralyzed, I thank Thee.
caption: A person kneeling on a barren beach, facing an ocean with a sun setting in the distance. Their face illuminated by a bright and rare light, emanating from a higher power. The person offers their thanks and gratitude to this power, with a sense of humbleness and frailty.

Photorealistic. A person on their knees on a bleak, sandy shore, holding their hands up towards the sky as if in prayer, with a bright and steady light shining down on them from above. The light illuminates the person's face with an indescribable radiance.

232-009.text: My terminus near,The clouds already closing in upon me,The voyage balk’d, the course disputed, lost,I yield my ships to Thee.
caption: A ship floating in a vast ocean with dark storm clouds approaching. The captain resignedly hands over the helm to a silhouette bearing a bright aura.

In a photograph taken in black and white high contrast style, a ship in the middle of the sea with storm clouds rapidly approaching. The ship is facing the oncoming storm with the sea becoming increasingly rough.

232-010.text: My hands, my limbs grow nerveless,My brain feels rack’d, bewilder’d,Let the old timbers part, I will not part,I will cling fast to Thee, O God, though the waves buffet me,Thee, Thee at least I know.
caption: A person is standing on a boat in the middle of a stormy sea. Their body is weak, but they are holding onto a wooden beam of the boat, refusing to let go. In the distance, there is a faint image of a bright figure, symbolizing their belief in God despite the difficulties they are facing.

A black and white photograph of a person standing amidst rough sea. The person has both hands stretched out as if they are hanging onto something while waves are hitting against their body. The image is filled with a sense of determination and hope in the midst of chaos.

232-011.text: Is it the prophet’s thought I speak, or am I raving?What do I know of life? what of myself?I know not even my own work past or present,Dim ever-shifting guesses of it spread before me,Of newer better worlds, their mighty parturition,Mocking, perplexing me.
caption: Surrealism. An abstract depiction of a person, half-man and half-prophet, lost in thoughts. They are surrounded by a cloud of fluid shapes that symbolize past and present confusion. The shapes are continuously changing, making it difficult for the person to figure out their own work, past or present. In the distance, there are glimpses of fantasy worlds emerging and confusing the person even more.

A surrealism painting, depicting a face divided into two halves: one side with a serene expression and the other, a distressed one. In the background, an abstract and ever-changing landscape, with vibrant and obscure features, evoking a sense of confusion and perplexity.

232-012.text: And these things I see suddenly, what mean they?As if some miracle, some hand divine unseal’d my eyes,Shadowy vast shapes smile through the air and sky,And on the distant waves sail countless ships,And anthems in new tongues I hear saluting me.
caption: The visual style is surrealism. A person is standing in the middle of a dark landscape. Suddenly, their eyes are opened, and what they see is extraordinary. Shadowy but monolithic, smiling creatures are flying or floating around in the air and sky, appearing almost like holograms. In the distance, there are an unbelievable number of ships of all kinds, large and small, that sail in every direction on the water. Surrounding the person, they can hear beautiful and unfamiliar singing from different tongues praising them.

A surrealistic painting. The viewer's eyes have been opened to a world of vast, shadowy, amorphous shapes that smile through the air and sky, docked ships on distant waves, and sounds of multilingual music.

233-001.text: 1I wander all night in my vision,Stepping with light feet, swiftly and noiselessly stepping and stopping,Bending with open eyes over the shut eyes of sleepers,Wandering and confused, lost to myself, ill-assorted, contradictory,Pausing, gazing, bending, and stopping.
caption: Surrealistic. The picture features a character, with a blurry and overlayed effect, wandering through a dark, misty world with an aura of uncertainty. The character occasionally stops to peer over sleeping people with wide open eyes.

A surrealist artwork where a character with light feet wanders through an assemblage of shut-eyed figures in a multi-part scene; pausing, bending and staring at each individual before continuing their winding path.

233-002.text: How solemn they look there, stretch’d and still,How quiet they breathe, the little children in their cradles.
caption: The visual style is impressionism. The picture shows a peaceful nursery with a soft lighting. The focus is on several sleeping babies lying in their cradles. The painter has captured the serenity and stillness of the moment.

In a Renaissance oil painting style, a dimly lit nursery room with sleeping babies in their cribs. The babies appear peaceful yet solemn in their slumber, their gentle breaths barely visible in the soft candlelight.

233-003.text: The wretched features of ennuyes, the white features of corpses, thelivid faces of drunkards, the sick-gray faces of onanists,The gash’d bodies on battle-fields, the insane in theirstrong-door’d rooms, the sacred idiots, the new-born emergingfrom gates, and the dying emerging from gates,The night pervades them and infolds them.
caption: In a dark, Gothic style, an eerie image depicts individuals with haunting expressions. The figures include a person with the look of utter boredom, a corpse-like individual with pale white skin, a drunkard with a livid face, a sickly grey figure representing an onanist, and several more featuring grotesque representations of the vulnerable and sick. The night envelops them in its embrace, capturing the essence of their true nature.

A black and white photograph with an eerie and somber atmosphere. Multiple faces of individuals with expressions of boredom, deathly paleness, drunkenness, sickness, insanity, and disability are displayed. A somber darkness seems to flow through and surround the subjects.

233-004.text: The married couple sleep calmly in their bed, he with his palm onthe hip of the wife, and she with her palm on the hip of the husband,The sisters sleep lovingly side by side in their bed,The men sleep lovingly side by side in theirs,And the mother sleeps with her little child carefully wrapt.
caption: Realistic painting style. In the foreground, a couple sleeps soundly in their bed, with the man's hand resting on his wife's hip, and vice versa. In the background, two sisters sleep closely beside each other in another bed. Meanwhile, two men also sleep close together in their bed. Finally, in the far right corner, a mother is shown sleeping with her child carefully wrapped in her arms.

The image represents a serene and peaceful domestic scene. There's a double bed with a sleeping married couple, comfortable and lovingly touching their hips. In another room, two sisters and two men have also drifted off to sleep in supportive positions. Lastly, there's a mother with her little child wrapped up carefully, sleeping together. The style is realism.

233-005.text: The blind sleep, and the deaf and dumb sleep,The prisoner sleeps well in the prison, the runaway son sleeps,The murderer that is to be hung next day, how does he sleep?And the murder’d person, how does he sleep?
caption: In the style of a surreal painting. The picture depicts various people sleeping in their own unique way. The blind, deaf, and dumb sleep peacefully, while a prisoner and a runaway son also rest. Meanwhile, a murderer due to be hanged soon lies awake, while the ghost of the person they killed rests in eternal sleep.

In monochromatic ultrarealism style, a series of contrasting images featuring people sleeping is depicted. The blind, deaf, and dumb sleep, a prisoner rests in confinement and the son who ran away slumbers anywhere. The murderer that awaits punishment is shown asleep along with the victim of the crime.

233-006.text: The female that loves unrequited sleeps,And the male that loves unrequited sleeps,The head of the money-maker that plotted all day sleeps,And the enraged and treacherous dispositions, all, all sleep.
caption: The scene is set in the dead of night. The sky is dark with scattered stars as if saying sweet dreams. In a dimly lit alleyway, four silhouettes are lying down on the ground in deep sleep. One is a female and another a male, both are lost and broken-hearted. One is a person of wealth and power, lying down with their head on a burlap bag full of money, and the last silhouette represents the treacherous and angry beings. All of them are lost in a deep sleep, not knowing what the new day has in store for them. The visual style is haunted with a tinge of melancholy.

A surrealist photograph of a peaceful scene, with a sleeping female and male lying next to each other in a bed, and a man lying on a pile of money with a sinister expression on his face. All around them, people with angry and devious expressions are also asleep in a deep slumber.

233-007.text: I stand in the dark with drooping eyes by the worst-suffering andthe most restless,I pass my hands soothingly to and fro a few inches from them,The restless sink in their beds, they fitfully sleep.
caption: In a somber monochromatic style, a figure is seen standing in a dimly lit room. The figure is holding their hands outstretched and swaying side to side, seeming to soothe someone who is off-camera. In the background, people are seen lying in their beds, restless and unwell. The mood is calm and comforting, with a sense of desperation and sadness.

This photograph evokes a dark atmosphere with a faint light source casting shadows around a hospital bed. The viewer sees a person with drooping eyes, and a caretaker standing beside, passing their hands over the restless patient. The patient's hand pokes out from under the blanket, and the scene suggests the patient may be finding some peace in their fitful sleep. The photography style may be stunningly shadowed or minimalistic.

233-008.text: Now I pierce the darkness, new beings appear,The earth recedes from me into the night,I saw that it was beautiful, and I see that what is not the earth isbeautiful.
caption: The image is presented in abstract art style, with deep, dark colors dominating the background. In the center, new beings appear, with bright and vivid colors taking center stage. The earth that once surrounded them begins to recede into the night. Despite the darkness, the viewer can see that the earth is beautiful. Similarly, the beauty of the non-earthly entities now shines through, and their significance is brought into focus.

In a surrealistic style, a figure is standing in the foreground with arms outstretched, piercing through a pitch-black backdrop. Vibrant new beings are emerging, while the planet becomes distant and fades into the darkness. Different beautiful entities are visible, which embody the unknown beyond the Earth.

233-009.text: I go from bedside to bedside, I sleep close with the other sleeperseach in turn,I dream in my dream all the dreams of the other dreamers,And I become the other dreamers.
caption: Surrealism. The picture shows a person sitting on a floating bed, travelling from one bed to another, with sleeping figures lying on them in various poses. The person's dream bubble shows them experiencing the dreams of the individuals lying around them, becoming them indistinguishably.
Surrealistic photography. A person in pajamas appears in different beds next to different people. The dreams of the people blend into each other, showing the interconnectedness of human experience.

233-010.text: I am a dance--play up there! the fit is whirling me fast!
caption: Surrealistic. The image is of a person made up of various colors and shapes, loosely resembling a dancer. They are lifted into the air, captured in a fit of motion as they are twirled at a dizzying pace.
In the style of impressionism, a figure dances in a whirling motion with a blur of colorful strokes around them, depicting their rapid movement.

233-011.text: I am the ever-laughing--it is new moon and twilight,I see the hiding of douceurs, I see nimble ghosts whichever way look,Cache and cache again deep in the ground and sea, and where it isneither ground nor sea.
caption: Surrealistic. In the foreground, a figure resembling a jester with a large, exaggerated mouth is laughing heartily. The silhouette of a crescent moon hangs low in the deep purple sky. In the background, faint figures of ghosts can be seen hiding in the land and sea. The viewer is left in wonderment as to what lies beyond.
Surrealist. A laughing figure standing near a darkened landscape. There are ghosts hiding in the shadows, some disappearing into water, others into the ground.

233-012.text: Well do they do their jobs those journeymen divine,Only from me can they hide nothing, and would not if they could,I reckon I am their boss and they make me a pet besides,And surround me and lead me and run ahead when I walk,To lift their cunning covers to signify me with stretch’d arms, andresume the way;Onward we move, a gay gang of blackguards! with mirth-shoutingmusic and wild-flapping pennants of joy!
caption: Surrealism. The picture is of a group of mischievous, horned mythical creatures surrounding a small figure in the middle who appears to be their leader. They lift their arms and dance around, creating a joyous atmosphere with loud music and wild flapping flags. The group moves forward, excitedly beckoning the leader to follow them on their journey.

The visual style could be a whimsical, high-spirited painting that captures the lively scene of a group of workers, who are enjoying their work and their boss's company. They are holding their hats aloft and singing, as they lead their boss and blow a colorful array of musical instruments with joyous fervor, and waving brightly colored flags.

233-013.text: I am the actor, the actress, the voter, the politician,The emigrant and the exile, the criminal that stood in the box,He who has been famous and he who shall be famous after to-day,The stammerer, the well-form’d person, the wasted or feeble person.
caption: A portrait-style picture showcasing people from all walks of life standing in a lineup, in the style of a police lineup. The faces are diverse and represent different ages, genders, and backgrounds. The picture is in a realistic style with muted colors to emphasize the seriousness of the subjects. The people portrayed are actors, politicians, emigrants, exiles, criminals, famous people, stammerers, and people with different physical abilities.

Pop art. A grid of faces in bold colors and stark outlines, each face expressing a different persona including an actor, actress, voter, politician, emigrant, exile, criminal, famous person, stammerer, well-formed person, or wasted person.

233-014.text: I am she who adorn’d herself and folded her hair expectantly,My truant lover has come, and it is dark.
caption: The visual style could be Impressionistic, showing a woman standing outdoors with golden, wavy hair that falls over her shoulders. She has a gentle smile on her face and looks toward the horizon. The sky is painted using blended, dark colors, indicating that it is nighttime. In the background, a dark silhouette of a person is walking towards the woman.

The picture has a woman standing by the window in anticipation, with her hair braided and adorned with accessories. The room is dim, and her lover has come back unexpectedly. The lighting is dark and romantic.

233-015.text: Double yourself and receive me darkness,Receive me and my lover too, he will not let me go without him.
caption: The visual style is abstract art. Two shadowy figures facing each other, with one figure extending their arms towards the other. The figures seem to be merging into each other. In the background, the hues of darkness embrace them.

Surrealist. A painting of a person splitting into two, allowing another person to enter their shadows. The new figure appears to be the old figure's lover, who refuses to let them go alone into the darkness.

233-016.text: I roll myself upon you as upon a bed, I resign myself to the dusk.
caption: Surrealist. The picture shows a figure, curled up as if they were lying on a bed – but the bed isn't there. The background is a landscape, difficult to define - perhaps a forest, casting long shadows as the sun sets. The figure appears content in the fading light, as they give themselves over to evening.
Surrealist. A dark silhouette of a human figure curled up on a bed, surrounded by a vast and twisted landscape all covered in darkness.

233-017.text: He whom I call answers me and takes the place of my lover,He rises with me silently from the bed.
caption:
Visual style: Surrealism. 
A person lying in bed next to an empty space, but a visible aura of energy is rising from the space with a figure taking form within it. The figure's posture is protective, hugging the person lying in bed.

Surrealist style. A figure who is a hybrid of a lover and a person's own body rises from the bed alongside the person. A looming figure (perhaps their consciousness or subconsciousness) watches from a distance.

233-018.text: Darkness, you are gentler than my lover, his flesh was sweaty and panting,I feel the hot moisture yet that he left me.
caption: Surrealism. A figure with a veil obscuring their face stands in a dark, desolate landscape. Behind them, a shadowy figure with a twisted, grotesque anatomy, represents the lover described in the stanza. In front of the figure, are sweat and moisture, appearing as luminescent orbs.

Surreal. A figure lying in a bed with a shadowy, abstract entity draped over them. The entity's embrace is tender, in contrast to the figure's lover who lies on the floor, discarded and covered in sweat.

233-019.text: My hands are spread forth, I pass them in all directions,I would sound up the shadowy shore to which you are journeying.
caption: An impressionistic painting of a person with their arms stretched wide, standing on a rocky shore with choppy waters behind them. The sunset casts the shadowy shore they are journeying to. The person appears to be trying to speak to someone on the other side, as they reach their hands out into the air.
Surrealist. A pair of hands emerge from a dark, dreamlike landscape and reach out in all directions, beckoning a figure in the distance who travels towards an unknown, shadowy shore.

233-020.text: Be careful darkness! already what was it touch’d me?I thought my lover had gone, else darkness and he are one,I hear the heart-beat, I follow, I fade away.
caption: Canvas with an abstract style. A figure stands alone in the center of the canvas, surrounded by dark, ethereal shapes. The figure is reaching out as if searching for something. In the distance, a faint light glows. Blue and purple tones dominate.

Surrealism. The shadow of a hand reaching out towards a figure in the darkness, who is listening intently for a beating heart. The boundary between darkness and the figure is blurred, suggesting unity.

233-021.text: 2I descend my western course, my sinews are flaccid,Perfume and youth course through me and I am their wake.
caption: In a fluid, abstract style, a bright and vibrant figure is shown descending against a warm western horizon. The sinews of their form seem to be loosely draped, as if in a state of complete abandon. Their features are expressive, the youthful figure exuding vitality and movement. The contours of their figure are blurred, hinting at the constant state of change and motion they embody. A trail of color and scent follows in their wake, evoking the richness of life and the fleeting nature of youth.
Surrealistic photography. A figure descending downward with their limbs appearing softened and stretched. A young person, leaves, and flowers are seen in the background.

233-022.text: It is my face yellow and wrinkled instead of the old woman’s,I sit low in a straw-bottom chair and carefully darn my grandson’sstockings.
caption: The visual style is realism. A grandparent is sitting in a wooden straw-bottomed chair, wearing a yellow wrinkled face instead of the old woman's, carefully darning their grandson's stockings. The scene feels intimate and peaceful as if the viewer stumbled into this private moment.

Photorealistic. A close-up of an elderly woman's hands, holding a mismatched sock and carefully repairing it with a darning needle. The background shows a straw-bottom chair and the wrinkled face in slight profile, possibly looking downward in concentration.

233-023.text: It is I too, the sleepless widow looking out on the winter midnight,I see the sparkles of starshine on the icy and pallid earth.
caption: The style could be impressionistic. The picture portrays a lonely widow looking outside the window at the dead of the winter midnight. The earth is covered in ice and snow, and the stars in the sky are sparkling, adding a hint of mystery to the scene.

The painting, executed in hyper-realism, portrays the image of a blurry-eyed widow gazing with longing out of the window of her home on a winter's night. The frigid terrain outside is illuminated by a myriad of flickering stars, casting a glittering, ethereal light on the pale, icy earth.

233-024.text: A shroud I see and I am the shroud, I wrap a body and lie in the coffin,It is dark here under ground, it is not evil or pain here, it isblank here, for reasons.
caption: The visual style is surrealism, with muted colors and a dreamlike quality. The picture shows a person, wrapped in a shroud, lying in a coffin in a dark, underground space. Despite the darkness, there is a sense of calm, and the person's face is peaceful. The background is hazy, as if shrouded in mist, and the overall mood is one of quiet acceptance.

In a monochromatic dystopian style, a black and white image depicts a buried shroud that wraps around a body inside a coffin. The darkness represents the emptiness of the afterlife, where the soul is neither tormented nor in pain, only blank due to unknown reasons.

233-025.text: (It seems to me that every thing in the light and air ought to be happy,Whoever is not in his coffin and the dark grave let him know he has enough.)
caption: Surrealistic. A bright and airy space with flowers, sunshine and butterflies, but with a coffin and a gravestone subtly hidden in the corner, creating an eerie effect. The overall tone of the picture is a juxtaposition of happiness and somberness, depicting the duality of life and death.
Surrealistic. A figure floating serenely on a cloud in a bright blue sky, while below them lie many open coffins. The figure's expression exudes contentment, while the coffins below remain empty.

233-026.text: 3I see a beautiful gigantic swimmer swimming naked through the eddiesof the sea,His brown hair lies close and even to his head, he strikes out withcourageous arms, he urges himself with his legs,I see his white body, I see his undaunted eyes,I hate the swift-running eddies that would dash him head-foremost onthe rocks.
caption: The photo is captured in a high-speed action shot, showing a tall, muscular and handsome swimmer who is naked. The sea appears mighty, with strong waves forming eddies around him. His hair, dark brown and wet, lies flat to his head as he strikes out with strongly muscled arms and legs that push him farther away from the eddies of the rocky coast. His body, tanned and toned, is white against the deep blue of the sea. Fearless determination shines in his eyes as he battles the churning waters, the surrounding cliffs adding to the dynamic energy of the scene.

Realistic acrylic painting. A confident and muscular swimmer navigating through tumultuous waves. His striking brown hair tapers off towards his face, as he shields his undaunted eyes from the glare of the sun.

233-027.text: What are you doing you ruffianly red-trickled waves?Will you kill the courageous giant? will you kill him in the primeof his middle age?
caption: The visual style of the image could be surrealistic. It depicts the raging ocean waves with a crimson hue. In the center of the image stands a towering giant in his prime. However, it appears that the waves are attacking him, and there is a sense of uncertainty whether the giant will survive this onslaught.
Neo-expressionist. A raging sea, with rough brushstrokes showing reds and oranges implying danger. A giant silhouette standing strong against the waves.

233-028.text: Steady and long he struggles,He is baffled, bang’d, bruis’d, he holds out while his strengthholds out,The slapping eddies are spotted with his blood, they bear him away,they roll him, swing him, turn him,His beautiful body is borne in the circling eddies, it iscontinually bruis’d on rocks,Swiftly and ought of sight is borne the brave corpse.
caption: The art style is expressionistic. A lone figure is fighting against a violent river. The struggle is long and arduous as the figure is bloodied and bruised. The rapids beat against his body and drag him further away, circling him around rocks. Despite the odds and weariness, the figure continues to hold on tightly. Finally, the body succumbs and is taken away by the water, lost to sight.

Abstract expressionism. A lone figure is moving towards a turbulent sea, fighting against the waves with all their might. The water is red with blood, a sign that the fight has not been easy. Eventually, the figure succumbs to the strength of the sea, and they are carried away, their body battered and bruised by the rocks.

233-029.text: 4I turn but do not extricate myself,Confused, a past-reading, another, but with darkness yet.
caption: In a surrealist style, the picture depicts a person trapped in a maze of floating books. The person appears confused and unable to escape, with darkness surrounding them. The books seem to be opened and are emitting a past memory, creating a sense of disorientation in the person.
Surrealism. A person's arm tangled up in cables or vines, unable to escape. The background is a hazy blend of past images, and all is shrouded in an ominous darkness.

233-030.text: The beach is cut by the razory ice-wind, the wreck-guns sound,The tempest lulls, the moon comes floundering through the drifts.
caption: In an impressionistic style, a coastal beach is depicted with rough and sharp brushstrokes. The beach is illuminated by the bright moon, while the icy wind cuts through it. The sound of wrecked guns can be faintly heard in the background as the storm begins to calm.
Surrealist. A desolate beach with an icy wind blowing through, causing the waves to crash against the shore. The moon illuminates the landscape, casting eerie, fragmented shadows all around.

233-031.text: I look where the ship helplessly heads end on, I hear the burst asshe strikes, I hear the howls of dismay, they grow fainter and fainter.
caption: The visual style would be impressionistic. An image of a large ship with a dark sky and intense waves. You can see the vessel helplessly heading toward its end in the center of the frame. There is a flash of light and a loud crash as the ship meets its doom. The howling of dismay is suggested in the swirling colors and blurred lines, gradually fading into the background.

Surrealist. The image shows a roaring sea with a massive ship heading straight for a towering rock formation, the ship's impact causes shockwaves to ripple across the water while onlookers in the distance cover their ears in fear as the sounds of impact, confusion and cries for help grow fainter and fainter.

233-032.text: I cannot aid with my wringing fingers,I can but rush to the surf and let it drench me and freeze upon me.
caption: The visual style is impressionistic. The picture shows a person standing on a rocky shore with the waves crashing against the rocks, and their arms are outstretched to the sky. The wind is blowing with such force that the person's clothes are fluttering around them. Their face is contorted in agony, portraying the feeling of helplessness and despair.
High contrast black and white photograph. The subject is a person standing at the edge of the ocean with their arms outstretched, being drenched by the cold water as waves crash around them.

233-033.text: I search with the crowd, not one of the company is wash’d to us alive,In the morning I help pick up the dead and lay them in rows in a barn.
caption: Realistic illustration. From a top-down perspective, a bustling crowd is searching through shambles, all covered in dust and ash, with dead bodies scattered on the ground. A lone figure is seen helping to pick up the corpses, laying them in neat rows, inside a nearby barn. The picture depicts the devastating aftermath of a tragedy.
Documentary. A sea of people wandering around aimlessly, some dead bodies being carried out of a building in the morning, and a crowd forming to help carry them away.

233-034.text: 5Now of the older war-days, the defeat at Brooklyn,Washington stands inside the lines, he stands on the intrench’dhills amid a crowd of officers.His face is cold and damp, he cannot repress the weeping drops,He lifts the glass perpetually to his eyes, the color is blanch’dfrom his cheeks,He sees the slaughter of the southern braves confided to him bytheir parents.
caption: The visual style would be impressionism. The painting depicts a cold and damp landscape that feels dreary and sorrowful. In the center stands an older George Washington, surrounded by his officers, on the intrenched hills of Brooklyn during the defeat of the war-days. His face is contorted with pain and sadness, and the tears flow down his cheeks. He raises a glass to his eyes to wipe away the tears, and his face is blanched from the horror of the slaughter of southern soldiers whose parents had entrusted them to him.

The picture depicts Washington standing on a hill with a group of officers, with a cold and damp expression on his face as he tries to hold back his tears. He constantly lifts the glass to his eyes, while his cheeks are blanched. The picture depicts the older war days and the sorrow of viewing the slaughter of the southern braves, confided by their parents. The visual style could be oil painting, with a somber and muted color palette to convey the sadness and grief.

233-035.text: The same at last and at last when peace is declared,He stands in the room of the old tavern, the well-belov’d soldiersall pass through,The officers speechless and slow draw near in their turns,The chief encircles their necks with his arm and kisses them on the cheek,He kisses lightly the wet cheeks one after another, he shakes handsand bids good-by to the army.
caption: In a painting with a realism style, a soldier stands in the middle of a room after war has ended. He is surrounded by other soldiers, and they all pass through the room. The officers come in one by one, slowly and silently. The chief officer encircles their necks with his arm to show his affection, and kisses them lightly on the cheek. He shakes their hands and bids farewell as they leave the room. The scene is solemn and emotional, capturing the end of a long and difficult journey.

Realistic portrait. Soldiers in uniform gather in an old tavern as they bid each other goodbye. The commanding officer stands at the center embracing his servicemen one by one with a kiss on the cheek as the officers watch in silence.

233-036.text: 6Now what my mother told me one day as we sat at dinner together,Of when she was a nearly grown girl living home with her parents onthe old homestead.
caption: The visual style is impressionistic. A dining table with plates of food and two figures sitting across from each other. A young woman, with a pensive expression, is listening intently to an older woman's animated storytelling. The harsh sunlight from the window to the right creates a wash of bright colors and values overlapping the scene.
Pictorialist. A young girl with her mother and father at the dinner table in a rustic setting, surrounded by trees and farmhouses. The mother is telling a story, and the girl is listening intently.

233-037.text: A red squaw came one breakfast-time to the old homestead,On her back she carried a bundle of rushes for rush-bottoming chairs,Her hair, straight, shiny, coarse, black, profuse, half-envelop’dher face,Her step was free and elastic, and her voice sounded exquisitely asshe spoke.
caption: The visual style could be a realistic oil painting. An indigenous woman with straight black hair, carrying a bundle of rushes on her back. She wears a traditional red dress and moccasins. Her face is partially obscured by her hair. She walks with a confident, bouncy step and opens her mouth to speak, emitting a beautiful sound.

Photorealistic with warm, saturated colors. A Native American woman with black hair wears a red dress, her back hunched under a bundle of rushes. Her free and elastic stride suggests a life of hard work, but her exquisite voice lifts everyone's spirits.

233-038.text: My mother look’d in delight and amazement at the stranger,She look’d at the freshness of her tall-borne face and full andpliant limbs,The more she look’d upon her she loved her,Never before had she seen such wonderful beauty and purity,She made her sit on a bench by the jamb of the fireplace, she cook’dfood for her,She had no work to give her, but she gave her remembrance and fondness.
caption: The visual style for this image is impressionistic. The image is of a mother who is gazing upon a stranger in amazement. The stranger has a tall and fresh appearance with flexible limbs. The mother looks at the stranger with admiration, as she has never seen such purity and beauty before. The stranger is seated on a bench by the fireplace with the mother cooking food for her. Even though the mother has no work to give to her, she offers her loving remembrance and fondness.

The image is a photograph in black and white, of a mother gazing in amazement and adoration at a beautiful stranger with tall, fluid body posture. The stranger sits on a wooden bench, while the mother prepares food for her. The emotions of love and warmth are palpable.

233-039.text: The red squaw staid all the forenoon, and toward the middle of theafternoon she went away,O my mother was loth to have her go away,All the week she thought of her, she watch’d for her many a month,She remember’d her many a winter and many a summer,But the red squaw never came nor was heard of there again.
caption: Realistic and melancholic. A grey-haired woman, dressed in plain clothing, sitting outside a log cabin in a forest. In front of her, a Native American woman with long, black hair and vibrant clothing sits on a stool, looking at the older woman intensely. The older woman is clutching onto the Native American's hand, not wanting her to go. However, the Native American woman eventually gets up and walks away, leaving the older woman to sit alone on the stool, staring into the distance.

This photograph features a desolate winter forest with a solitary cabin in the background. A Native American woman dressed in red stands in the foreground. Her silhouette blends into the surroundings as time and seasons pass by.

233-040.text: 7A show of the summer softness--a contact of something unseen--anamour of the light and air,I am jealous and overwhelm’d with friendliness,And will go gallivant with the light and air myself.
caption: Fauvism style. A bright, colorful painting with a figure surrounded by a soft, summery glow. The figure is holding out their hand to something unseen, conveying a sense of beckoning towards something ethereal. The figure appears both overwhelmed and jealous, but is also exhibiting an exuberant sense of lightness and joy. The scene feels playful and carefree, as if the figure is ready to dance and twirl through the bright colors and soft textures of the painting.
In the style of Impressionism, a sun-filled garden with flowers and trees in soft focus. In the foreground there is a shimmering light, creating a feeling of warmth and friendliness.

233-041.text: O love and summer, you are in the dreams and in me,Autumn and winter are in the dreams, the farmer goes with his thrift,The droves and crops increase, the barns are well-fill’d.
