caption: The visual style is impressionistic. The picture shows a sunny day in a vast farm where a farmer can be seen in the distance with crops and livestock. The color palette is radiant, with warm tones dominating the scene, evoking the feeling of Summertime. The foreground is in focus, where we can see a young couple holding hands, surrounded by blooming flowers and trees, the symbol of love. The background is fading out in a blurred style, showing hints of the upcoming Autumn and Winter, as the leaves of the trees far away start to change their colors. The barns in the distance are well-fill'd, indicating that the harvest has been successful.

Surrealist. The picture is divided into two parts, with love and summer depicted on one side and autumn and winter on the other. In the middle of the picture, a farmer is standing on a ladder, stacking hay in a barn that appears to be endless.

233-042.text: Elements merge in the night, ships make tacks in the dreams,The sailor sails, the exile returns home,The fugitive returns unharm’d, the immigrant is back beyond monthsand years,The poor Irishman lives in the simple house of his childhood withthe well known neighbors and faces,They warmly welcome him, he is barefoot again, he forgets he is well off,The Dutchman voyages home, and the Scotchman and Welshman voyagehome, and the native of the Mediterranean voyages home,To every port of England, France, Spain, enter well-fill’d ships,The Swiss foots it toward his hills, the Prussian goes his way, theHungarian his way, and the Pole his way,The Swede returns, and the Dane and Norwegian return.
caption: The visual style is surrealism. There is a night sky with a full moon and stars shining down. Various ships are sailing on this sky sea, but instead of water, there are clouds. The clouds are connecting different locations in the world. People from different nationalities from around the world are making their way home to different parts of their homelands. Some are walking, some are on ships, and some are even flying. The surrealistic image creates a dreamlike atmosphere, where anything is possible.

The picture is a surreal scene of different people from different lands coming home. Ships sail in the dream-like sea as immigrants return to their home country. Different nationalities make their voyage home, the Swiss go to their hills, the Pole goes in their way, the Irishman is back with his childhood neighbors and friends, and everyone is joyously welcomed back with open arms to their respective homes.

233-043.text: The homeward bound and the outward bound,The beautiful lost swimmer, the ennuye, the onanist, the female thatloves unrequited, the money-maker,The actor and actress, those through with their parts and thosewaiting to commence,The affectionate boy, the husband and wife, the voter, the nomineethat is chosen and the nominee that has fail’d,The great already known and the great any time after to-day,The stammerer, the sick, the perfect-form’d, the homely,The criminal that stood in the box, the judge that sat and sentencedhim, the fluent lawyers, the jury, the audience,The laugher and weeper, the dancer, the midnight widow, the red squaw,The consumptive, the erysipalite, the idiot, he that is wrong’d,The antipodes, and every one between this and them in the dark,I swear they are averaged now--one is no better than the other,The night and sleep have liken’d them and restored them.
caption: The picture style is a mosaic composed of various faces with different emotions and features, each one representing a different person. The faces include a swimmer lost in the water, a tired and bored person, a woman longing for love, a successful businessman, actors at the end and the beginning of their careers, couples in love, voters and politicians, great people from the past and those yet to come, people with disabilities, criminals and their judges, fluent lawyers, jurors and audiences, people who laugh and cry, dancers, widows, natives, sick people with different ailments, and anyone else along that spectrum. All of them are equal and their differences have been eliminated by night and sleep.

A large collage of people, each with their own unique appearance and story. The art style is pointillism, with each spot representing an individual. Men and women of all backgrounds and social classes are included, from the healthy to the sick, the happy to the sad, and those with power or those without.

233-044.text: I swear they are all beautiful,Every one that sleeps is beautiful, every thing in the dim light isbeautiful,The wildest and bloodiest is over, and all is peace.
caption: Using a romantic art style, the painting features a serene view of a dimly lit landscape at dusk. Various figures, either sleeping or at rest, are scattered throughout the scene, each one exuding beauty and tranquility. A sense of calmness is conveyed, as though the wildest and bloodiest events have already passed and all is now peaceful.

Realistic. A serene and peaceful night time landscape with beautiful sleeping flowers and trees lit by the dim light of the moon. The scene feels harmonious, with a sense of calm after the wildest and bloodiest has ended.

233-045.text: Peace is always beautiful,The myth of heaven indicates peace and night.
caption: Minimalistic. A serene, dark blue sky with a luminous full moon in the center symbolizing the myth of heaven. A white dove representing peace is in flight in the foreground.
Minimalist. A faint crescent moon surrounded by the night sky. The overall effect is peaceful and serene.

233-046.text: The myth of heaven indicates the soul,The soul is always beautiful, it appears more or it appears less, itcomes or it lags behind,It comes from its embower’d garden and looks pleasantly on itselfand encloses the world,Perfect and clean the genitals previously jetting,and perfect andclean the womb cohering,The head well-grown proportion’d and plumb, and the bowels andjoints proportion’d and plumb.
caption: The style is surrealism. The image is of a glowing, translucent figure with the shape of a human, with intricate designs flowing through it. There are two separate bodies- one with perfectly formed genitals and the other perfect internal organs. The figure has a serene expression and is surrounded by a garden in bloom. The figure is looking at itself, with a sense of self-enjoyment, as if reflecting on its own beauty.

Surrealist photography. A black and white photo on a white background with a naked person in the center . The genitals, head, bowels, and joints appear oversized and well-proportioned. The person looks content and at peace in their own skin.

233-047.text: The soul is always beautiful,The universe is duly in order, every thing is in its place,What has arrived is in its place and what waits shall be in its place,The twisted skull waits, the watery or rotten blood waits,The child of the glutton or venerealee waits long, and the child ofthe drunkard waits long, and the drunkard himself waits long,The sleepers that lived and died wait, the far advanced are to go onin their turns, and the far behind are to come on in their turns,The diverse shall be no less diverse, but they shall flow and unite--they unite now.
caption: The image is painted in a surrealist style. The background is a vast cosmic void, vibrant with an array of psychedelic colors.The soul, depicted as a bright and radiant being, takes center stage. The essence of the universe lies within it, with all things in their proper place. Surrounding the figure is a vast array of beings, including a twisted skull, watery blood, the child of the glutton and venereal, drunkard and a host of sleepers that lived and died. The beings seem to all be waiting their turn, to fuel the soul's immortality. The diverse beings are flowing and uniting, creating a pop of color and radiance around the soul.

Surrealism. An image of a beautiful soul surrounded by the orderly universe. Twisted skulls, watery blood, and other grotesque figures are waiting and flowing together in harmony. The sleeping and the dead, the far advanced and far behind, are also present in an otherworldly landscape.

233-048.text: 8The sleepers are very beautiful as they lie unclothed,They flow hand in hand over the whole earth from east to west asthey lie unclothed,The Asiatic and African are hand in hand, the European and Americanare hand in hand,Learn’d and unlearn’d are hand in hand, and male and female are handin hand,The bare arm of the girl crosses the bare breast of her lover, theypress close without lust, his lips press her neck,The father holds his grown or ungrown son in his arms withmeasureless love, and the son holds the father in his arms withmeasureless love,The white hair of the mother shines on the white wrist of the daughter,The breath of the boy goes with the breath of the man, friend isinarm’d by friend,The scholar kisses the teacher and the teacher kisses the scholar,the wrong ’d made right,The call of the slave is one with the master’s call, and the mastersalutes the slave,The felon steps forth from the prison, the insane becomes sane, thesuffering of sick persons is reliev’d,The sweatings and fevers stop, the throat that was unsound is sound,the lungs of the consumptive are resumed, the poor distress’dhead is free,The joints of the rheumatic move as smoothly as ever, and smootherthan ever,Stiflings and passages open, the paralyzed become supple,The swell’d and convuls’d and congested awake to themselves in condition,They pass the invigoration of the night and the chemistry of thenight, and awake.
caption: The style is impressionistic. The painting depicts several beautiful individuals from different parts of the world holding hands as they lie unclothed on the earth. There are people of different ages, genders, and nationalities. A father holds his son while a mother's white hair shines on her daughter's white wrist. Friends embrace each other, and scholars kiss their teachers. It shows that everyone is equal in this state of vulnerability, and peace and harmony reign, with even the wrongs made right. Sick individuals are healed, and prisoners and the insane become free. The painting embodies the beauty of humanity's interconnectedness and our ability to heal as one.

The photograph is a montage of people from different continents and backgrounds, all lying down with bare skin touching as they sleep next to each other. A father holds his child, a couple embraces without lust, a teacher and a student exchange kisses, and the formerly incarcerated and mentally ill are now well and free.

233-049.text: I too pass from the night,I stay a while away O night, but I return to you again and love you.
caption: Minimalist. A circle, half black and half white, representing night and day, respectively, with a line that swings back and forth between them, going past the white for a while before returning to the black.
Surrealism. A figure fades into a bright horizon, standing at bay from a dark, shadowy figure. The bright, bold figure turns back to look at the shadow with a mix of longing and resolution.

233-050.text: Why should I be afraid to trust myself to you?I am not afraid, I have been well brought forward by you,I love the rich running day, but I do not desert her in whom I lay so long,I know not how I came of you and I know not where I go with you, butI know I came well and shall go well.
caption: The visual style is impressionistic. The painting depicts a person with outstretched hands standing in a meadow with a winding river nearby. The vibrant colors show the beauty of the day. The person expresses trust and comfort in their surroundings, while also a sense of uncertainty about their destination.

The photograph is brightly lit with a peaceful tone. A person sits outside in a field, embracing the sun. There is trust and deep appreciation for the present moment, with a feeling of security and contentment.

233-051.text: I will stop only a time with the night, and rise betimes,I will duly pass the day O my mother, and duly return to you.
caption: Surrealism. A person standing in a vast, starry night with their arms reaching upwards. The left half of the picture is dark and night-like while the right is bright and day-like. The person appears to be suspended in air and looking towards the sky.

Using the visual style of surrealism, a person standing on a clock's minute hand above a bustling city during the night. They are looking up towards the sun, which is just rising over the horizon. In the foreground, a woman, presumably their mother, is standing, arms outstretched to them as if beckoning them to come back to her.

234-001.text: Let the reformers descend from the stands where they are foreverbawling--let an idiot or insane person appear on each of the stands;Let judges and criminals be transposed--let the prison-keepers beput in prison--let those that were prisoners take the keys;Let them that distrust birth and death lead the rest.
caption: In a surrealist style, a crowd of people stands on bleachers, with some individuals screaming or arguing. Suddenly, an insane person appears on each of the bleachers, causing confusion and disruption. Judges and criminals swap places, while prison-keepers find themselves behind bars. People who are skeptical of life and death then begin to lead the group.

Surrealist. On top of grand, stone stands stand screaming, hysterical figures. They are interchanged with feeble, mad-looking individuals. The prison wardens are locked up behind bars, while the prisoners hold the keys, and the distinction between the guilty and the judged is blurred.

235-001.text: 1To think of time--of all that retrospection,To think of to-day, and the ages continued henceforward.
caption: Minimalist black and white sketch style. The image shows an hourglass with sands falling to the bottom half. The top half of the hourglass has a blurred image of the present day, while the bottom half shows a clear image of the past. An arrow pointing towards the bottom half suggests the direction of the flow of time.
Surrealistic. The picture shows a clock melting and disintegrating, with an old man and a young child staring at it in amazement, representing how the concept of time can be fluid and subjective.

235-002.text: Have you guess’d you yourself would not continue?Have you dreaded these earth-beetles?Have you fear’d the future would be nothing to you?
caption: In a surrealistic style, the picture depicts a person in a fetal position, surrounded by giant earth beetles. The entire scene is shrouded in darkness, creating a feeling of fear and uncertainty. The figure seems contemplative, unsure about their future, with a poignant expression on their face.
Surrealist. A lone person gazing into the abyss, large beetles crawling around them. Uncertainty and fear is etched into the person's face, emphasizing the dread of the unknown.

235-003.text: Is to-day nothing? is the beginningless past nothing?If the future is nothing they are just as surely nothing.
caption: Minimalistic. The image features a black background with a white question mark at the center, followed by a series of floating numbers in black and white fading into the background. The numbers represent the beginningless past, present, and future, emphasizing the fleeting nature of time.
Minimalist. A single dot in the center of an empty space, representing the present as all that exists.

235-004.text: To think that the sun rose in the east--that men and women wereflexible, real, alive--that every thing was alive,To think that you and I did not see, feel, think, nor bear our part,To think that we are now here and bear our part.
caption: The visual style for this picture could be surrealism. The painting features a large sun in the center, with a man and a woman on either side of it. Their bodies are melting together in a fluid motion, blending into the landscape. The landscape itself is distorted and surreal, with everything from trees to rocks and clouds taking on a life of their own. The painting evokes the feeling that everything is alive and connected, and that everything moves together as one natural force.

Surrealism. A painting of the sun rising from the west while people are depicted as rigid objects, lifeless and isolated in a barren landscape. The viewer is placed directly in the barren landscape among this chaos, causing them to reflect on their existence and place in the world.

235-005.text: 2Not a day passes, not a minute or second without an accouchement,Not a day passes, not a minute or second without a corpse.
caption: In the style of impressionism, a clock with a black background indicating time passing. On the left, a pregnant woman giving birth, while on the right, a man's figure is falling backward depicting a death.

In an abstract expressionist style, a chaotic visual filled with bursts of colors and shapes representing the cycle of life and death. The vibrancy and energy of new births are juxtaposed with the stillness and emptiness of corpses.

235-006.text: The dull nights go over and the dull days also,The soreness of lying so much in bed goes over,The physician after long putting off gives the silent and terriblelook for an answer,The children come hurried and weeping, and the brothers and sistersare sent for,Medicines stand unused on the shelf, (the camphor-smell has longpervaded the rooms,)The faithful hand of the living does not desert the hand of the dying,The twitching lips press lightly on the forehead of the dying,The breath ceases and the pulse of the heart ceases,The corpse stretches on the bed and the living look upon it,It is palpable as the living are palpable.
caption: A somber painting in an impressionist style. The center of the image is a bed with a figure lying on it, with family members standing around in concern. The atmosphere is filled with sadness, showcased by the dark hues, and muted tones. Various objects, including unused medicine bottles, sit idly on the shelves, further adding to the sense of inaction. The image depicts the transition from life to death, with the last breath taken and the final heartbeat. The focus is on the intimacy and raw emotion of the moment, and the visceral reality of death.

A somber, realistic photograph depicting a dying person's last moments, surrounded by loved ones who are gathered in mourning. The stillness of death contrasts with the movement of the living, yet the unity of the family's hands speaks to support and love in a time of grief.

235-007.text: The living look upon the corpse with their eyesight,But without eyesight lingers a different living and looks curiouslyon the corpse.
caption: The visual style would be surrealistic. In the foreground, a group of living people are staring at a lifeless body. In the background, there is a ghostly-looking, eyeless figure hovering above the corpse, looking curiously at it.
Impressionist. A group of people are standing, some of them observing a corpse with their eyes, while a different group of people curiously gazes at the same corpse without eyesight.

235-008.text: 3To think the thought of death merged in the thought of materials,To think of all these wonders of city and country, and others takinggreat interest in them, and we taking no interest in them.
caption: With a modern and energetic style, the painting portrays a bustling city on one side and a scenic countryside on the other. In the center stands a solitary figure lost in thought, blending the idea of their mortality with that of the physical matter surrounding them. Meanwhile, the rest of the world happily engages with and admires the wonders of both the city and country, while the figure remains engrossed in their internal introspection.
Photographic realism. An aerial view of a bustling city with the urban landscape and the natural environment, yet people are uninterested in its wonders.

235-009.text: To think how eager we are in building our houses,To think others shall be just as eager, and we quite indifferent.
caption: The picture is created in a Pop art style. It depicts two contrasting images side by side. On the left is a man happily building his own house, with a content smile on his face. On the right, several people look on in disappointment, some with tears in their eyes, as their own houses are left abandoned and untouched because of their lack of enthusiasm.
Surrealism. A man feverishly building a house, oblivious to a group of people beside him, also eager to construct their homes.

235-010.text: (I see one building the house that serves him a few years, orseventy or eighty years at most,I see one building the house that serves him longer than that.)
caption: Minimalistic. A time-lapse of a person's life, fast-forwarded. They begin by building a house and end with the house standing for decades beyond their lifetime.
Realistic. An elderly person bent over a wood table, skillfully hammering nails into wood. In the background is a large, weathered house that has stood for generations.

235-011.text: Slow-moving and black lines creep over the whole earth--they nevercease--they are the burial lines,He that was President was buried, and he that is now President shallsurely be buried.
caption: Illustration in the style of charcoal sketches. Dark, slow-moving lines are creeping over the surface of the earth, with a continuous and relentless movement. The lines appear to be burial lines, signifying the final resting place of the earth's inhabitants. The image suggests that whoever holds the position of the President comes and goes, with one being buried and another taking their place - they are not immune to the inevitability of death.
A grayscale photo of a vast landscape with slow-moving black lines creeping over it like veins. A small hill with a grave on top indicating that every leader inevitably succumbs to the burial lines.

235-013.text: 4A reminiscence of the vulgar fate,A frequent sample of the life and death of workmen,Each after his kind.
caption: Surrealism. A painting depicting a dark and gloomy factory with various workmen are shown performing their duties. The painting has a bluish tint, and the figures almost blend into the factory's landscape, as if they are part of it. In the background, there are several silhouettes resembling tombstones, representing the life and death of workmen.
With a dark and somber color palette, an industrial scene is depicted with a group of workmen toiling hard at their jobs, emulating the tough cycle of life and death of the working class.

235-014.text: Cold dash of waves at the ferry-wharf, posh and ice in the river,half-frozen mud in the streets,A gray discouraged sky overhead, the short last daylight of December,A hearse and stages, the funeral of an old Broadway stage-driver,the cortege mostly drivers.
caption: Realistic. A gloomy winter scene with a cold blue hue. A river and ferry-wharf with icy water splashing onto the dock. Half-frozen muddy streets with a gray sky overhead. A hearse leading the funeral procession of an old Broadway stage-driver, followed by stages filled with other drivers.

Realism with a dull color palette. A ferry-wharf with waves crashing, a river almost completely covered in ice with chunks of ice floating, streets caked in half-frozen mud under a grey winter sky. A funeral procession of old Broadway stage-driver with multiple hearses and stages followed by drivers.

235-015.text: Steady the trot to the cemetery, duly rattles the death-bell,The gate is pass’d, the new-dug grave is halted at, the livingalight, the hearse uncloses,The coffin is pass’d out, lower’d and settled, the whip is laid onthe coffin, the earth is swiftly shovel’d in,The mound above is flatted with the spades--silence,A minute--no one moves or speaks--it is done,He is decently put away--is there any thing more?
caption: Film noir. A dark, stormy day with a somber funeral march. Rain streams down the black hearse as it pulls up to the cemetery gate. Once inside, the coffin is lifted out and slowly lowered into the grave. The dirt is shoveled in and the mourners watch in solemn silence as the mound is flattened. The scene ends with the mourners beginning to disperse as the rain continues to fall.

This black and white photograph captures the solemn procession to the cemetery. The hearse sits at the entrance gate, surrounded by mourners. The new-dug grave awaits, the coffin is lowered and settled, and as the earth is swiftly shoveled in, the mound above the grave is flatted with the spades. Silence ensues and the mourners pay their respects to the deceased.

235-016.text: He was a good fellow, free-mouth’d, quick-temper’d, not bad-looking,Ready with life or death for a friend, fond of women, gambled, atehearty, drank hearty,Had known what it was to be flush, grew low-spirited toward thelast, sicken’d, was help’d by a contribution,Died, aged forty-one years--and that was his funeral.
caption: In the style of oil painting, a portrait of a rough-edged man with messy hair and a rough beard. His expression is friendly and approachable. He is seated at a table with a bottle of wine and a hearty meal before him. Behind him stands a woman with a sorrowful expression. In the background, we can see a cemetery with a freshly dug grave, where the man's funeral takes place.

Nostalgic, monochromatic photograph of a man with a wide smile, sitting at a table surrounded by empty bottles and plates of food. The photograph transitions from the man at his happiest to his gradual decline, ultimately ending with a somber image of his empty chair at his funeral.

235-017.text: Thumb extended, finger uplifted, apron, cape, gloves, strap,wet-weather clothes, whip carefully chosen,Boss, spotter, starter, hostler, somebody loafing on you, youloafing on somebody, headway, man before and man behind,Good day’s work, bad day’s work, pet stock, mean stock, first out,last out, turning-in at night,To think that these are so much and so nigh to other drivers, and hethere takes no interest in them.
caption: Surrealist. A jumbled mass of objects and people, each with a distinct role. In the center stands a figure with a thumb extended and finger uplifted, dressed in an apron, cape, gloves, and wet-weather clothes, holding a carefully chosen whip. To the left are the Boss, spotter, starter, and hostler. To the right, somebody loafing and somebody being loafed on. Up high, a pet stock and a mean stock are depicted. Behind and in front are men at work, with a day's work, good or bad, behind them. The scene is set at night when the drivers are turning in. Despite the busyness, the central figure, a driver, stands alone, apathetic to the surrounding chaos.

In an impressionistic style, we see a busy stable yard with horses and their handlers. The workers are distinguished by their attire and tools, with some standing idle and others toiling in pairs. The narrator observes it all, seemingly disconnected from the goings-on.

235-018.text: 5The markets, the government, the working-man’s wages, to think whataccount they are through our nights and days,To think that other working-men will make just as great account ofthem, yet we make little or no account.
caption: Pop art style. A bold and colorful cityscape, with a focus on a busy marketplace with men in suits moving quickly. In the foreground, a group of working-class men stand together with protesting signs, while a clock above them shows the time passing. The contrast between their struggle and the perceived importance of the markets and government is clear.

A photograph taken in a busy city with people rushing around a crowded market, while a government building stands tall in the distance. The perspective shift towards a working-man's point of view, who seems to be ignored by the rest of society.

235-019.text: The vulgar and the refined, what you call sin and what you callgoodness, to think how wide a difference,To think the difference will still continue to others, yet we liebeyond the difference.
caption: The picture is done in a surrealistic style. In the foreground, there are two groups of people - one made up of unrefined individuals, and the other with those who are more sophisticated. They are separated by a gap that signifies a significant difference. But in the background, some individuals are shown rising above the gap, indicating that despite the difference, there is a possibility of transcending it.

Surrealism. A stark light divides the image in half: one depicting vulgar characters and the other showing refined individuals. A person stands in the center of the image, transcending above the dichotomy to a higher plane of existence.

235-020.text: To think how much pleasure there is,Do you enjoy yourself in the city? or engaged in business? orplanning a nomination and election? or with your wife and family?Or with your mother and sisters? or in womanly housework? or thebeautiful maternal cares?These also flow onward to others, you and I flow onward,But in due time you and I shall take less interest in them.
caption: The artistic style is impressionism. A group of people, with varying lifestyles and ages, are together in a bustling city, possibly surrounded by towering buildings. They all seem content in their respective activities, such as working, spending time with family or doing household duties. However, there is a sense that all of them are moving forward in time, symbolized by the blurred, flowing motion of the painting. Despite their differences, they are connected and will eventually lose interest in these current pursuits as time passes.

A collage of daily life moments; a person commuting to work in the city, a couple planning a wedding, a mother taking care of her child, two siblings arguing, etc. Each moment is connected and flows into each other, representing the passage of time and the gradual disinterest one has in these fleeting experiences.

235-021.text: Your farm, profits, crops--to think how engross’d you are,To think there will still be farms, profits, crops, yet for you ofwhat avail?
caption: A minimalistic picture in the style of impressionism with a farmer in the centre, staring off into the distance with a vacant look. In the background, there are several fields with crops that are painted in soft greens and yellows. There is an overall sense of stillness and quietness in the painting.

Surrealism. The landscape beyond a barren, lifeless farm is lush with vibrant, overgrown foliage. The farmer appears small and insignificant in the foreground, consumed with worry and doubt as he realizes the true valuelessness of his land and efforts.

235-022.text: 6What will be will be well, for what is is well,To take interest is well, and not to take interest shall be well.
caption: Surrealism. A triptych-style painting. The first panel shows a peaceful scene of a sunset over a calm ocean. The second panel shows a chaotic scene of a city in turmoil. The third panel brings the two scenes together with a figure in the foreground, sitting calmly and meditating while chaos and peace exist around them.
Minimalist. A person standing in front of a signpost with an arrow pointing in two directions reading 'take interest' and 'don't take interest'. The person looks content either way.

235-023.text: The domestic joys, the dally housework or business, the building ofhouses, are not phantasms, they have weight, form, location,Farms, profits, crops, markets, wages, government, are none of themphantasms,The difference between sin and goodness is no delusion,The earth is not an echo, man and his life and all the things of hislife are well-consider’d.
caption: The painting is in the style of realism. It depicts a busy city street with people going about their daily lives. On the left, a mother is washing dishes in front of a yellow house, while a man is working on a construction site nearby. Farmers are selling their crops in a marketplace, and there are signs of a functioning government in the background. The painting reflects on the importance of tangible things like domestic responsibilities, businesses, and governance in life, and the distinction between good and evil.

Realistic photography. A quiet and humbling moment of a man and a woman sharing domestic chores within the walls of their home. The farmland outside, bountiful with crops and livestock, highlights the value of hard work and livelihood. The majesty and importance of life on Earth come alive in this scene.

235-024.text: You are not thrown to the winds, you gather certainly and safelyaround yourself,Yourself! yourself!. yourself, for ever and ever!
caption: In a surrealistic style, the picture shows a person standing still in a fierce wind. They are surrounded by small objects and debris, but they stand steadfast and calm, their hands held out in front of them. The objects that surround them seem to coalesce into something new with each gust of wind, forming an unbreakable barrier around this person.
Minimalistic. Profile of a person with their arms outstretched and their eyes closed, surrounded by a swirling wind that is contained in a circle around them.

235-025.text: 7It is not to diffuse you that you were born of your mother andfather, it is to identify you,It is not that you should be undecided, but that you should be decided,Something long preparing and formless is arrived and form’d in you,You are henceforth secure, whatever comes or goes.
caption: Surrealistic. A black and white portrait of a faceless figure emerging from a swirling mass of thick, white fog. The figure is genderless androgynous, and seems to be both human and not. They appear to be simultaneously emerging from and disappearing into the fog. Despite this uncertainty, they display an air of quiet confidence and assurance.

The photograph is staged in a studio with a light shining down on a person's face. It is a portrait taken in black and white to convey timelessness. The person's face is serious, and their expression conveys confidence and security.

235-026.text: The threads that were spun are gather’d, the wet crosses the warp,the pattern is systematic.
caption: Abstract. A vibrant tapestry with overlapping and interweaving threads of varying colors, forming a complex pattern that is both symmetrical and systematic. The surface of the tapestry is slightly damp, accentuating the sheen of the threads, and the warp can be seen beneath the colorful crosses.
The image depicts a woven tapestry, with intricate and precise details, reminiscent of an optical illusion, as different threads are being woven together.

235-027.text: The preparations have every one been justified,The orchestra have sufficiently tuned their instruments, the batonhas given the signal.
caption: Pop-Art. A colorful, abstract depiction of an orchestra in the preparation phase. Instruments are being tuned and the conductor's baton is raised in the air to signal the start of the performance. The lines representing the musicians' movements are bold and dynamic, conveying a strong sense of anticipation and excitement.
In an impressionist style, a conductor raises their baton to signal the orchestra. The musicians stand poised and ready in front of their instruments, which are bathed in warm light from the stage.

235-028.text: The guest that was coming, he waited long, he is now housed,He is one of those who are beautiful and happy, he is one of thosethat to look upon and be with is enough.
caption: In the style of impressionism, a bright colorful mural depicting a sunny outdoor scene. A picturesque house with a garden, surrounded by tall trees. A figure in silhouette can be seen approaching. On the porch, a man stands waiting happily, arms outstretched in welcome. The silhouette arrives and the two embrace in the warmth of the sun.
Minimalist black and white portrait of a smiling person. They are standing at the threshold of a well-lit doorway, looking back at the viewer invitingly with a sense of contentment and pleasure.

235-029.text: The law of the past cannot be eluded,The law of the present and future cannot be eluded,The law of the living cannot be eluded, it is eternal,The law of promotion and transformation cannot be eluded,The law of heroes and good-doers cannot be eluded,The law of drunkards, informers, mean persons, not one iota thereofcan be eluded.
caption: Surrealist. Depicted as a large hourglass, the sand represents the passing of time. In the upper section of the hourglass are images of the past, present, and future. In the bottom section are depicted good-doers, heroes, drunkards, informers and mean persons, all following the laws of promotion, transformation and living. The image radiates a sense of eternity as the laws cannot be eluded.

A surreal visual containing a cosmic clock with various hands moving at different speeds, some people are running while others are frozen in time. There is a clear divide between those who embrace the law and those who ignore it.

235-030.text: 8Slow moving and black lines go ceaselessly over the earth,Northerner goes carried and Southerner goes carried, and they on theAtlantic side and they on the Pacific,And they between, and all through the Mississippi country, and allover the earth.
caption: In shades of black and white, a time-lapse photograph depicts the movement of people across the United States. The Northern and Southern regions can be seen, as well as those on the Atlantic and Pacific coasts. The Mississippi River and other waterways can be seen as well, as the people travel all across the land. The style is documentary or journalistic.

This photo is presented in a minimalist style, with black and white lines and lots of negative space. The lines flow in a consistent and orderly fashion, resembling the motion of railroad tracks. There are silhouettes of people in the distance, representing individuals making their way along the journey of life.

235-031.text: The great masters and kosmos are well as they go, the heroes andgood-doers are well,The known leaders and inventors and the rich owners and pious anddistinguish’d may be well,But there is more account than that, there is strict account of all.
caption: In an abstract, modern art style, there are various shapes and colors arranged in a seemingly random pattern. However, upon further inspection, a detailed tally can be found, listing all of the great masters, heroes, good-doers, leaders, inventors, rich owners, and pious individuals, as well as a record of their deeds and impact on the world.

Surrealism. A bustling cityscape with all its great leaders and inventors sitting on a snail's shell. Above them is a giant weighing scale, measuring the cosmic significance of their contributions, with some falling short. Beside the scale stands a shadowy figure, taking strict notes on this judgement day.

235-032.text: The interminable hordes of the ignorant and wicked are not nothing,The barbarians of Africa and Asia are not nothing,The perpetual successions of shallow people are not nothing as they go.
caption: In the style of expressionism, there is an overwhelming mass of dark, shadowy figures endlessly streaming from the background. In the foreground, there is a solitary figure, possibly a saint or enlightened person, standing with arms outstretched, facing the horde with determination, as though ready to face and overcome its onslaught. Above, there is a bleak, cloudy sky, with rays of light appearing to penetrate through the depths of the darkness.

Using the art style of pointillism, a photograph of a crowded marketplace in a bustling and dense city. The photograph is of people moving in different directions, with different expressions on their faces, but all are in a hurry and appear to be living in midst of chaos.

235-033.text: Of and in all these things,I have dream’d that we are not to be changed so much, nor the law ofus changed,I have dream’d that heroes and good-doers shall be under the presentand past law,And that murderers, drunkards, liars, shall be under the present andpast law,For I have dream’d that the law they are under now is enough.
caption: The picture shows a serene landscape with trees, flowers, and blue skies. In the foreground, there are a group of people, including heroes, good-doers, murderers, drunkards, and liars. They all live under the same blue sky with trees leaning over them. They seem to be at peace with each other, and there is no sign of chaos. It is a surreal painting style.

Using a surreal visual style, the image depicts a balance beam with virtuous people on one side and wicked people on the other. In the center, a powerful law book hovers, as if maintaining the equilibrium between justice and sin.

235-034.text: And I have dream’d that the purpose and essence of the known life,the transient,Is to form and decide identity for the unknown life, the permanent.
caption: The picture is in a classical style, with an ethereal and surreal backdrop. In the foreground stands a figure with their arms outstretched, symbolizing the transience of life. As they reach towards the backdrop they are transformed into a symbol of identity, representing the permanence of life. The colors are muted, giving it a dreamlike quality.

In an expressionist style, there is a blurred, ethereal image of a figure with a quizzical expression looking towards a hazy, translucent representation of themselves. In the background, there are static, fading images of locations and experiences flashing by. The image captures the intangible, transformative nature of life experiences in forming a sense of self.

235-035.text: If all came but to ashes of dung,If maggots and rats ended us, then Alarum! for we are betray’d,Then indeed suspicion of death.
caption: The visual style for this scene would be dark and slightly ominous, with a focus on textures and shadows. The image would depict a barren wasteland, with a pile of ashes and dung in the center. Surrounding the pile are swarming maggots and rats, which give the impression of decay and death. In the distance, a figure is seen cowering in fear, suggesting that they have been "betrayed" by this desolate landscape. Overall, the picture conveys a sense of despair and uncertainty, emphasizing the speaker's fear of death and the unknown.

The picture is a surreal interpretation of the fight against mortality. The image depicts an array of giant rats and maggots rising from the ashes of dung. The protagonist looks confused and lost, with a sudden realization that death may not be the end, but it feels like a trap.

235-036.text: Do you suspect death? if I were to suspect death I should die now,Do you think I could walk pleasantly and well-suited toward annihilation?
caption: In an abstract expressionist style, a figure is walking toward a bright light, possibly the afterlife. The figure exudes confidence and contentment, showing no fear of death. The colors are warm and inviting, giving a sense of peacefulness.
Surrealist. A person walking confidently down a path, with a looming figure of death standing at the end, casting a shadow over the scene.

235-037.text: Pleasantly and well-suited I walk,Whither I walk I cannot define, but I know it is good,The whole universe indicates that it is good,The past and the present indicate that it is good.
caption: The painting is done in the impressionistic style, depicting a person walking confidently in the midst of beautiful scenery. The colors are warm and muted, and the lighting is soft and diffused, indicating a beautiful day. The atmosphere of the painting is peaceful and serene, and the scenery itself hints at endless possibilities, with the vastness of the universe being subtly portrayed in the distance.
Abstract expressionism. A person walking gracefully into a colorful and indescribable space with past and present elements blending together to signify the goodness of the universe.

235-038.text: How beautiful and perfect are the animals!How perfect the earth, and the minutest thing upon it!What is called good is perfect, and what is called bad is just as perfect,The vegetables and minerals are all perfect, and the imponderablefluids perfect;Slowly and surely they have pass’d on to this, and slowly and surelythey yet pass on.
caption: With an art nouveau style, a detailed and intricate illustration of a lush, vibrant, and diverse ecosystem is displayed. There are animals, plants, and minerals all co-existing in perfect harmony. Each detail is carefully crafted with precise linework and vivid colors. The overall image portrays the idea that everything in nature is perfectly balanced and that both the so-called good and bad elements are integral and necessary parts of the natural world.

Naturalism. A soft, focused image of an animal in its natural habitat, surrounded by lush flora and minerals. Despite the contrast between light and dark and its vulnerability, the animal's beauty is evident.

235-039.text: 9I swear I think now that every thing without exception has an eternal soul!The trees have, rooted in the ground! the weeds of the sea have! theanimals!
caption: In a surreal art style, an ethereal glow surrounds a dark forest with trees that seem to have a soul, with root-like connections to the ground. Below, there are weeds of the sea extending their tendrils into the water, also with a faint, glowing aura to their bodies. At the edges of the painting, there are animal figures, each with an otherworldly light emanating from within them, suggesting that every creature has an eternal soul that transcends their physical form.

Abstract expressionism. A vibrant and colorful canvas with various shapes and lines that seem to blur and merge together in an explosion of motion. The painting seems to convey the idea that eternal souls exist within all living things, from the towering trees rooted in the earth to the smallest of sea creatures.

235-040.text: I swear I think there is nothing but immortality!That the exquisite scheme is for it, and the nebulous float is forit, and the cohering is for it!And all preparation is for it--and identity is for it--and life andmaterials are altogether for it!
caption: The visual style would be an ethereal and cosmic painting with light colors, perhaps in the style of surrealism or abstract art. The image depicts a nebulous, glowing cloud that represents everything in existence, all the materials of the universe converging into a single point at its center. This point is the source of immortality, from which everything in the universe originates and returns to. The image captures the essence of eternity and the infinite cycle of life and death.
Surrealism style. A large nebula in shades of blue and purple above a misty, ethereal landscape with structures that seem otherworldly. There is a feeling of eternity in the image.

236-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
236-001.text: Darest thou now O soul,Walk out with me toward the unknown region,Where neither ground is for the feet nor any path to follow?
caption: A surrealistic picture with an obscure atmosphere. A faceless figure is leading a second figure towards a vague horizon. The ground fades into darkness and there is no discernible path. The figures are illuminated by a soft, eerie light as they venture towards the unknown.
Surrealistic. A person standing on a floating ground while looking towards an unknown vast space where nothing is visible.

236-002.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
236-002.text: No map there, nor guide,Nor voice sounding, nor touch of human hand,Nor face with blooming flesh, nor lips, nor eyes, are in that land.
caption: Surrealistic. The picture is dark, with the land being a barren wasteland of rock and dirt, with no signs of life. The landscape is overshadowed by a vast, starry sky. An ethereal, ghostly figure is hovering above this landscape, reaching out as if searching for something. A faint light glows from within the figure, providing the only source of illumination.
Surrealistic. An infinite, dark, and barren land lies ahead. A figure stands alone in awe, with no map or guide, nor companionship. The vast emptiness echoes his footsteps as if leading to nowhere.

236-003.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
236-003.text: I know it not O soul,Nor dost thou, all is a blank before us,All waits undream’d of in that region, that inaccessible land.
caption: Surrealistic black and white. A lost soul floats in a vast empty space. Above them, an inaccessible land can be seen. Both the soul and the land are impossible to reach.
A surrealist photograph featuring an individual standing in front of a vast, empty abyss, unsure of their surroundings and the unknown journey that lies ahead of them.

236-004.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
236-004.text: Till when the ties loosen,All but the ties eternal, Time and Space,Nor darkness, gravitation, sense, nor any bounds bounding us.
caption: Abstract expressionism. A colorful explosion of paint on a canvas with no clear boundaries. The colors blend together into one another giving an impression of infinity, freedom and absence of any restraining force.

In a surrealist style, an ethereal scene with many floating, translucent ties or strings attached to a figure. The strings gradually dissipate until only a few remain, those being the eternal ties. The figure is unconstrained by any earthly forces, surrounded by darkness and nothingness.

236-005.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
236-005.text: Then we burst forth, we float,In Time and Space O soul, prepared for them,Equal, equipt at last, (O joy! O fruit of all!) them to fulfil O soul.
caption: Abstract Expressionism. A colorful burst of energy in the form of an expanding sphere with vibrant colors and patterns swirling around it. Radial rays emanate from it, representing time, as it moves through space. The boldness of the colors and shapes signify the preparedness and excitement of the soul for what's to come.

In an abstract expressionist style, the painting depicts a bursting forth of colors and shapes to create a free-flowing and unrestricted sense of time and space. The image is infused with a sense of joy and fulfillment, mirroring the sentiments of the poem.

237-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
237-001.text: Whispers of heavenly death murmur’d I hear,Labial gossip of night, sibilant chorals,Footsteps gently ascending, mystical breezes wafted soft and low,Ripples of unseen rivers, tides of a current flowing, forever flowing,(Or is it the plashing of tears? the measureless waters of human tears?)
caption: An abstract oil painting in dark hues, showing a mysterious night landscape. In the foreground, ghostly whispers seem to rise from the ground, represented by dark smoky swirls. Small gusts of wind are illustrated by undulating linear shapes with occasional twisted knots. In the distance, there are winding, meandering rivers of undetermined depth and width. The muted tones suggest a sad and contemplative mood.

The misty and dark image of a forest at night, with only the moonlight shining on the trees. The movement of the trees is gentle, like whispers that can almost be heard, accompanied by the sound of a nearby river.

237-002.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
237-002.text: I see, just see skyward, great cloud-masses,Mournfully slowly they roll, silently swelling and mixing,With at times a half-dimm’d sadden’d far-off star,Appearing and disappearing.
caption: The visual style could be surrealism. A dark and brooding sky with giant cloud formations slowly rolling and merging with one another. In the center of the image, there is a melancholic, far-off star that intermittently appears and disappears. The tone of the picture is one of sadness, isolation and uncertainty.
A photograph taken in black and white, showcasing an overcast sky. Menacing, towering clouds glide by soundlessly as distant stars flicker briefly before disappearing into the gloom.

237-003.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
237-003.text: (Some parturition rather, some solemn immortal birth;On the frontiers to eyes impenetrable,Some soul is passing over.)
caption: The visual style is surrealism. The picture is a dark realm, with impenetrable eyes on the forefront. In the distance, a glowing figure is passing over, representing a solemn, immortal birth.
Surreal. A hazy and mysterious border where a being is transcending from this world to another. The image portrays a sense of everlasting life, with an ambiguous figure en route to a world unknown.

238-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
238-001.text: 1Chanting the square deific, out of the One advancing, out of the sides,Out of the old and new, out of the square entirely divine,Solid, four-sided, (all the sides needed,) from this side Jehovah am I,Old Brahm I, and I Saturnius am;Not Time affects me--I am Time, old, modern as any,Unpersuadable, relentless, executing righteous judgments,As the Earth, the Father, the brown old Kronos, with laws,Aged beyond computation, yet never new, ever with those mighty laws rolling,Relentless I forgive no man--whoever sins dies--I will have that man’s life;Therefore let none expect mercy--have the seasons, gravitation, theappointed days, mercy? no more have I,But as the seasons and gravitation, and as all the appointed daysthat forgive not,I dispense from this side judgments inexorable without the least remorse.
caption: The visual style is surrealism. The painting features an abstract, deific, square figure emerging from a background that combines elements of old and new. On one side, there is the god Jehovah, on the other side is an ancient god - Brahm and Saturnius. The figure stands solid, four-sided, and imposing, executing righteous judgments. To one side is a representation of Earth, and to the other side is the father. The scene is aged beyond computation and rolls with mighty laws, just like seasons and gravitation. The painting evokes a sense of mercilessness, as the figure forgives no man, and whoever sins dies without the least remorse.

Surrealism. A multi-faced entity, composed of old and new elements, with a powerful and unyielding presence. It towers over the Earth like an ancient deity, meting out justice without mercy or compassion.

238-002.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
238-002.text: 2Consolator most mild, the promis’d one advancing,With gentle hand extended, the mightier God am I,Foretold by prophets and poets in their most rapt prophecies and poems,From this side, lo! the Lord Christ gazes--lo! Hermes I--lo! mine isHercules’ face,All sorrow, labor, suffering, I, tallying it, absorb in myself,Many times have I been rejected, taunted, put in prison, andcrucified, and many times shall be again,All the world have I given up for my dear brothers’ and sisters’sake, for the soul’s sake,Wanding my way through the homes of men, rich or poor, with the kissof affection,For I am affection, I am the cheer-bringing God, with hope andall-enclosing charity,With indulgent words as to children, with fresh and sane words, mine only,Young and strong I pass knowing well I am destin’d myself to anearly death;But my charity has no death--my wisdom dies not, neither early nor late,And my sweet love bequeath’d here and elsewhere never dies.
caption: The visual style is Renaissance baroque, with the picture depicting a man with a gentle smile and a compassionate gaze. He has a white toga draped around him with a soft golden aura, denoting his divine nature. In his hand, he extends a warm embrace to a group of people from different walks of life, rich and poor, old and young, as a symbol of love and compassion. Behind him, the ruins of a prison and the cross where he was crucified symbolize the trials he faced in his lifetime. Despite the hardships, his face radiates hope and charity, reminding us of the eternal wisdom and everlasting love that he has bequeathed to the world.

Surrealistic. The figure of Consolator advancing with outstretched hand, composed of various mythological figures, such as Christ, Hermes, and Hercules. Passersby, both rich and poor, stop to receive his kiss of affection, while he absorbs their sorrow, labor, and suffering, leaving them with fresh and sane words of indulgence and hope.

238-003.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
238-003.text: 3Aloof, dissatisfied, plotting revolt,Comrade of criminals, brother of slaves,Crafty, despised, a drudge, ignorant,With sudra face and worn brow, black, but in the depths of my heart,proud as any,Lifted now and always against whoever scorning assumes to rule me,Morose, full of guile, full of reminiscences, brooding, with many wiles,(Though it was thought I was baffled, and dispel’d, and my wilesdone, but that will never be,)Defiant, I, Satan, still live, still utter words, in new lands dulyappearing, (and old ones also,)Permanent here from my side, warlike, equal with any, real as any,Nor time nor change shall ever change me or my words.
caption: The image is in the style of a dark oil painting, with a close up of a man with a sly, almost sinister expression on his face. He has a worn and tired look, with dark skin and wrinkles on his forehead. Although he may appear subservient and overlooked by society, he harbors a secret rebellion within him that is proud and unyielding. He is the embodiment of defiance and cunning, never giving up or being silenced. His presence is a permanent fixture in both old and new lands, making him a timeless symbol of resistance.

The picture shows a man with a black face, a worried expression filled with anger, and a sense of defiance. He is an outcast, dissatisfied, and appears crafty, a symbol of rebellion who still stands tall despite his struggles, and fiercely remains undefeated. This visual style is reminiscent of futurism, which glorifies the power of technology and industry, as well as the desire for rebellion and change.

238-004.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
238-004.text: 4Santa Spirita, breather, life,Beyond the light, lighter than light,Beyond the flames of hell, joyous, leaping easily above hell,Beyond Paradise, perfumed solely with mine own perfume,Including all life on earth, touching, including God, includingSaviour and Satan,Ethereal, pervading all, (for without me what were all? what were God?)Essence of forms, life of the real identities, permanent, positive,(namely the unseen,)Life of the great round world, the sun and stars, and of man, I, thegeneral soul,Here the square finishing, the solid, I the most solid,Breathe my breath also through these songs.
caption: The style is surrealism. The picture depicts a bright figure with outstretched arms floating above a dark, chaotic world. The figure is luminescent and seems to breathe out a mist that spreads across the entire world, calming all chaos and unrest. Despite the darkness and chaos below, the figure emanates joy and peace, as if it is the source of all that is good in the world.

The picture appears in a dreamlike style, an ethereal mass that travels with a colorful aura. The entity has wings and is surrounded by light that transcends space and time, taking everything in its presence. The picture feels cosmic and magical, as if watching a force of nature that is much bigger than oneself.

239-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
239-001.poem: Of Him I Love Day and Night
239-001.text: Of him I love day and night I dream’d I heard he was dead,And I dream’d I went where they had buried him I love, but he wasnot in that place,And I dream’d I wander’d searching among burial-places to find him,And I found that every place was a burial-place;The houses full of life were equally full of death, (this house is now,)The streets, the shipping, the places of amusement, the Chicago,Boston, Philadelphia, the Mannahatta, were as full of the dead asof the living,And fuller, O vastly fuller of the dead than of the living;And what I dream’d I will henceforth tell to every person and age,And I stand henceforth bound to what I dream’d,And now I am willing to disregard burial-places and dispense with them,And if the memorials of the dead were put up indifferently everywhere,even in the room where I eat or sleep, I should be satisfied,And if the corpse of any one I love, or if my own corpse, be dulyrender’d to powder and pour’d in the sea, I shall be satisfied,Or if it be distributed to the winds I shall be satisfied.
caption: The visual style is surrealistic. The image is a landscape with the protagonist wandering around in search of their loved one who has passed away. Everywhere they go, there are burial sites and reminders of death. The buildings and streets, including landmarks like Chicago and Philadelphia, all have a macabre quality. The protagonist becomes accepting of the idea that memorials and corpses can be placed anywhere, even in their own living space, and that dispersing the ashes in the sea or wind is a satisfactory form of burial.

Surrealist. A person is wandering through different places searching for someone they love who has passed away, but there are no graves, only living spaces that are equally full of death. The person feels that memorials of the dead should be put up everywhere, and it does not matter where they are placed, they will be satisfied as long as they are remembered.

240-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
240-001.text: Yet, yet, ye downcast hours, I know ye also,Weights of lead, how ye clog and cling at my ankles,Earth to a chamber of mourning turns--I hear the o’erweening, mockingvoice,Matter is conqueror--matter, triumphant only, continues onward.
caption: The picture is done in a gothic style. It shows a person's feet with heavy weights of lead attached to them. The atmosphere of the surrounding is dim and gloomy, depicting mourning. There is the faint sound of an arrogant, mocking voice echoing in the background. These weights are holding the person back from moving forward, constricting their progress towards the light.

In a dark, gloomy room, a person's feet are stuck in a mud-like substance represented by lead. In the distance, a brightly lit room represents the conquest of matter over spirit, while a mocking voice is heard. The visual style is represented by chiaroscuro, with strong contrasts between light and dark.

240-002.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
240-002.text: Despairing cries float ceaselessly toward me,The call of my nearest lover, putting forth, alarm’d, uncertain,The sea I am quickly to sail, come tell me,Come tell me where I am speeding, tell me my destination.
caption: Post-Impressionist. A stormy sea with a small boat in the center. A figure inside the boat is holding their head and crying. In the distance, a figure on the shore is calling out with their arms raised. The scene evokes a feeling of despair and uncertainty about the destination.

This image is captured in a dramatic, cinematic style. A boat sailing towards a dark and foreboding sea horizon with a person at the helm, looking back longingly towards their lover, sitting on a rough and rocky coast, possibly waving goodbye or crying out to them. The feeling of uncertainty, questioning and despair are evident on the sailor's face.

240-003.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
240-003.text: I understand your anguish, but I cannot help you,I approach, hear, behold, the sad mouth, the look out of the eyes,your mute inquiry,Whither I go from the bed I recline on, come tell me,--Old age, alarm’d, uncertain--a young woman’s voice, appealing tome for comfort;A young man’s voice, Shall I not escape?
caption: Surrealist. In the foreground, an old person with a worried expression on their face lying on a bed. On the right, a young woman looking at the old person with a pleading expression, and on the left, a young man anxiously looking at the sky, searching for escape. The background is a dream-like landscape with cloudy skies and a faint aura surrounding the figures.

Surrealist. An illustration of a person lying on a bed, with a sad face and pleading eyes. Two ghostly voices can be seen coming out of their mouth: a young woman's voice seeking comfort, and a young man's voice asking if he can escape. Meanwhile, an old age figure is uncertain, and alarms the scene.

241-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
241-001.poem: As If a Phantom Caress’d Me
241-001.text: As if a phantom caress’d me,I thought I was not alone walking here by the shore;But the one I thought was with me as now I walk by the shore, theone I loved that caress’d me,As I lean and look through the glimmering light, that one hasutterly disappear’d.And those appear that are hateful to me and mock me.
caption: Using an impressionistic style, the painting shows a figure walking along a beach at sunset. The figure is surrounded by a warm glow and appears to be happy and content, as if accompanied by a loved one. However, as the figure looks out to sea, the warm glow disappears, and the figure is left alone, surrounded by mocking and hateful figures.

Surrealistic. A figure walks alone by the shore with arms open, as if embracing someone or something that is not there. The background is blurry and distorted as hateful and mocking figures appear in the foreground.

242-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
242-001.text: I need no assurances, I am a man who is preoccupied of his own soul;I do not doubt that from under the feet and beside the hands andface I am cognizant of, are now looking faces I am not cognizantof, calm and actual faces,I do not doubt but the majesty and beauty of the world are latent inany iota of the world,I do not doubt I am limitless, and that the universes are limitless,in vain I try to think how limitless,I do not doubt that the orbs and the systems of orbs play theirswift sports through the air on purpose, and that I shall one daybe eligible to do as much as they, and more than they,I do not doubt that temporary affairs keep on and on millions of years,I do not doubt interiors have their interiors, and exteriors havetheir exteriors, and that the eyesight has another eyesight, andthe hearing another hearing, and the voice another voice,I do not doubt that the passionately-wept deaths of young men areprovided for, and that the deaths of young women and thedeaths of little children are provided for,(Did you think Life was so well provided for, and Death, the purportof all Life, is not well provided for?)I do not doubt that wrecks at sea, no matter what the horrors ofthem, no matter whose wife, child, husband, father, lover, hasgone down, are provided for, to the minutest points,I do not doubt that whatever can possibly happen anywhere at anytime, is provided for in the inherences of things,I do not think Life provides for all and for Time and Space, but Ibelieve Heavenly Death provides for all.
caption: The visual style is surrealism. The picture is a close-up of a person deep in thought, surrounded by a universe filled with orbs and planets. The person is reaching out and interacting with the orbs, suggesting an ability to transcend space and time. The universe is infinite, and there are many layers of existence, with each layer having its own unique perspective and senses. The picture also includes images of death, such as wrecks at sea, but suggests that even these are a part of the greater design, and that Heavenly Death will ultimately provide for all.

Surrealistic. An intricate mosaic of faces, perspectives, and worlds intercrossed. Different systems and patterns, each with their own understanding of death and life, interwoven into the fabric of existence. An inextricable tapestry of endlessness and magnificence.

243-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
243-001.text: Quicksand years that whirl me I know not whither,Your schemes, politics, fail, lines give way, substances mock and elude me,Only the theme I sing, the great and strong-possess’d soul, eludes not,One’s-self must never give way--that is the final substance--thatout of all is sure,Out of politics, triumphs, battles, life, what at last finally remains?When shows break up what but One’s-Self is sure?
caption: A surrealistic painting with a figure sinking in quicksand with clock hands, paper bills, and broken pencils swirling around. The surroundings are desolate with remnants of broken dreams scattered around. However, in the center of the painting, a bright and powerful soul, portrayed as a glowing orb, shines through the darkness, representing the unwavering nature of the great and strong-possessed soul.
Surrealism. A person is sinking in quicksand, with distorted scenery around them. Only their soul, shown as a strong and defiant figure, remains intact and unyielding amidst the chaos.

244-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
244-001.text: That music always round me, unceasing, unbeginning, yet longuntaught I did not hear,But now the chorus I hear and am elated,A tenor, strong, ascending with power and health, with glad notes ofdaybreak I hear,A soprano at intervals sailing buoyantly over the tops of immense waves,A transparent base shuddering lusciously under and through the universe,The triumphant tutti, the funeral wailings with sweet flutes andviolins, all these I fill myself with,I hear not the volumes of sound merely, I am moved by the exquisitemeanings,I listen to the different voices winding in and out, striving,contending with fiery vehemence to excel each other in emotion;I do not think the performers know themselves--but now I thinkbegin to know them.
caption: Style: Surrealist. A painting with vivid colors and complex shapes depict a cascading series of musical notes swirling around a faceless figure. The notes represent different voices and singing styles, including a strong tenor and buoyant soprano, all fighting to be heard. The painting also shows a transparent bass line that vibrates and moves throughout the universe. As the notes collide and meld together, the figure absorbs the exquisite meanings of the music and begins to understand each performer on a deeper level, even as they struggle to excel in emotion.

This picture is a vibrant explosion of colors and sounds, depicting the beauty of a choir rehearsal. Each melodic voice blending perfectly into one another, creating an electrifying atmosphere that is both invigorating and emotionally stirring, each note carrying a different meaning that can only be understood through hearing it.

245-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
245-001.text: What ship puzzled at sea, cons for the true reckoning?Or coming in, to avoid the bars and follow the channel a perfectpilot needs?Here, sailor! here, ship! take aboard the most perfect pilot,Whom, in a little boat, putting off and rowing, I hailing you offer.
caption: The visual style for this picture could be an illustrated nautical scene. There is a large ship struggling at sea, with puzzled sailors looking out into the distance. In the foreground, there is a small boat with a perfect pilot rowing towards the big ship. The waves are choppy, and there may be rocks and reefs in the background to indicate the danger of navigating these rough waters. The scene captures the moment where the perfect pilot is hailing the sailors to take aboard, ensuring a safe passage.
Realistic drawing. A ship lost at sea trying to navigate through rough waters. A small boat with a pilot approaching the ship, offering their help to guide them through the difficult journey.

246-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
246-001.text: A noiseless patient spider,I mark’d where on a little promontory it stood isolated,Mark’d how to explore the vacant vast surrounding,It launch’d forth filament, filament, filament out of itself,Ever unreeling them, ever tirelessly speeding them.
caption: The visual style is impressionism. A spider, sitting alone on a small rock, casting out thread after thread into the vast surrounding space. The spider remains patient and persistent as it tirelessly continues to weave. The image captures the feeling of isolation and the determination to explore beyond the immediate surroundings.

In a black and white photograph, a spider stands motionless on a small rock formation over a dark and vast space. From its body, it continuously releases lifelines, which stretch endlessly into the nothingness.

246-002.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
246-002.text: And you O my soul where you stand,Surrounded, detached, in measureless oceans of space,Ceaselessly musing, venturing, throwing, seeking the spheres toconnect them,Till the bridge you will need be form’d, till the ductile anchor hold,Till the gossamer thread you fling catch somewhere, O my soul.
caption: Surrealist style. An ethereal, translucent figure of a soul levitates in seemingly infinite voids of space. The soul is deep in thought, contemplating its place in the universe. The soul is reaching out towards other spheres in search of connection. A thin thread is making its way through the abyss, serving as the only connection point for the soul.
The picture is set in outer space with a small figure in the center. The figure is deep in thought, reaching out, trying to connect with its environment, looking for something solid to anchor to.

247-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
247-001.text: O living always, always dying!O the burials of me past and present,O me while I stride ahead, material, visible, imperious as ever;O me, what I was for years, now dead, (I lament not, I am content;)O to disengage myself from those corpses of me, which I turn andlook at where I cast them,To pass on, (O living! always living!) and leave the corpses behind.
caption: The visual style is surrealist. The picture is a person made up of different pieces - half of the body is luminous and alive, while the other half of the body is dark, decrepit, and decaying, representing the past. The person is walking forward with a determined and grandiose stride, confidently leaving the dead parts of themselves behind.

In a surreal and abstract style, an individual can be seen walking along a path, with parts of their past selves fading away as soon as they have stepped beyond them. The figure looks ahead with determination, while the remnants of their past selves remain behind them like ghostly apparitions.

248-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
248-001.text: From all the rest I single out you, having a message for you,You are to die--let others tell you what they please, I cannot prevaricate,I am exact and merciless, but I love you--there is no escape for you.
caption: The visual style of this picture would be eerie and ominous. It would be a depiction of a shadowy figure pointing directly at the viewer. The background would be dark with faint images representing people and the shadow figure would be illuminated revealing a sinister smile.
Film noir. In a dark alleyway, a couple stands. The male is signaling to the female to step away. She is distressed as she realizes this will be the end for her, and there is no escape.

248-002.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
248-002.text: Softly I lay my right hand upon you, you ’ust feel it,I do not argue, I bend my head close and half envelop it,I sit quietly by, I remain faithful,I am more than nurse, more than parent or neighbor,I absolve you from all except yourself spiritual bodily, that iseternal, you yourself will surely escape,The corpse you will leave will be but excrementitious.
caption: The visual style is impressionism. The picture is of a hand gently touching a person's forehead. The person is lying down comfortably. The background is fuzzy and abstract. The hand symbolizes support, absolution, and spiritual guidance being received by the person.
The photograph is shot in a dark bedroom with a person lying on the bed. A person's right hand softly placed over the other person's hand.

248-003.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
248-003.text: The sun bursts through in unlooked-for directions,Strong thoughts fill you and confidence, you smile,You forget you are sick, as I forget you are sick,You do not see the medicines, you do not mind the weeping friends,I am with you,I exclude others from you, there is nothing to be commiserated,I do not commiserate, I congratulate you.
caption: The visual style could be impressionistic. The image depicts a person basked in sunlight with an ethereal ambience. The person wears a small smile and exudes confidence as they stand amidst a blurry background, losing themselves to the moment. A joyous air exists, leaving little sight of the medicine brought to them by weeping friends. Their bed is aglow, and a friend by their side, congratulating them instead of commiserating over their sickness.

The picture is like a dreamy landscape, the sun rays break through with the soft tones of the end of the day. There is a person in the foreground that is radiantly happy, with their head up towards the sun. The person seems to forget any worries or pain they have, and there is no one else around to interfere with this moment.

249-001.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
249-001.text: Night on the prairies,The supper is over, the fire on the ground burns low,The wearied emigrants sleep, wrapt in their blankets;I walk by myself--I stand and look at the stars, which I think nownever realized before.
caption:
Visual Style: Realism.

The image shows a vast prairie landscape at night, with a campfire in the middle of the scene illuminating the foreground. A group of tired travelers are seen wrapped in their blankets sleeping around the fire. In the distance, a lone figure (presumably the speaker) can be seen walking and standing, gazing above at the radiant stars, with an expression of wonder on their face.

A painting in Impressionist style showing a dark prairie scene with a campfire in the center. The emigrants are sleeping, covered with blankets while a solitary figure stands looking up at the starry sky.

249-002.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
249-002.text: Now I absorb immortality and peace,I admire death and test propositions.
caption: Surrealistic style. The picture is dark and gloomy, with the protagonist standing amidst thick mist. On one side of the protagonist, there is a bright glowing door with a 'Life' signboard, and on the other side, there is another door. This door is black with a 'Death' signboard. The protagonist is standing in the middle, looking intently at both doors.

Abstract expressionist. The painting shows an explosion of color with a central focal point of pale blue and dark purple. The colors spread outward like an aura, and the brushstrokes mirror the movement of an explosion.

249-003.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
249-003.text: How plenteous! how spiritual! how resume!The same old man and soul--the same old aspirations, and the same content.
caption: In simplistic cubism, two figures are depicted, one elderly man and one ethereal soul. Both have a serene, content expression on their face as they float through a cloud-like landscape. The soul and man are intertwined and appear to share the same aspirations in harmonious unity.
A photograph taken in sepia tones, with an elderly person gazing into the distance--showing the wisdom of age and a life that has been fulfilled in every sense.

249-004.book: BOOK XXX.  WHISPERS OF HEAVENLY DEATH
249-004.text: I was thinking the day most splendid till I saw what the not-day exhibited,I was thinking this globe enough till there sprang out so noiselessaround me myriads of other globes.
