A serene and somber photograph in black and white, capturing America bowing its head in mourning with a peaceful and humbled expression on its face. The mood is reflective and contemplative as it remembers those lost and reflects on the weight of the past.

373-005.text: War, death, cataclysm like this, America,Take deep to thy proud prosperous heart.
caption: Abstract expressionism style. Bright red and black colors fill the canvas to depict chaos, war and destruction. In the midst of the turbulence, a faint outline of a heart can be seen. It symbolizes America taking in the devastation and holding it near to its proud, prosperous heart.

This picture is done in a apocalyptic post-modern style. The scene shows the United States of America grappling with pain, destruction, and chaos but still, it stands tall and resolute - with a sense of steadfast, defiant pride.

373-006.text: E’en as I chant, lo! out of death, and out of ooze and slime,The blossoms rapidly blooming, sympathy, help, love,From West and East, from South and North and over sea,Its hot-spurr’d hearts and hands humanity to human aid moves on;And from within a thought and lesson yet.
caption: Surrealist. A tree with branches that resemble human hands sprouting vibrant flowers in every color of the rainbow amidst a backdrop of a murky swamp. In the distance, a golden sun sets over jagged mountains.

The art style is impressionism. A person singing with bright and colorful flowers rapidly blooming from the ground, symbolizing sympathy, help, and love. People from all over the world gathering together with hot-spurred hearts and hands to move humanity towards the aid of others.

373-007.text: Thou ever-darting Globe! through Space and Air!Thou waters that encompass us!Thou that in all the life and death of us, in action or in sleep!Thou laws invisible that permeate them and all,Thou that in all, and over all, and through and under all, incessant!Thou! thou! the vital, universal, giant force resistless, sleepless, calm,Holding Humanity as in thy open hand, as some ephemeral toy,How ill to e’er forget thee!
caption: In a surrealist style, a giant hand holds a small, ephemeral figure. The figure is made up of indistinct and blurred shapes representing humanity. Water and air swirl around the figure, as if the hand is holding him up in space. The hand is constructed out of invisible laws and regulations, adding a mystical element to the image.

Surrealistic style. A giant, omnipotent hand with the universe within its grasp - a human figure, water, Earth, and other celestial objects. The hand manifests itself in various forms, but it's always present, holding everything together.

373-008.text: For I too have forgotten,(Wrapt in these little potencies of progress, politics, culture,wealth, inventions, civilization,)Have lost my recognition of your silent ever-swaying power, yemighty, elemental throes,In which and upon which we float, and every one of us is buoy’d.
caption: Surrealistic. A cityscape with buildings made of puzzle pieces, representing progress, politics, culture, wealth, inventions, and civilization. The city is floating and swaying in the midst of a great stormy ocean. Lightning strikes a bright light amidst the chaos, representing a mighty, elemental force upon which the city floats. The people in the city look tiny and insignificant compared to the tremendous power of the elemental forces of nature.

In the style of abstract expressionism, a chaotic and colorful image that captures a multitude of elements, representing progress, politics, culture, wealth, inventions, and civilization, all intertwined and intertwined. Yet within the chaos, there is a silent, ever-swaying force, represented by powerful and elemental throes, which our buoyant, floating selves are suspended on.

374-001.text: For his o’erarching and last lesson the greybeard sufi,In the fresh scent of the morning in the open air,On the slope of a teeming Persian rose-garden,Under an ancient chestnut-tree wide spreading its branches,Spoke to the young priests and students.
caption: The visual style would be impressionistic. The scene depicts a group of young priests and students in a lush Persian rose-garden on a bright, sunny morning. The graybeard sufi stands before them, his arms outstretched as if in teaching. The ancient chestnut tree's wide-spread branches cast dappled shadows on the group.

The picture shows an elderly sufi giving a lesson to a group of young priests and students. The scene is set under a wide-spread ancient chestnut tree and in the midst of a Persian rose-garden with lush greenery in the background. The visual style is reminiscent of classical Persian art.

374-002.text: “Finally my children, to envelop each word, each part of the rest,Allah is all, all, all--immanent in every life and object,May-be at many and many-a-more removes--yet Allah, Allah, Allah is there.
caption: With an abstract, modern art style in mind, the picture depicts a colorful and vibrant scene. The center of the picture shows a large and ubiquitous being comprised of different colors, with its tentacles stretching out to touch every corner. Each corner represents a different object or life-form, but the being touches them all. The repetition of the word "Allah" is seen around the edges of the picture, almost like a border or frame.
Surrealism. The universe enclosed in a human hand's grip with divine light shining through the gaps between the fingers.

374-003.text: “Has the estray wander’d far? Is the reason-why strangely hidden?Would you sound below the restless ocean of the entire world?Would you know the dissatisfaction? the urge and spur of every life;The something never still’d--never entirely gone? the invisible needof every seed?
caption: Surrealism. An image of a vast and tumultuous ocean with a lonely, twisting strand of multicolored seaweed in the foreground. In the distance, a glimmer of light suggests that something is hidden within the darkness. A faint and insistent pulse seems to emanate from the image.

Surrealist. A figure with an outstretched hand standing in front of a tumultuous ocean, with various plants and animals positioned on their body, conveying the concept of searching for a hidden reason in every being's urge and desire to achieve something that can never be completely fulfilled.

374-004.text: “It is the central urge in every atom,(Often unconscious, often evil, downfallen,)To return to its divine source and origin, however distant,Latent the same in subject and in object, without one exception.”
caption: Surrealism. The painting depicts countless atoms floating in an abstract universe, with each atom yearning to return to its divine source. The atoms are shaped like small entities, with an unconscious and often evil nature, striving to escape their own downfall. The background is a vivid and colorful image of the universe. Each atom, including the subjects and objects, is seen as divine and has the same latent desire for a higher existence.
Abstract expressionism painting style. Swirling colors of darkness and light - an intense vortex of creation, destruction, and rebirth.

375-001.text: The commonplace I sing;How cheap is health! how cheap nobility!Abstinence, no falsehood, no gluttony, lust;The open air I sing, freedom, toleration,(Take here the mainest lesson--less from books--less from the schools,)The common day and night--the common earth and waters,Your farm--your work, trade, occupation,The democratic wisdom underneath, like solid ground for all.
caption: A hand-drawn sketch in ink and watercolor with a color palette of earth tones. In the background is an idyllic countryside with a small farm, a river, and a lush tree. In the foreground is a group of people of all ages engaged in simple tasks like farming, fishing, and crafting. They all have content expressions on their faces, and the air is filled with a sense of community and purpose. The drawing is an ode to simple, wholesome living and celebrating the common, everyday things that make life meaningful.
A monochromatic photograph with a landscape view of a field showing the daily activities of people, such as farming, fishing, and construction, with a theme of freedom, democracy, and simplicity.

376-001.text: The devilish and the dark, the dying and diseas’d,The countless (nineteen-twentieths) low and evil, crude and savage,The crazed, prisoners in jail, the horrible, rank, malignant,Venom and filth, serpents, the ravenous sharks, liars, the dissolute;(What is the part the wicked and the loathesome bear within earth’sorbic scheme?)Newts, crawling things in slime and mud, poisons,The barren soil, the evil men, the slag and hideous rot.
caption: The picture is grotesque and surreal, in a style reminiscent of the dark and macabre. The foreground is overrun by writhing, twisted forms of demonic creatures, prisoners in jail, and serpents. The air is thick with a nauseating fog of poison and filth, engulfing everything in its path. In the background, an apocalyptic landscape stretches out, a desolate and barren wasteland, with the rotting remains of evil men and crawling things in slime and mud.

Surrealism. A grim and unsettling image split into parts. On one side, dark and demonic figures filled with disease and decay. On the other, a barren and polluted landscape, filled with snakes, sharks, and crawling things festering in slime and muck. The middle, an image of a man standing in the midst of the chaos, pondering the part that evil and loathsome things play in the nature of the universe.

377-001.text: More experiences and sights, stranger, than you’d think for;Times again, now mostly just after sunrise or before sunset,Sometimes in spring, oftener in autumn, perfectly clear weather, inplain sight,Camps far or near, the crowded streets of cities and the shopfronts,(Account for it or not--credit or not--it is all true,And my mate there could tell you the like--we have often confab’dabout it,)People and scenes, animals, trees, colors and lines, plain as could be,Farms and dooryards of home, paths border’d with box, lilacs in corners,Weddings in churches, thanksgiving dinners, returns of long-absent sons,Glum funerals, the crape-veil’d mother and the daughters,Trials in courts, jury and judge, the accused in the box,Contestants, battles, crowds, bridges, wharves,Now and then mark’d faces of sorrow or joy,(I could pick them out this moment if I saw them again,)Show’d to me--just to the right in the sky-edge,Or plainly there to the left on the hill-tops.
caption: Hyperrealistic. A panoramic depiction of a bustling life filled with various experiences across different times of the day and seasons. Sunrise and sunsets bask over clear landscapes showcasing different parts of a city including busy streets filled with animal-packed carriages, a farmer's residence with flowers bordering the pathway, families celebrating wedding events and worthily participating in contests, participants facing a judge in a courthouse with sorrowful faces, and individuals atop hills expressing their joy. Every scene is vibrantly captured with vivid colors and intricate details which depicts both sorrow and happiness moments the city has to offer.

Realism. A wide panoramic photograph of various landscapes and scenes, taken at different times of day and year, varying from idyllic views of farms and dooryards, to bustling city streets with shopfronts, to solemn funeral processions, to bustling crowds at sporting events and demonstrations, to trials in courtrooms, and to mark'd faces of sorrow or joy.

378-001.text: Not to exclude or demarcate, or pick out evils from their formidablemasses (even to expose them,)But add, fuse, complete, extend--and celebrate the immortal and the good.Haughty this song, its words and scope,To span vast realms of space and time,Evolution--the cumulative--growths and generations.
caption: The picture is in a modern art style. A colorful blending of different shapes and forms. The image resembles a colorful cosmic explosion. The colors swirl and twirl together, blending and fusing until the scene is complete. The message is that goodness and immortality are being celebrated in the midst of an expanding universe.

The picture shows a vast landscape with a limitless horizon, extending into the sky. The colors are bright and very warm. The vast landscape represents all of space and time, and the light represents the immortal and the good.

378-002.text: Begun in ripen’d youth and steadily pursued,Wandering, peering, dallying with all--war, peace, day and nightabsorbing,Never even for one brief hour abandoning my task,I end it here in sickness, poverty, and old age.
caption: The picture is done in a realist style. An old person staring directly at the viewer. The lines on their face show the hardships of a difficult life. Their eyes show wisdom cultivated from years of wandering and experiencing life. The background shows moments of war, peace, day, and night, represented by different landscapes. Despite sickness, poverty, and old age, the person has accomplished their life's work.

Documentary photography style. An old and sick individual sitting in front of a large cork board with photos, articles, and notes pinned to it. The board represents their pursuit in life, with imagery of war, peace, day, and night all represented. A sense of exhaustion and weariness is conveyed.

378-003.text: I sing of life, yet mind me well of death:To-day shadowy Death dogs my steps, my seated shape, and has for years--Draws sometimes close to me, as face to face.
caption: In a dramatic and ominous style, a person walking along a road with a dark and shadowy figure following them closely, almost as if they're being stalked. The background is set in black and white with dim lighting to emphasize the feeling of death.

The photo would be in black and white, with a person in a coat walking in the street with a dog. The person would be looking straight ahead with a distant gaze as if something is following them. The photo would convey a sense of unease and apprehension.

379-001.text: How dare one say it?After the cycles, poems, singers, plays,Vaunted Ionia’s, India’s--Homer, Shakspere--the long, long times’thick dotted roads, areas,The shining clusters and the Milky Ways of stars--Nature’s pulses reap’d,All retrospective passions, heroes, war, love, adoration,All ages’ plummets dropt to their utmost depths,All human lives, throats, wishes, brains--all experiences’ utterance;After the countless songs, or long or short, all tongues, all lands,Still something not yet told in poesy’s voice or print--something lacking,(Who knows? the best yet unexpress’d and lacking.)
caption: The style is abstract-expressionism. A painting of an infinite galaxy with bright and bold colors. The colors represent the cycles of poems, singers, plays, vaunted Ionia's, India's, Homer, Shakspere, retrospective passions, heroes, war, love, adoration, and all ages' plummets. Despite all these countless songs, tongues, and all human experiences, something is still missing - the best yet unexpressed and lacking.

The artwork is a grand, panoramic display of the universe through time and space. It shows ancient civilizations, famous figures, wars, and passions all over a backdrop of stars, galaxies, and star clusters. However, there is an inherent feeling of incompleteness, as if something important is still missing.

380-001.text: Grand is the seen, the light, to me--grand are the sky and stars,Grand is the earth, and grand are lasting time and space,And grand their laws, so multiform, puzzling, evolutionary;But grander far the unseen soul of me, comprehending, endowing all those,Lighting the light, the sky and stars, delving the earth, sailingthe sea,(What were all those, indeed, without thee, unseen soul? of whatamount without thee?)More evolutionary, vast, puzzling, O my soul!More multiform far--more lasting thou than they.
caption: The picture would show a galaxy of stars and planets. The camera would then zoom out to show the entire universe, with a vast expanse of space and time. Suddenly, a burst of light appears in the center, emanating from the unseen soul. The burst of light illuminates all the galaxies while delving the earth and sailing the sea. The visual style would be a cosmic or celestial theme, where different elements are in constant motion.

This photograph is full of grandeur and mystery, with a vast sky and stars above and a sprawling earth below. But even more awe-inspiring is the invisible presence of the soul, which provides meaning and purpose to all things, both seen and unseen. Using the style of abstract fine art photography, it depicts the soul as a glowing, ethereal force, surrounded by vibrant hues and textures that hint at the unfathomable depth and complexity of the human spirit.

381-001.text: Unseen buds, infinite, hidden well,Under the snow and ice, under the darkness, in every square or cubic inch,Germinal, exquisite, in delicate lace, microscopic, unborn,Like babes in wombs, latent, folded, compact, sleeping;Billions of billions, and trillions of trillions of them waiting,(On earth and in the sea--the universe--the stars there in theheavens,)Urging slowly, surely forward, forming endless,And waiting ever more, forever more behind.
caption: Surrealism. The picture is split in half diagonally, with a bright and warm sky above and a dark, snowy ground below. The bottom half is covered in a blanket of snow with a few green sprouts peeking through. The top half is filled with small, intricate and beautiful shapes in delicate lace, representing the infinitesimal unseen buds that are waiting to grow. In the distance, there are shadows of sea creatures and distant celestial bodies, hinting at the vastness of the universe.

Macro and surreal photography. An upside-down view of ice and snow with various microscopic, delicate, and lace-like formations underneath, resembling unborn babies in wombs. The formations appear to be innumerable and waiting to slowly evolve and push forward.

382-001.text: Good-bye my Fancy!Farewell dear mate, dear love!I’m going away, I know not where,Or to what fortune, or whether I may ever see you again,So Good-bye my Fancy.
caption: In the style of impressionism, a blurred figure in shades of blue and purple carries a suitcase on their shoulders, with their back turned away from the viewer. Behind them, a hazy landscape of green hills and a pinkish-orange sky suggests a sunset. A smaller, blurry figure in the distance waves goodbye, but the main figure seems uncertain and contemplative about what their future may hold.
The image shows a person walking away towards the horizon with their back turned, and a figure of a heart left behind, grasped by a hand. The overall style is melancholic and dream-like.

382-002.text: Now for my last--let me look back a moment;The slower fainter ticking of the clock is in me,Exit, nightfall, and soon the heart-thud stopping.
caption: Surrealist. A dark scene with a giant clock face in the background, with a dimmer ticking sound emanating from it. In the foreground, a person's back is facing the clock, and their body is slowly fading away. The dimming of the person's body shows that nightfall has come, and their life is about to end.
The scene is dark and ominous with a faint clock in the background. The last light of dusk is casting shadows on the scene, and a heart monitor is flatlining. The overall style is chiaroscuro.

382-003.text: Long have we lived, joy’d, caress’d together;Delightful!--now separation--Good-bye my Fancy.
caption: The visual style is impressionistic. Two figures are depicted in a warm embrace, surrounded by a bright yellow light that evokes a sense of joy and companionship. Their posture suggests they have been together for a long time and have enjoyed each other's company. However, a subtle shift is taking place as the embrace loosens and one of the figures begins to pull away. Their melancholic expression and drooping shoulders signify that they are bidding farewell, while the other figure looks on with a wistful gaze, saying their final goodbyes to their beloved "Fancy".
Surrealistic. An image of two people holding hands on a floating island, surrounded by vibrant colors and patterns. One of them is waving goodbye while the other looks on longingly.

382-004.text: Yet let me not be too hasty,Long indeed have we lived, slept, filter’d, become really blendedinto one;Then if we die we die together, (yes, we’ll remain one,)If we go anywhere we’ll go together to meet what happens,May-be we’ll be better off and blither, and learn something,May-be it is yourself now really ushering me to the true songs, (whoknows?)May-be it is you the mortal knob really undoing, turning--so now finally,Good-bye--and hail! my Fancy.
caption: The visual style is impressionism. The picture shows two figures sleeping, overlapping into one another, as if they are blending together. They are surrounded by a dreamy atmosphere. In the background, there is a blurry image of an open sky. The colors are muted and hazy. One figure looks like they are fading away and the other looks like they are being pulled. There is a sense of longing and inevitability in the image.

The visual style for this image would be surrealism. The image shows two people joined together, sleeping and blending into each other. The background is a dreamy landscape that's hard to decipher, representing their uncertain future. One person is seen ushering the other, while turning the knob that separates them. The image ends with a goodbye and a welcoming hail to the imagination.
